text: I cant believe shit tastes this good! Strong coffee smell, chocolate bitter sweetness,a hint of mint/peppermint. This is one complex and great tasting beer!

Bottle. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate and a hint of vanilla. The taste was similar to the aroma with more coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits and a touch of hops. Very good.

Bottle from Red: Wine, Beer & Spirits in Clarksville
Aroma: coffee, roasty, licorice, chocolate
Appearance: black with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Fantastic
Dark brown, almost black with small brown head. Aroma of cocoa with some spicy notes. Medium strong bitterness, some sourness, vanilla sweetness. Vanilla and chocolate notes, some spiceness.

Bottle from Boxbeers. Just by taking the cap off a lovely aroma came into the room! Pitch black, foamy beigebrown head. Aroma is coffe, chocolate, liquorice, a bit of soy, nice aroma. Medium sweet, bitter. Nice full body, really oily and creamy texture. Amazing beer.
Zaległe - ocena przepisana z untappd w ramach uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer. z tego co pamietam piękne piwko nie beczkowe.

Can. Pours black. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roast malt and vanilla. Taste is moderate sweet with roast bitterness. A bit thinner than expected. Certainly very good but a little disappointing considering the high ratings.

Very dark pour. Big espresso head. Some lacing. Aroma of rich dark coffee. Mouth is super chewy and heavy. Alcohol is well hidden. Taste is very balanced. Finishes like a cup of coffee. Very very tasty.
330ml can share thanks to Wingman. Almost black colour with thin tan head. Nose is red wine dark chocolate dark malts. Tastes of dark malts chocolate cocoa red wine. Meaty beast

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 Bottle from BeerLovers Vienna chugged in the park. Pours jet black with off white head. Aroma is coffee, molasses, chocolate, hazlenut,  vanilla and coconut. Taste is treacle, chocolate, boozy dried fruits, coffee and a boozy burn that fades away leaving a lovely aftertaste. Nice carbonation. Great stuff
Ciemne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana dosyć szybko opada. Kawa, czekolada, goryczka nie jest zbyt wysoka. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.

330 ml bottle bought at IC Beer in Kwun Tong.
Looks: Opaque deep Cola blackish brown colour with a thin crust of yeast sediments; Less than one-quarter finger head with residual soapy beige foam which fades in 15 seconds; Poor sticky lacing with zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet dark malt, with strong roastyness, hazelnuts, strong cream, strong coffee liquor, strong liquorices, strong caramel, sticky toffee, plums, floral, sugar, spices, toast and grass.

Taste: Strong sweet dark malt, with strong roastyness, strong black coffee, chocolate, strong alcohol and liquorices, strong caramel and sticky toffee, red fruits, strong cream, floral, syrup, spices, strong herbs, light biscuits, lemon, strong bitter hops and sharp grass. 

Body: Medium body; Oily palate.

Mouth Feel: Strong dark maltyness in a pretty viscous background. Roasty with very clear sharp black coffee, followed by strong cream and heavy sugary sweetness. Strong booze with very strong caramel, toffee and chocolate, with quite abundant red fruits and floral. Very strong herbs with dry bread and lemon to round. Very intense but off-balanced!

Alcohol: the 10.9% abv is naked, screams loudly with lots of liquorices bitterness to go with the syrups. Not exactly cloying but it deters me from getting a full mouthful. Seems to be at odds with the hops and dark malt. Strong but not tasty. 

Hoppiness: floral, spices, and grass in nose. Floral, spices, strong herbs, lemon and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness - hops and liquorices - is strong for a lasting, high astringent sweet-bitter malty finish.

After taste: Fairly dry. Sweet, boozy and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one has a very strong creaminess - perhaps an attribute from civet coffee - which should have make it a pleasant tasting experience, but it was heavily affected by screaming booze and heavy sweetness, in the absence of any strong burnt toast or distinguish dark maltyness. Hoppiness is quite decent but couldnt turn the sweet boozy tide. Not a train wreck but unbalanced. Too strong but going nowhere. I understand that most of its high scores happened when it was contract-brewed by Nøgne Ø, but mine was brewed by Levrig, so I wonder if thats the difference in opinion. Anyhow, better stick with Beer Geek Breakfast instead.

Kolor czarny, beżowa, szybko opadająca piana. W aromacie świeżo zmielona kawa, mleczna czekolada. W smaku kawowo, czekoladowo, delikatna goryczka kontrowana subtelną słodyczą. Spoko piwo, takie jak lubię, ale piłem lepsze risy, które nie znajdują się w top 50 :).
Bottle. Black with nice brown head. Full bodied. Taste of coffee and chocolate

Bottle bf 19.05.25. Pours black, minimal head. Strong coffee, cocoa, dark fruits, alcohol, woody, roasty, biscuits. Strong roasty bitterness, some sweetness. Full bodied, oily, average carbonation, little alcoholic. Should be better after some time.
Tap @HBF17. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma has cocoa and coffee. Taste has caramel, coffee and chocolate. Really nice.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, brązowa, sycząca piana, która po chwili znika. Na powierzchni unoszą się drobiny (kawy?). W aromacie słodko, masa czekolady, podchodzi pod praliny, troszkę dalej kawa. W smaku bardzo jednowymiarowo, dużo słodyczy i kawowej kwaśności, kontrowane dość zalegającą goryczką. Piwo, po którym spodziewałem się wiele i niestety się zawiodłem.
Black colour with beige foam. Aroma and taste of chocolate, espresso and dark malt.

Kolor: Czarny, nieprzejrzyste.
Piana: Sycząca, brązowa, szybko znika do zera.
Zapach: Dużo kawy, czekolada, wiśnie w likierze. Pachnie świetnie.
Smak: Gęste, cierpkawe na wstępie. Wysoka słodycz, dużo mocnej kawy, gorzkiej czekolady. Kawowy posmak.
Wysycenie: Specyficzna etykieta, niedokładny skład.
Opakowanie: Specyficzna etykieta, brak składu. 
Uwagi: Warka 13.05.26 Trochę inne niż zapamiętałem z kranu, nie zrobiło na mnie takiego wrażenia jak wtedy. Tak czy inaczej bardzo dobre.
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a snifter. Pours black with tiny khaki head. Big coffee flavor with a nice chocolate profile.

Pitch black pour with minimal, non-dense, quickly vanishing espresso head. Tons of coffee and roasted malts in the nose. Alcohol and oats are also there. The taste is lightly sweet with a discrete salty character towards the end. Notes of coffee liquor-like alcohol, licorice and soy sauce. Silky, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation, full bodied. Lingering malty aftertaste. Very good.
Pekzwarte kleur met minieme grijze schuimkraag. Geur is koffie met een tikkeltje melk. Smaak is sterke koffie met een tikkeltje melk. Op het einde komt het bittere aspect van koffie sterk naar boven.
Black, minimal head. in aroma coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Sweet, full body, very good taste of coffee. Really nice stout.

330ml bottle from Elizabeth Station. BB 2026-05-13. Pours an almost black with a brown head. Aroma is coffee, liquorice, some chocolate and dark fruits notes. Taste is sweet, roasted coffee. Good stuff.
No matter where the coffee in this beer originated, this stuff is the sh##! Amazingly loaded with coffee and coco this brew will not disappoint.
Heerlijke chocolade en koffie. Perfect vol mondgevoel. Licht geroosterde afdronk. Absoluut heerlijk! Mijn stout

330 ml bottle into snifter, bottled on 5/13/2016. Pours pitch black color with a small dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, nutty dark roasted coffee, caramel, toffee, toasted oats, dark bread, marshmallow, and molasses; with lighter notes of vanilla, cream, smoke, dark fruit, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of huge dark chocolate, cocoa, nutty dark roasted coffee, caramel, toffee, toasted oats, dark bread, marshmallow, and molasses; with lighter notes of vanilla, cream, smoke, dark fruit, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/woody hop and roast malt/coffee bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, nutty dark roasted coffee, caramel, toffee, toasted oats, dark bread, marshmallow, molasses, light vanilla/dark fruit, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Light dryness from roast/hop bitterness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and fairly full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Minimal warming alcohol for 10.9%. Overall this is an incredible imperial coffee oatmeal stout! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. Very unique/intense on coffee complexity and awesome balance with the base oatmeal stout. A highly enjoyable offering.

Kicsi gyorsan olvadó, barna hab, fekete szín. Illata nagyon finom, csokis, kakaós, aszalt gyümölcsös, enyhén kávés. Édeskés, csokis, kakaóporos, kávés ízvilág markáns hordós és aszalt gyümölcsös aromákkal. Testes, közepesen keserű, enyhén szénsavas, némi alkoholos beütéssel. Minden ízkomponens erőteljesen jelen van, egy sok is a jóból. Ettől függetlenül nagyon finom, jó arányokkal rendelkező sör.

Small brown head quickly dissapearing. Aroma is intensive. Coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, roast, almonds, vanilla. Flavour is dominated by coffee. From behind we can taste chocolate, rum, almonds, caramel, some licorice notes. Medium-high body. Soft carbonaton. Bitter is appropriate, comes from hop. Alcohol perfectly hidden. Very nice Imperial Stout.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 Bogactwo zajebistości jakie niosą ze sobą ciemne słody, kakao, czekolada, bardzo dużo intensywnej kawy, espresso i pralinek czekoladowych, słodki zapach, miły. Prezentuje się niesamowicie - nieprzejrzysta czerń i obfita, o ultra drobnych ziarenkach beżowa piana, która potem całkowicie znika. W smaku bardzo intensywnie, bo wystarczy malutki łyczek by rozlała się wszędzie w ustach kawa, gorzka czekolada, kakao. Kawa tu temat przewodni i jest jej naprawdę wiele, posmak jest bardzo długi, zdecydowanie nie #TEAM_słodyczka bo czekoladowo-kawowa goryczka odkłada się na długo po pierwszym łyku - ale piwo wcale nie zniechęca do kolejnego łyku. Pod koniec wychodzi likier kawowy i pralinki kawowe. Bardzo dobre piwo o intensywnym smaku i aromacie, pełne, oleiste. Alkohol raczej z tych szlachetnych, rozgrzewający, jak w cukierkach z brandy.

Poured from the tap. Black with tan head. Excellent balance of roast malt and sweet chocolate, very subtle citrus. Nothing overpowers, mild alcohol thats mostly hidden. Nice warming finish that lingers perfectly.

Pours black with light brown head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, sugar, cocoa, milk chocolate, cream, caramel, some chocolate cake, biscuit. Taste is caramel, chocolate, cream, liquid sugar, a lot of coffee, dark roasted beans, some milk, orange peel, dark chocolate again, rum, barrel. A lot of different tastes. Very very good beer!

Bottle shared at home. Black with short lasting dark tan head. Big sweet deep roasted chocolate malts, massive coffee, dark fruit, floral notes, roasted almond, general nuttiness, ash, alcohol. Big sweet and over medium bitter. Big bodied with over average fizzy carbonation for the style. Big syruppy and stick texture and powerful dense aromas. Nice!

Flaske kjøpt på Vinmonopolet Nerstranda. Aroma lakris, sjokolade, malt. Utseende sort med lett beige skum. Smak lakris, sjokolade, mokka, noe kaffe i ettersmaken. dette er en fyldig og kraftig øl med med mye smak

Bottle. Pitch black with a quickly fading dark brown bubbly head. Aroma is of rich dark chocolate, dark fruits, plums, berries, coffee, treacle. Taste is of dark chocolate, treacle, caramel, coffee, plums, sweet rum like finish. Sticky syrupy mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

Bottle at home (bb 13/05/26). Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has lots of coffee, dark chocolate, oatmeal, roasted malts, vanilla, quite some alcohol, unfortunately a hint of green apple as well. Taste is moderate to heavy bitter, light to moderate sweet, creamy full mouthfeel, long bitter roasted coffee aftertaste. Very nice, too bad for that hint of green apple, need to try this again.

Black, steady brownish head, nice lacing. Aroma: at the beginning fresh coffee, after while cocoa, vanilla, caramel. Full body, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness. Very sweet, but also lot of black malts in opposition. Great balance. Flavour: again cocoa and vanilla, date, malty hay. Great aftertaste - fresh coffee which doesnt dominate whole flavour - it appears only in the end. Overall great balance, very rich flavour.
Helt svart med fint brunt skum. Kaffe, lakris, sjokolade, lær og vanilje i duften. Ristede kaffebønner, lakris og en vanijesmak som henger i lenge. God bitterhet. Konge!

Aroma: chocolate, coffee, some fruity notes(probably from coffee), roasty, some nuts
Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, chcolate, coffee, roasty, fruity, caramel
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 A lot of coffee, chocolate and some vanilla (in my unit I recognised some plums). Great example of oatmeal stout.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Wygląd: Czarne, beżowa drobnopęcherzykowa piana, skromna, ale zostaje jej trochę na szkle.
Aromat: Dużo kawy (nie jest to taka typowa kawa z palonych słodów, ale też nie do końca kopi luwak, wszystko się tu miesza), kakao, gorzka czekolada, słody palone, likier kawowy, w tle słodki akcent wpadający w ciemne owoce (może suszona śliwka), i jeszcze trochę kawy, po ogrzaniu więcej słodyczy i tego deserowego alkholu.
Smak: Dużo kwaskowej kawy, dalej kakao, likier czekoladowo-kawowy, bombonierkowe czekoladki z alkoholem. Jest słodko, goryczka średnia, głównie palona, chmiel w tle, mogłaby mocniej kontrować. W ustach dość gęste, lepiące. Jedno z najlepszych piw, jakie miałem okazję pić.

Aromas of dark chocolate, oatmeal, brown sugar, and cold pressed coffee. Taste is dark chocolate and dark fruits, oatmeal, brown sugar, charred roasted malts and espresso coffee. Some grassy hops in the finish and after taste.

Smells chocolate. Dark brown little head, liquid almost black. Taste is dark chocolate, bit of cinnamon and cardamon. Then coffee kicks in, but its mild and deep, medium roast. Quite drinkable but requires some time for a full bottle. Alcohol very well hidden. Very good overall. Would drink again.
0,33l bottle. Aroma of strong and roasted black coffee with some hops and licorice on the background. Taste is strong and intense black coffee with faint liquorice and burnt caramel. Awesome!

Pitch black, weak offish head. Smell is espresso tiramisu with alcohol presence, raisins, chocolate and raw nuts. Milk, tia maria. Subtle vanilla.
Taste is oily bitter, with subtle sweetness. Dry finish with light astringency. Quite strong, coffee and pure chocolate.
Oily feel, full body, long finish. Aromas of chocolate and coffee, a little alcohol, vanilla. Black color , brown foam.

Canned on 11/17/16. 12 oz. Pours dark brown & sits pitch black in the glass; gigantic brown head. Plenty of coffee aromas up front followed by some sweet cocoa. The coffee taste is present from start to finish but shines mostly in the middle of the mouth. Arrives chocolaty and rich with bready malts. Finishes with caramel/brown sugar along with a bit of hops as well. Alcohol is so well hidden that it only shows up at the very back of the palate. Warms up to allow more chocolate thru. Incredibly thick, chewy mouthfeel (near milkshake), medium-low carbonation, finishes dry with the coffee & booze. Lacking in the nose but overall has balanced flavors.

330ml bottle. Black with brown head. Aroma is islay whisky, wood, chocolate, light malts, light coffee and alcohol. Taste is roasted malts, islay whisky, salty see breeze, wood, dark chocolate, coffee, dried dark fruits and warming alcohol. Filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and rich peated, woody, malty aftertaste with warming booziness.

Bottle. Been sitting on this one a while. Pours black into a snifter. Minimal head. Roast, coffee, cherry, dried fruit in the nose. First taste is roasty malt and coffee, some bourbon, a bit of alcohol burn, then mellows out to dark fruit, coffee, cocoa, and a hint of oaky vanilla. Super low carbonation. Smooth and slick mouthfeel. Tasty.
Shared bottle at oldbuttiken in Copenahgen. This is too much? never is too much in a beer. great!

Bottle 2014 vintage to snifter. Pours black with minimal beige head. Sticks to the tongue and glass. Very tight persistence carbonation only when disturbed. Nose is sweet, burnt roast, & faint coffee. A little sweetness in there but the bitter coffee dominates the palate. Intense bitter finish. Nice mouthfeel. I can see what all the fuss is about. Good stuff.
Bottle at home. Poured clear black with no head. Coffee, roast, chocolate, sweet cherries. Light sweet, light bitter. Delicious candy on the palate. Good

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a highly effervescent dark brown head. Aroma is liquorice, vanilla, molasses and coffee of course. Taste is fudge sweet, vanilla sweet, caramel and chocolate from the coffee, mildly roasty, oaky, hint of leather, cocoa powder. Pretty deep and complex. Velvety mouthfeel with a full body.
Thick, bitter coffee aroma. Very thick mouthfeel with nice balanced taste of malts and coffee. Some dark chocolate notes. Very well done. Bottle.
Poured deep black with a dense beige head. Aroma of bitter dark chocolate, coffee, roast malt. Full, oily body. Flavour as the aroma, very well balanced.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Jeden z najlepszych europejskich stoutów. Gęsty, kremowy, esencjonalny. Potężna czekolada i kawa w aromacie i smaku, słodkie, niezwykle zbalansowane. Pyszne.

Bottle from the 7-11 in Kittery, Maine. Lots of coffee upfront that leads into a strong fresh coffee flavor that lasts throughout the beer. The oatmeal is noticeable, adding a bit of sweetness and smoothing out the palate. Dry cocoa flavor at the end that finishes quickly, but in between I got a "general sweet malt" flavor more than anything else. Good, solid coffee stout thats definitely worth a try.

Pours a black colour, with a brown head, medium retention. Thin dotted lace.Aroma of chocolate, mocha, licorice, dried fruits, spices. Creamy palate, full body, carbonation is just enough, Taste is similar to the aroma: chocolate, mocha, red and dried fruits, spices. All that you want, A beast. Best Mikkeler Ive had.

Black. Full aroma and flavour, with roasted barley, salty liquorice, chocolate, coffee, and hoppy spice. Rather sweet taste with a dry, spicy and malty bitter finish. Full body, smooth texture and low carbonation. Overall, a wonderful imperial stout. It is big, heavy, fat, very tasty, complex, and not cloying, despite the sweetness.

Pours almost black with beautiful creamy finely bubbled dark khaki head. Good lacing. Almost is mostly coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, cold brew coffee, chocolate milk, followed with some earthy roasted malt notes. Finishes off dry. Booze well hidden, reads almost as sweetness in the end. A smooth, rich, decadent coffee stout.
On tap at Mikkeller San Fransisco. This is everything Id ever thought a stout could be, velvet smooth and coffee but with out the bitter roasted flavours, I could happily drink this forever.

Bottle and tap - tasted this few times. Sensoric. Pitch black with medium, semi-thick, light brown head. Poor head retention and lacing. Strong roasted malts aroma, mainly fresh brewed coffee, but party some notes of wet, cold ground coffee beans. Simultaneously you can experience nice smooth cocoa nibs, vanilla and dried fruits (plums, raisins) aromas, along with pleasant toffee and caramel notes. Lightly boozy character in the background. No artificial flavor here, which is nice. Taste is semi-sweet in the beginning, but from the middle it becomes bitter and intensifies in the end. The bitterness stays constant and quite long after the last sip. Full body, creamy texture (some describe the as oily and thick, which is definitely not true), in the beginning lively carbonation, but later on rather soft, finish is semi-bitter, coffee, smooth and silk. Very nice palate Id say velvety. In general very balanced beer with perfectly combination of coffee, roasted malts and perfectly timing of all flavors. It starts as nearly sweet RIS and finishes as dry semi-bitter roasted imperial stout. The aftertaste is very long and despite high ABV content it is highly drinkable. But I think its a little bit overrated here.

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of strong coffee, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste follows the same with vanilla, dark fruits, some hops and licorice on the background. Full body, soft carbonation, long finish. Great stuff.

12 ounces bottle shared with brother. Aroma: strong roasted coffee, light caramel, woody, light licorice. App: dark brown, minimal mocha head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, liquoreux, light licorice, roasted finish. Overall: think Ive had it before. Really good even though I have a bad cold.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (direkt von Mikkeller). Mir fehlen die Worte... Kaffeelikör in der bierigsten Vollendung.
Bottle: pours dark black with thin tan head, aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, taste is a little sweet, dark chocolate, coffee, medium bodied, very smooth

This bottle is from Nogne 0. The aroma is malt, coffee, some chocolate, some bread. Pours almost black with light brown head, slightly lasting and excellent lacing. The taste is a light bitter. The body is medium to full, the texture very creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish long. Very Very Good!!!
Fat på All In Beer Fest, Göteborg. Smak och doft av kola, kaffe, toffee. Stor, tung, len och söt. I grunden en ganska "standard" stout, men riktigt bra! Helt klart en av festivalens bästa.
All In Beerfest 2016: Heavy aroma from coffee, licorice and roasted malt. Taste is huge coffee, slight salty licorice, thick body. Excellent stout.

Coffee, licorice, soy souce, chocolate in nose. Pours pitch black with tan quickly reducing foam. Taste is medium sweet nicely balanced between coffee, chocolate and licorice flavours. After warming praline, dried fruits and vanilla notes are appearing. Medium bitter finish, full to medium body. Overall outstanding Impy.

Very nice aroma of coffee, coffee cake, chocolate, a bit of vanilla, nuts, nice alcohol note. Later the alcohol note becomes a bit unpleasant, but still its very good overall.
Pretty sweet, low bitterness. 
Very thick, almost flat - i like that. a bit too much alcohol in taste
still, one of the top imp stouts ive had
Bottled at home, a 2014 one. Great aroma of coffee and oatmeal, taste really balanced, and smooth. A really great beer.

Very nice imp stout. sweet and bitter. Nice- good beer
chocolate, coffee, roasty, toast, basement aromas, vanilla, smoke, woody,

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 [Butelka]
Wygląd: Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, średnia brunatna piana
Aromat: Przepięknie czekoladowy, kawowy, praliny, delikatny, szlachetny alkohol w tle
Smak: Gładkie, aksamitne, czekoladowe, palone, znakomite.
Podsumowanie: Genialne, można chwalić godzinami

Nieprzejrzyście czarne, gęste, piana ciemno beżowa, z początku obfita, szybko jednak opada. W aromacie w pierwszej chwili atakuje kawa, po niej na scenę wchodzi czekolada, praliny itp. W smaku jest słodko, ale nie za słodko, jest sporo czekolady i kawy, jest delikatna kwaskowatość od ciemnych słodów. Niskie wysycenie, przyjemna gładkość, goryczka co najwyżej średnia, alkohol fantastycznie ukryty. Świetne piwo, dobrze zbalansowane, ale jednak Beer Geek Vanilla Shake zrobiło na mnie ciut lepsze wrażenie.

Svart som natten. Kaffe och choklad, djupa smaker. Något kärv i eftersmaken, bra men inte bäst 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of huge coffee, roasted malts, vanilla, roasted chocolate, baked bread. 
Pours pitch black with a mocha head. 
Taste follows the nose with loads of coffee, roast, sweeter vanilla and chocolate. 
Lighter side of full bodied, soft carbonation, velvety mouthfeel, bitter and roasty finish. 
Its good stuff.
Great mouthfeel, low carbonation, lots of coffee, roasted malt, some sweetness. Complex and warming.

Säuerlich schlanker Lakritzgenosse. Viel deliöse Kaffeearomen gepaart mit einem tiefschwarzen Outfit. Der Trunk heiß alkoholisch und voll würzig röstiger Schokokraft. Schwer. Not the best, trotzdem BIG and hot as hell. MIKKELLER & FRIENDS Kopenhagen. 0,2/60DKK. Tap.

Aroma - big roast, alcohol, licorice, caramelized sugars, chocolate, coffee, and a dash of vanilla.
Appearance - the body is on the verge of blackness, the head is beige and around 1/2" and settles into a thin layer of foam. Alcohol cloying drapes the glass in a wash of small suds.
Taste - has a rich roast, coffee, caramelized sugars, alcohol, some licorice, and a little dark chocolate.
Palate - full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, nice roast astringency that is medium in length.
Bottle and tap at various times. Really dark color, Roasted and coffee notes. Strong coffee taste, roasted malts.
Dark brown with a small mocha head. Smells like that coffee that the lemurs shit out. Creamy texture. Coffee taste with some sour undertones.

Aroma: Dark roasted malt, chokolate and a hint of vanilla. 
Flavour: Dark roasted coffee with chocolate and sweet fruity notes with vanilla. Aftertaste is fruity bitter with a long lasting malty roasted flavour. Mouthfeel is creamy and alcoholic warm. 
Colour: Black with a brown head. 
From: Bottle @ Salling Super Aarhus Sept. 2016.

Pours black with a thin khaki head which fades to just a little lacing. Aroma is of roasted malts, super dark chocolate, intense dark roast coffee, milk coco, dark fruits, sweet malts, caramel, and some salt. Taste is about the same as the aroma with a lot of bitter dark chocolate, espresso and dark roast, almost burnt coffee, dark fruits, vanilla, sweet malts, caramel, salt, earthiness, and and maybe just a little alcohol as it warms. Has a full body with a creamy, kinda of oily mouthfeel and a semi bitter, long, lingering finish. Overall, a fantastic, super unique and interesting beer that Im glad I finally tried.
simply amazing. Nice dark colour aroma of chocolate and coffee, taste is coffee and chocolate with a bit of soy, little creamy and bitter. This shit is one of the best

Appearance: Basically black, very dark tan head.
Aroma: Burnt, roasted, dark malt, coffee.
Taste: Very dark malt, burnt, strong coffee, very easy drinking. Nice burnt bitterness. Very very nice!
Bought: Vinmonopolet (Online), 330 ml, NOK 89.00
Info: 25/9-2016, BB: 13/5-2026

Piwko na otwarcie mojej parapetówki. Długo czekałem na tę chwilę. W aromacie likier czekoladowo - kawowy (kolejność nieprzypadkowa) z dominującą kawą gdy wkładam nos do sniftera. W smaku kawa z czekoladą, w posmaku kawa z czekoladową goryczką. Likierowo słodkie, likierowo gęste. I ta puszysta gęstość właśnie łagodzi szczypiący nieco w język alkohol. Doskonale piwo. Rewelacyjne do powolnego sączenia jeżeli ktoś ma bardzo silną wolę (ja nie mam, przynajmniej nie w takich chwilach). No i ta kawa, której smak tak długo utrzymuje się ustach. Petarda! To piwo rzeczywiście zasługuje na 100 na 100.

OMG what a beer! The aroma is amazing, complex and somehow new! Flowery notes and strong notes of wet poppy seeds (reminding of Polish poppy seed xmas cake) together with dark, roasted malt notes. Great coffee and chocolate scents. Some tracing molasses. It blew my mind. The taste is rich and complex, full on the mouth. Very satisfying. Amazing beer. I want more!

Draught. Pitch black (almost) with small and beige head. Aroma is really great, dark chocolate, coffee, pralins, some vanilla. In taste lightly sweet, bitter like dark chocolate, roasty coffee, vanilla, pleasant booze. Full bodied, oily and think, very smooth with soft carbonation. Finish is lightly roasted and moderately bitter. Fantastic beer - liquid dessert.

Dark black, minimal head but who cares? Great dark chocolate aroma mixed with coffee and alcohol. Very sweet, moderate bitter with terrific coffee aftertaste. Everything wonderfuly composed in full body. Absolutely great beer.

Aromat cudowny, kawa i pralinki, takie konkretne z gorzkiej czekolady, likier kawowy, wanilia, karmel. Smak średnio słodki, lekko gorzki. W smaku pralinki i likier kawowy, nuta bardzo przyjemnego alkoholu. Posmak dosyć gorzki, lekko taniczny, mocno kawowy. Ciało wysokie, piwo oliste i wykleja miło, jest przyjemnie gładkie dzięki niskiemu wysyceniu.

Appearance: deep dark black
Aroma: coffee and vanilla
Mouthfeel: medium heavy, low carbonation 
Taste: roast malt, coffee. Vanilla
Fantastic beer

Black pour, tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma is rich coffee with notes of roast, chocolate, caramel, hint of vanilla. Medium to full body, big coffee flavors balance well with the rest of the show. Really nice.

Wygląd: czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana bardzo szybko opada i wręcz po kilkunastu sekundach nie zostaje po niej nic.
Aromat: kawa, wiśnie w czekoladzie, czekolada, wanilia, paloność.
Smak: kawa, pralinkowa słodycz,gorzka czekolada, niskie wysycenie, przyjemny alkohol rozgrzewający przełyk. Piwo oleiste, przyjemnie wykleja podniebienie. 
Podsumowując, piwo świetne, zdecydowanie do długiej degustacji, pokazujące jak powinien pachnieć i smakować wybitny RIS.

Served at the Mikkeller Bar in San Francisco; very dark pour with caramel colored head. Aromas of Mexican chocolate, coffee, vanilla, cinnamon and toast are upfront. First taste is thick, creamy and silky smooth and confirms that this is a great beer; alcohol content is not obvious, very well balanced. Similar to Narwhal and Rasputin, that good.

Straight from the bright tank at Mikkeller San Diego back in May 16 w/ Brian. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, licorice, vanilla, heaven. So smoooooth -- the alcohol is warming but doesnt dominate the palate. Again, the flavours are so smooth, almost creamy in texture, with enough hops to allow everything else to shine without becoming overwhelming. This is near perfection for an imperial stout.

Almost black color. Medium level carbonation. Lovely aroma of coffee, vanilla, and chocolate. Oily body. So rich, perfectly balanced. Chocolate beginning. Nice smooth, but intense coffee finish, that isnt too bitter. Tastes like a mocha with a little something extra tossed in. Usually this style is too sweet, but this found the right point. Not much hops, just enough to keep the sweetness in tow. I think this would have been better at 8%, but I cant complain too much. This is surely the best coffee stout Ive ever had.

Bottle from Nørreport Estate Wine - Beer Paradise. Aroma is roasted malt, sweetish rich chocolate, bitter dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, espresso, coffee beans, mocha, touch of liquorice but not too much as I am touchy about liquorice, cream, wood. Flavour is chocolate malty sweet and moderate bitter. Body is full and creamy, incredibly smooth and drinkable, heavy but not boozy. Simply amazing, dangerously close to Imperial Stout perfection in my book.

It pours thick black with a minimal brown head. Original "speckled lacing", which match the weasel pictured on its label. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee. Taste is very complex with this beautiful and strong coffee backbone (and the use the top quality civet coffee here, that known as Kopi Luwak in Indonesia and Cà phê chồn in Vietnam), which provides a hint of chocolate as well. Notes of vanilla and licorice are present as well. Alcohool well hidden. A full bodied joy for who loves both stouts and coffee. Absolute master piece!

330ml. Bottle at home. pours black with a tiny fast diminishing brown head. aromas of liquorice and roasted chocolate, and coffee. Heavy taste: Coffee, liquorice, and sweet notes. Taste is long lasting and the aftertaste comes with a taste of alchohol. Great full body, with medium to high carbonation.

Bardzo dobre piwo. Zawiódł mnie tylko jego wygląd (brak piany przy nalewaniu przede wszystkim). Piłem wiele piw z kawą, ale żadne z nich nie miało takiego smaku i aromatu jak te. Świetna faktura, lekka paloność i przyjemna gorycz. Aż kusi mnie żeby spróbować Kopi Luwak...

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur noire, mousse qui disparait. Nez malt noir, café, vanille, note épices. Gout malt noir, café, vanille, chocolat, bien doux et balancé avec des notes grillées et alcool et un corps superbement plaisant et onctueux . Fin intense cremeuse grillée et amere

Rating #1896 - 2015.09.20 - Bottle. Black as civet cat shit (assumed, not witnessed) with almost no tan cap. Aroma is heavy roast malts,chocolate, espresso, mild molasses notes,Taste is heavy on roast malt and coffee flavours, very mild sweetness of cocoa, coffee, smoky/woodiness. For 10.9%, the alcohol heat is less pronounced than expected. Wondrous.

Bottle. Black with almost no carbonation. Aroma of coffee, licorice, chocolate and booze. Taste reflects the aroma, but with vanilla as well. A fine bitter ending. A very, very good beer. Just amazing...
Dark brown pour with tan head. Aroma of sweet chocolate and roast coffee. Taste follows nose. Nice mild bitter bite near end. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 butelka, warka do 13/05/2026. sniadaniowo, niedzielnie :) juz przy nalewaniu widac, ze piwo jest z tych gesto-lepko-oleistych, praktycznie czarne, piana ladna, szybko opadajaca do obraczki, zostajaca na szkle. Aromat... o fok :) kazde kolejne wypite piwo utrudnia kolejnym zrobienie efektu Wow! ale tu byl - megaintensywnie, glownie kawa, jako podstawowa nuta, ale rowniez intensywne i jednoznaczne aromaty waniliowe (duzo wanilii, poza kawa czy tez obok niej - dominujaca nuta), czekoladowe, pralinkowe, sliwek w czekoladzie, suszonych fig, palonosci, pumpernikla... pewnie jeszcze kilku rzeczy ;) karmel? porto lub rum? lukrecja? migdaly? zboze? takie troche zgadywanie, bo wszystko to powyzej jest tak poukladane (mimo, ze to wszak swieza warka), ze ciezko wyodrebnic. w ustach na dziendobry dwa podstawowe wrazenia: slodkosc (ale taka nie cukrowa, miodowa, karmelowa, tylko taka pralinkowo-waniliowo-bombonierkowo-alkoholowa) oraz konsystencja... ta konsystencja jest strasznie fajna - to piwo jest ewidentnie geste, pelne ciala, ale zarazem przymuszajace do kolejnych lykow. jest nieco oleiste, jest wyraznie lepkie, jest tez gladkie... wysycenie nieskie, ale nie bardzo niskie jak nieraz w RISach, alkohol z jednej strony dobrze ukryty a z drugiej ten co czuc, czuc w aromacie i smaku jako jakis szlachetny, slodki destylat. wszystko jest do tego wszystkiego bardzo zrownowazone, zbalansowane. ewidentnie ekstraklasa swiatowa. i to jest wersja bez beczki! mozna? mozna.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Niewielka, brązowa pianka, drobna, ale szybko opadająca do zera. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Intensywny aromat świeżej, delikatnie palonej kawy, ziaren kakaowca, gorzkiej czekolady, pralin, trufli i jagód... W smaku równie intensywne i równie przyjemne, półsłodkie, gęste, oleiste, likierowe, przy czym alkohol pięknie wkomponowany w całość. Posmaki długie, palone, rumowe, waniliowe. Goryczka średnia, palona. Wysycenie niskie.
Cudowny RIS, genialnie zbalansowany i jednocześnie bardzo intensywny, treściwy, pełny, gęsty, aksamitny od owsa... Klasa!

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Bottle, 10.6% vol. Pours thin brown head, which dissapears quickly. Aroma is sweetness and coffee in a great harmony, with a smoked twist. Taste is strong coffee, liqourice and a pleasant bitterness from beginning to end. Great and refreshing just like a morning coffee.

Jest to Imperialny Stout owsiany warzony z dodatkiem wietnamskiej, najdroższej na świecie kawy Kopi Luwak. 
 Dodatki:  Płatki owsiane, kawa wietnamska Ca Phe Chon (Kopi Luvak) 
 Data ważności:  13.05.2026 
 Kolor:  Czarny jak bezgwiezdna noc w Stavanger. Kompletnie nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Co tutaj się dzieje? Piana dosłownie znika w oczach. Dawno nie widziałem tak szybko pękających bąbelków.
Jest ciemnobeżowa, lekka, niska, drobna. I tyle zdążyłem zapisać zanim spojrzałem ponowenie na firmowego Rastala Mikkellera.
Nie ma żadnych śladów jej obecności, ani milimetra pierścienia. 
 Zapach:  Piękny, po prostu piękny. Aromat jest wielowarstwowy i z każdym kolejnym niuchem wyłapać można coś nowego.
Początek wyraźnie słodki, czekolada deserowa, karmel, bardzo intensywna wanilia. Zaraz za nim odrobina brązowego cukru trzcinowego i lukrecji.
Kawa nie jest w zapachu aż nadto intensywna, nie miażdży kubków zapachowych tak jak można by było się tego spodziewać. 
 Smak:  Po pierwszych łykach odpływam powoli do wietnamskiego raju. Raj ten jest pełen ziaren kawy, gorzkiej i deserowej czekolady. Po języku spływają słodkie nuty wanilii, lukrecji i karmelu. Po lekkim ogrzaniu, podniebienie łechtają ciemne owoce. Na finiszu jest już sos sojowy i ponownie wytrawne, mocne Double Espresso. Paloność jest na umiarkowanym poziomie. RIS jest cudownie lepki, gęsty, jedwabiście otula język swoją delikatną powłoką. Ciepło alkoholowe rozgrzewa od środka. 
Doskony balans poszczególnych elementów. Tworzą one barwną, spójną i niezwykle harmonijną kompozycję.
Pomimo wysokiego woltażu piwo wydaje się bardzo lekkie i nieziemsko pijalne. W tym tkwi jego największy sekret. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jest to RIS z dodatkiem płatków owsianych, a także najdroższej i nalepszej kawy na świecie Kopi Luwak.

Kopi luwak jest gatunkiem kawy wytwarzanej z ziaren kawy, które wydobywane są z odchodów zwierzęcia z rodziny łaszowatych zwanego lokalnie luwak.

Łaskun chętnie zjada owoce kawowca, ale nie trawi jego nasion, a jedynie miąższ. Po nadtrawieniu przez enzymy trawienne i lekkim sfermentowaniu przez bakterie produkujące kwas mlekowy ziarna przechodzą przez przewód pokarmowy i są wydalane. Zwierzę zjada tylko najlepsze owoce, a przez przejście przez przewód pokarmowy łaskuna ziarna kawy tracą gorzki smak i kawa z nich wytwarzana zyskuje nowy, łagodny aromat. Po oczyszczeniu kawę przetwarza się w typowy sposób. (Źródło : Wikipedia) 

Brunch Weasel jest rewelacyjnym RIS-em. Uwielbiam Mikkeller & Friends za ich pełne, słodkie, lepkie i niezwykle bogate smakowo RIS-y.
Ilość elementów wyłapanych podczas degustacji jest niezwykle imponująca.
Kawa, jak się obawiałem mogła zdominować profil piwa, jednak ku mojej uciesze tak się nie stało.
Została ona po mistrzowsku wklejona w całość i nie zaburzyła finalnego odbioru.
Faktura piwa i alkoholowe ciepło kapitalnie dopełniają całokształt. 

Na takie piwa warto czekać latami.
To był na prawdę kompletny do A do Z RIS.
Z niezwykłą przyjemnością spijałem każdą kropelkę tego cuda

Pitch black with almost no head. Strong aroma of coffee, licorice, pleasant booze - tastewise it is even better.

Extraordinary beer.

Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Niska, ciemnobeżowa piana, zostawia świetny lacing. Aromat bardzo złożony: na pierwszym planie jest kawa, w tle czekoladowy likier, paloność i wanilia. W smaku jest słodkie, zalepiające, smukłe, gładkie, są nuty czekoladowe, kawowe i waniliowe. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, ale rozgrzewa. Świetne piwo, ale jak na mój gust trochę za słodkie.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Similar taste, with perhaps faint licorice elements. Very smooth and rich. Excellent - one of my favorites.

Tasted from the tap on the 09/07/2016 at Caminha Artbeerfest 2016. Opaque black colour with a medium foamy beige head. Aroma of strong and roasted black coffee with some hops and licorice on the background. Taste is strong and intense black coffee with faint liquorice and burnt caramel. Next one please!

Aroma: sweet, roasty coffee; Appearance: pitch black with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: exceedingly smooth with subtle coffee notes, some booziness, extremely rich and nuanced; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: delicious; would buy again if I can find it.

How : bottle Appearance : jet black with a thin brown head. Aroma : espresso, milk chocolate, dried fruits, oranges, spice, vanilla, cloves, caramel and brown sugar. Palate : full body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 Black color with creamy head. Dark roasted aromas of coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is one of a kind when it comes to coffee-based Imperial Stouts. Such smooth, bitter taste from the coffee that caresses your taste buds. Chocolate and vanilla is also present. Sweet licorice, like the ones in Harbio Matador Mix. It is really good, probably due to the Kopi luwak. But I have read some alarming articles about the Kopi luwak farms and the treatment of the animals, is the taste really worth it? Non the less, great tasting Imperial Stoout.

Vanilla, milk chocolate and coffee aroma. Pours black with a pretty thin brown head. Sweet flavour, lots of chocolate and vanilla. Notes of coffee. Rich body, flat. Bitter chocolate finish. Just an amazing beer.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours pitch black, with delicious beige head. Beautiful sight. Aroma is a lot of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla.Could even be like a sweet chocolately cake. The taste is so poetically balanced. A lot of sweetness (chocolate, vanilla), some bitterness (coffee, malts). The body is full, creamy, and the mouthfeel is sticky, yet somehow still sparkly and dancing on the tongue. It?s so smooth. Simply amazing.
Rich, creamy, very well balanced. moderate sweetness. The quality of the coffee taste is superior. Huge aftertaste as well. Deserves the best (one of the bests) european beer title.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, small tan head. 
Mild nose, with a hint of alcohol. Taste is very round, sweet malts, coffee and chocolate, with a somewhat bitter finish. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Draught at Mikkeller San Diego, 21.4.16. Black with a brown head. Mellower coffee than in the Antigua, coconut, caramelized almonds. Mellow and rich flavor, a little sourish, perhaps some licorice.Full body, smooth carbonation, coffee and anise finish.
Wow. Great on the nose with coffee at the forefront. Loved every second of it, so smooth, vanilla, some chocolate and coffee flavours made this beer.
Another solid stout! I like this a lot. Easily available, the price is a bit high but I think it is worth it. Lots and lots of good coffee flavor.
Tiefschwarz, brauner Schaum, leicht Vanille in der Nase, schön rund im antrunk, Schokolade und Kaffee im Abgang, angenehm ausgewogen, leichte bittere

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 F: dark brown, good retention, big.
C: dark, opaque.
A: malt, whisky, Porto vine, plums, dark cherries, cocoa, coffee, woody, dark chocolate, raisins, molasses, candy, dark caramel, pine, simple complex aroma.
T: roasted malt, coffee, alcohol, chocolate, dark fruits, cocoa, caramel, coffee grounds, pine, grapefruits bitterness, long complex lingering aftertaste, full body, oily mouthfeel, good carbonation, 0,33l bottle, from Malting Pot in Brussels, great stuff, a must try beer.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0., Madrid, España.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate, licorice, coffee / Malta tostada, dulce, chocolate, regaliz, cafe.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A pitch black beer with a big beige creamy head ; good retention ; good lacing. Roast, toast, light blackcurrant, balck chocolate (+), coffee, herb. Medium sweet, warming baseline ; medium to dry heavy bitter. Full body, light creamy texture, average to soft carbonation, light prickly on the tongue, chocolate dry lasting bitter finish. Overall, WoW !! Wonderful beer, such a powerful aromatic landscape, great bitter chocolate coffee adventure.
awesome one. Pours oily, thick consistency. Complex aroma, some malt, coffee and some dark fruits, may be. Full body, awesome taste of some coffee, toffee with a bitter finish.

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a medium, creamy, long lasting, chocolate brown head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, vanilla and coffee. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate, vanilla and warming alcohol with a dry, bitter, slightly hoppy finish. Medium to full body with a creamy smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Ive been dying to try this one for a while. It was well worth the wait. Delicious.

0.33 l bottle from Saveur Bière, best before May 2025. Pitch black with a thin, frothy, almost stable, light brown head. Sweetish, medium roasty and slightly fruity aroma of milk chocolate, coffee beans, vanilla, some caramel and hints of prunes. Sweetish, slightly roasty and minimally fruity taste of milk chocolate, coffee beans, vanilla, caramel, toasted nuts and some prunes, followed by a long, moderately roasty-bitter, slightly warming-alcoholic finish. Full body, very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, almost flat. What a treat! Superbly balanced, unbelievably creamy and very tasty although not overly complex.

Bottle
Aroma-coffee, chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Sehr ausgewogenes schwarzes bier mit geruch und geschmack nach zartbitter und mandeln sowie nach dörrobst! Traumhaft gutes bier!
Arômes de cerises et réglisse. Liquide noire opaque avec mousse abondante et compacte. En bouche, notes de torréfaction alcool et beaucoup de corps.

On tap at TCBW 2016. Bkack liquid. Beige head. Coffee and roasted sour coffee beans in the aroma. Nice sourness in my nose. Reminds sherry or port. Smooth coffee at first. Creamy palate. Really nice mouthfeel. Bready sourness and coffee beans in the middle. Coffee taste also in the end. Great balance. Very drinkable. Would say even medium bodied. Tasty.

Bottle kindly bought for me at the bierkonig in Amsterdam. Pours pitch black with huge brown head. Texture is oily, carbonation is a bit high, Nose is lots of rosted malt, coffee, custard and some faint liquorice. Taste is Boom coffee, alcoholic fancyness, lots of roasted malts.
Pours a dark mahogany brown with fluffy tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, and some woody notes. Flavors of chocolate, coffee, and hints of tobacco. Astringent bitter dry finish.
TCBW. Black with light brown head. Coffee, tomato pure and sour notes. Bitter with coffee and coffee flavours. Black and chili-like. Smooth with wide body.
TCBW16. Sweet strong aroma. Strong espresso vibe. Mild cream, great roasting. Raisin and other ripe fruits. Maybe one sided. Id drink again.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Amazing Imperial Stout. Strong aroma that remains until the very end: roasted malts, sugar and so much coffee. Taste is the same. Every sip is great, and gets better while the temperature increases. A little bit overcarbonted, by as time goes by, it gets lowered, and the texture gets smoother. Excellent.

Dark, black inch-thick head.

Smells like coffee at first followed by burnt caramel and dark chocolate. The taste is sweet and coffee-bitter. You can definitely smell the alcohol. Mouthfeel very smooth.
Its been a long time since I had this one, but I remember it was awesome, and made me a definite sucker for RIS
Smells great... Very rich and flavorful... A heavier beer.... Like very much, despite the rather unexpected "unique" ingredient

Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma chocolate and coffee and roasted malt. Full body with some alcohol. Flavor is pretty complex with roasty malt and coffee predominating and some cocoa, overall its pretty sweet but not too much but a little bit of harsh booziness. Quite good though.
On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, liquorice and tobacco. Sweet finish.

12oz bottle. Black color brown head. Roasted Malt dark chocolate aroma. Medium heavy very smooth texture. Milk Chocolate roasted malt flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2016 Backlog, early amateur rating! From tap in Copenhagen 131015. Roasted and malty with chocolate.

Un 10 de cerveza. Tiene un ahora dificil de olvidar pero lo más impresionante es su entrada en boca, una cerveza suave por la cantidad de avena que lleva y un sabor impresionante a vainilla, chocolate, cafe... es inmejorable.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass ; room temperature.

Very strong beer, in all means. I didnt like it. The taste is really well balanced between porter and wisky. Great colour, and a overhelming palate.

Bottle. Aged sample - probably at least five years. Black with beige head. Aroma of cocoa, coffee, roasted malts. Sweet flavour of cocoa and coffee with roasted malts bitterness in the finish. Great beer.

Gray wax sealed bottle. Bubbily dark black with a little bit of foamy tan head. Aroma is mild but sweet milky stout comes through. Really smooth roasted bitter coffee beans, dark chocolate, mild hop bitterness at the end. Thick body and dry. Some lacto notes in the finish linger with the coffee, like drinking milk n coffee. Some booze in the final sips, pleasant though. Preferred the Slyrs whisky barrel version, but this one is really awesome too. I still cant believe Im drinking catshit.

Poured from a bottle. Really great imperial stout. Black with mocha head. Nose is coffee, chocolate and roast along with vanilla, and hints of fruit and spice. Dark ripe fruit on the tongue, not too sweet, finishes slightly bitter. Slick, oily mouthfeel. Drinkable, alchohol well hidden. Plenty of complexity to enjoy with this beer.

Black with a brown head - Good aroma of roasted malt and some coffee tones as well - Good roasted malt body that is soft and olso a nice flavour of coffee roast and some chocolate notes as well with some bitterness - The coffee, roasted malt and bitterness goes into the finish - This was real good

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2016 Thick black body, medium brownish head. Aroma of toasted malt, surprisingly floral, i had notes of lavender at first... Some fruits too like plum, blueberries and black current. Coffee is coming afterward and as the beer breath it takes a more prominent place. Flavours of toasted barley, coffee, lots of malt complexity, caramel, licorice, alcohol fusel, cocoa. The floral hops arrives at the end bringing the bitterness with them. Long finish, toasted malt, coffee, alcohol, strong bitterness. Oily body, low carbo. What an outstanding beer, complexe, savory, balanced, elegant.
From bottle at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Amazing as always. Pitch black and Good balance

A: Pitch black with a one finger brown head. Disappears quite fast and leaves a thin lacing. N: Coffee, floral, liqourice, some dark berries, plum, apple T: Salty, coffee, liqourice, salmiak O: Very very nice! Perfect carbo that gives an soft tender mouthfeel. Very bitter coffee, just a little tartness and hint of sweetness. Love it!
Sedosidad, potencia en aroma, suave cafe de civeta, no se q se puede decir de este pepinazo.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 One of my favorite imperial stout. Full of coffee flavor and very well hidden alcohol. May be the best beer Mikkeller ever made.

Delft 9-01-2015, samen met Lou, drankgigant

Gigantische aanrader! Wat een bijzonder bier! Vrij duur maar is het zeker waard. Vette fles met kaarsvet dichtgemaakt. Bijzonder verhaal over de koffie die erachter zit. Oatmeal stout, mooie donkere kleur met een hele gave caramel kleurige schuimkraag. Enorm goed gebalanceerd! caramel/koffie smaak. Gigantisch lekkere, volle smaak. Super zachte smaak.

Bottle. Pours a stouty brownish-black, medium espresso colored head (more akin to a film really). Nose is lots of darkness: dark roast, black coffee, molasses, licorice, dark bread, dark chocolate, faint smoke, candy sugar. Mouth is big and oily on the palate, medium sweetness, decent balancing bitterness, Dutch process cocoa, coffee, black licorice, vanilla, smoke, roasted barley, some soot. Cant even tell its got cat shit in it. ;-P Seriously though. Very nice.

Shared bottle. Pours is dark with thick brown head that lasts for seconds. Aroma of honey, coffee, dark chocolate, malts, herbal, fruity notes comes after, tangerine and pine. Taste has lot of coffee notes, medium to moderate sweet, moderate bitter, dark chocolate mouthfeel, alcohol warmth in finish. Heavy body, oily texture, coffee aftertaste, light bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours jet black with brown head. Aroma is sweet honey, malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is sweet thick/rich chocolate and coffee with a chocolate coffee alcohol finish. Very good.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Pitch black pour, thick as hell, with a short-lived espresso-coloured head. Smells of dark chocolate, cocoa, dark cherries and a bit of vanilla. Tastes like sherry truffles, dark chocolate, coffee and dried fruit. An excellent stout.

Pitch black, nice tanned head, great lacing. In aroma chocolate liqueur and a lot of freshly prepared coffee. Mouth feel is perfect, thick, dense, super chewy. And then there is a taste which makes man speechless. Full of coffee, a lot of chocolate, both sweet and dark bitter. The aftertaste never ends, but yet the bitterness in it is short very noble. There is not event touch of alcohol in the taste. In the very end it warms your throat just a bit, which is nice and pleasant. Because you almost have to chew this beer, and because its so balanced, so smooth, so nice and in the same time it gives so many sensations, its a perfect beer for me.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Bottle. Pours nice thick black with light-brown head. Roasted aroma of dark marts, Chocolate and Coffee. The taste also include pine, grapefruit, orange-peel with balanced alcohol warm the. Starts sweet then some acidity and finish bitter with a long long lingering aftertaste of coffee. A full-body beer with a creamy oily texture. Complex, Intens and overwhelming good!

Cool bottle. Very dark with a very small brown head. Thin lacing. Rosted malts, coffee and dark chocolate dominante the heavy aroma. Taste follows. Slight sweetness and a good amount of bitterness. Aftertaste is strong coffee and roasted. Much better as it warms to near room temperature. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur dun noir profond qui laisse passer quelques reflets brun accompagner dune belle mousse brune. En bouche je suis decu mais pas desapointer, cest une imperial stout plutot typique qui jour entre lalcool le chocolat noir et le cafe. Cette biere nest pas un desastre mais elle est surevaluer cest certain...

Deep dark black with a Brown head that fades into a nice veil. Big nose with lots of chocolate, brownies and cereals. Super silky oily, very thick palate. All in smoothness with the coffee shining at the end. Big dessert beer. Really well executed.

Pours an opaque dark almost black color with khaki colored head. Coffee, roasted coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, and some vanilla on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied and rich, alcohol is hidden very well, also very smooth. Finishes with coffee and chocolate.

Poured into a taster showing a thick pitch black with a very thin layer of brown colored foam. 

The nose shows big notes of coffee and roasted malts with sweet notes of molasses.

The palate is rich, full bodied, and creamy smooth. A very slight latte sweetness throughout but dominantly lightly roasted coffee, cacao, and gentle notes of roasted malts. Finish is a dark chocolate/cacao bitterness. Full and rich without a flavor that also drags you down.

Really interesting. First time Ive had a beer this expensive per ounce. Made me rethink beer and beer menus, that I could put this on a menu as a digestif and not even get a full liquor license.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

355 ml bottle poured at home. Pours a dark brown with a brownish head and lots of lacing. Smell and taste is coffee. Almost no alcohol flavor at all. I love it. If I had to criticize at all it would be that the finish was a touch watery but its really nitpicking. Thoroughly drinkable.
Nice coffee stout. Made out of kopiluwak beans. Black colors. Thick texture. Sweat coffee taste

From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Playing Legend of Grimrock 2. Alcohol perflectly hidden. Nice aroma, taste and feel. No need to worry about the weasel dropings this is made from. It doesnt stink at all but the contrary

Bottle. Pours deep black with brownish head and good lacing. Strong aroma of coffee and roasted malts. Taste: again lots of coffee, only a bit sweet, with well marked bitterness. Full bodied, with oily texture and perfectly hidden alcohol. A very good stout.

Delicious stout. Pours a black color with a tan head that disappeared quickly. The smell is sweet up front with coffee and booze kicking in at the end. Taste is exactly the same but very smooth because of the oats.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours deep dark brown almost no head. Aroma: roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, plums. Taste: roasted malts, chocolate, sweet dark plums, coffee, creamy, sweet with some bitterness, a bit spicy, toffee, hazelnuts. Full body. Sweet roasted finish.

Clear sparkling dark black color with a huge, creamy - rocky, excellent lacing, fully lasting, light brown head. Aroma is light heavy malty, coffee, moderate roasted, chocolate, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus - orange, pine. Flavor is light heavy sweet and bitter with a long long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy - oily, smooth and soft, carbonation is soft. Very nice beer Mikkel and then the story in the news

Shared from 11.2oz brown bottle into taster glasses, opaque black colour with deep sudsy brown foam, long-lasting with fine lace. Rich malts, grainy, fruity, dark chocolate, dark coffee, brown bread, toast with orange marmalade, roasty, stone fruit esters, pleasant sharpness from burnt barley grains. Somehow both chewy and creamy. Sweet and bitter. Tart. Full-bodied, chewy mouthfeel, subtle tannins and mineral essence, average carbonation, lingering multi-layered aftertastes with a hoppy snap and bright coffee acidity at finish. Boozier and less smooth than the regular Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast, which I actually enjoyed more. But dont get me wrong, this is still a masterpiece.

Waxed bottle at home. Pitch black, oily pour topped by a minimal foamy brown head. Nicely balanced roasted coffee, dark chocolate and bourbon-y notes in the nose and taste, some dried and red fruits. Lingering aftertaste, slightly bitter sweet. Big bodied, medium carbonation, oily and smooth mouthfeel. Impressive balance with big flavours.

Al naso nei primi minuti è un bellaccostamento di cacao, tabacco e legno. Note vinose di sottofondo e frutti rossi. Ma col passare dei minuti scompaiono per lasciare posto alla sola carruba. Peccato. Laspetto è piacevole, con il nero corvino del colore e la schiuma non abbondante color marroncino cremosa. Al palato ha un bel corpo, molto strutturato, con bollicine molto esigue. In bocca tanto cacao e un lievissimo tostato, caffè solo sulletichetta. E morbida con un finale secco, amaro di tostato e lieve resinoso. Persistenza del retrogusto prolungata. Ne parlano molto bene, ma più di un dubbio resta.
Its been a good afternoon. Not gonna lie - I liked this one a lot more before I knew it was made with defecated coffee beans.

Bottle at home. Pours black with small brown head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, dark dried fruits, burnt hay, acetone. Taste roasted malt bitterness, well balanced by malty sweetness. Oily palate.

미켈러 - 비어긱 브런치 위즐 10.9% ABV 미켈러의 유명한 임페리얼 스타우트. 크게보면 탄맛-단맛-시큼 감칠맛 나는 단맛으로 마무리 짓는 특이한 맥주인데, 이 마지막의 시큼한 감칠맛의 정체가 포인트 

바로 이 시큼한 감칠맛의 커피향의 정체가 베트남산 사향고양이 커피였다. 발리에서 처음 루왁 커피를 마셨었는데, 커피에서 나는 산미가 커피 자체에서 나는 그것이라기 보다는 속쓰릴때 위에서 올라와 느껴지는 그 동물적 산미였다. 대단히 잘짠 레시피지만

ᅄ 환영할만한 맥주는 못된다. 커피생산을 위한 사향 고양이 사육에는 반대하는 입장이며, 이것을 마케팅의 주요한 방식으로 사용하는 것 역시 반대한다. 코피루왁도, 이 맥주도 다시 마실일은 없다.

다시 레시피를 보면 역시나 상당히 잘만들었다. 처음에 솟는 탄내는 로스팅 자체를 계획적으로 과하게 한데서 나타난 것 같은데, 역시 비터 초콜릿의 풍미로부터 달콤한 밀크 초콜릿까지, 거기에 단일종 커피의 산미까지 이용한 수준은 박수칠만한 하다.

사용한 사향고양이 원두는 베트남 산이라고 한다. 애증이 교차하는 맥주. 이 맥주를 둘러싼 담론들이 싫지만 레시피를 다루는 솜씨와 임페리얼 오트밀 스타우트라는 장르를 재해석한 점에서는 만점을 안날리수가없 

https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Cola, roast, sweetness, coffee, toffee, caramel, dark fruit, light spice. Surprisingly easy drinking, rich and smooth but no hint of the booze. Sweet but not cloying. Lightly spiky and spicy. Good stuff.

One of the easier ones to get, but somehow, Ive not rated it. Dark chocolate, coffee (civet coffee), molasses, some soy, toasted malt, and a hint of smoke. Opaque black with a 2 cm short lasting head, that reduces to 5 mm after about a minute. The head is a mottled, light brown and there is some nice lacing. Taste is coffee, coffee, coffee, oatmeal, soy, molasses, caramel, and dark chocolate. This is good. Really good.

Butelka. Barwa czarna jak smoła. Pian beżowa, drobna, utrzymuje się do końca tworząc bardzo cienką obrączkę. Aromat intensywny, kawy (espresso), suszonych owoców w postaci śliwek i rodzynek. Smak zdominowany przez kawę, mocno paloną, intensywną w smaku. Wysycenie wysokie. Alkohol fajnie drażni gardło i nozdrza. Smaki kawowe mocno zalegające. 
Podsumowując piwo bardzo dobre, pełne, gęste, oleiste. Do długiej degustacji.

Bottled at Krapiva bar. Deep brown with cream head. Sweet coffee aroma with malty background. Very reach and intensive taste full of chocolate and soft coffee, really full body enough sweetness and awesome balance. One of best beer i ever drunk.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, vanilla and chocolate; ends slightly/medium bitter and dry with roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. All that could be said, is underrating this beer. The malts together with the added sugar, give this the exact same flavour of genuine bakery chocolate. The added coffee is so amazing. The palate is superbly thick and smooth. The aroma might realistically be closer to a nine than a ten, but the taste is even a 100 out of 100; it is that good!

330 mL bottle. The pour is a jet black with a thin ring of khaki colored collar of head and no lace. The aroma is incredibly boozy. There is a good coffee and a strong chocolate and nice roast. The booze really hinders this one for me. It's not really complex, so I was hoping for more. The flavor is really good. There is big roast and chocolate that is really solid. The coffee is nice and well balanced with the other flavors. I remember the first time I had this a little more bitter, but I'm glad this one is not at all. The coffee is good and balanced with a roast. The mouth feel is thin. The carbonation is lacking. It falls off the tongue a little bit. The aftertaste is chocolate and roasty with a hint of coffee. Lingeringly smooth and good. Wish it were a little thicker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by koleminer20 because hes awesome. Aroma is wonderful Kopi Luwak, roasted malt, chocolate, booze, really good. Appearance is black, light brown, poured thick. Taste is wonderful, Kopi Luwak, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, wow. Mouthfeel is thick, soft carbonation, great body, oily. Overall, my god this is a beauty.

Dark black color with thin brown ring of a head and light lacing. Aroma is light with mix of coffee and cocoa. Flavor is strong but smooth. Rich cocoa balanced with strong coffee flavor with slight deep berry notes. Very good but very expensive- $12 for 11oz glass!?
Olor intenso a cafe. Buen cuerpo. Espuma consistente. Sabor a chocolate y cafe. Muy intensa.

Tap at Yellow Ape, Osaka. 
L: a simply gorgeous looking beer. Jet black, and a cracking small dark tan bubbly head which eventually goes with a tonne of lacing. 
S: nothing surprising or unusual for an imperial stout, just solid rich dark roasted malt, chocolate, well-balanced notes. 
T: so big in flavour, strong malt, choc fudge. It stays the same all the way down, zero palate fatigue, full-flavoured till the end. 
F: really smooth, you cant taste the alcohol, but the feel is so full and rich you know its there. 
O: wonderful. Really easy to sip for an hour because of the rich flavours.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Colore nero impenetrabile, schiuma marrone scuro, cremosa.
Bouquet complesso, profumi tostati, caffè, malto tostato, erbaceo e resinoso dei luppoli, anche agrumi, ancora caffè.
In bocca pastosa, oleasa, quasi masticabile, sapore forte, intensissimo di caffè, malto tostato, cioccolato fondente, poi arrivano gli amari del luppolo, per finire con un ritorno dei tostati/caffè e un amaro lunghissimo, leggermente astringente. Alcool comunque ben nascosto, equilibrata nonostante i sapori forti. Capolavoro.

black liquid with minimal milk chocolate head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee, some smokiness. Tastes same, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, Palate: full body, sticky, average carbonation, long bitter finish,
Nästan svart öl med inslag av rött. Brunt centimerhögt skum. Rostad malt och kaffe i aromen men kanske framförallt mörk choklad. I smaken så träder kaffesmakerna fram mer men utan att ta över.

Aroma: sweet, sweet coffee, some strange notes (medicinal herbs).
Taste: moderate sweetnes with prominent bitterness.
Flavour: Sweet robusta, fresh ground arabica, bitter chocolate.
Good burned bitterness in the aftertaste.

Very good.

A thimble full. Pours a dark brown/black, flat looking with no head. Nose involves a big blast of coffee with some dark chocolate. Pretty sweet, decently bitter. Medium toward full bodied, quite oily, finishing dry and roasty. A coffee bomb, and a cool experience. Glad I didnt have to plunk down for it.

Doskonale zbalansowane piwo. Intensywny kawowy aromat. Piwo oblepia kubki smakowe powodując niesamowite doznania sensoryczne. Goryczka niezbyt intensywna jak na styl. W miarę ogrzewania wychodzi bardzo szlachetny alkohol.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts.
Well balanced, not as strong on the coffee flavor as I had anticipated. Very smooth for the ABV. Excellent beer, not quite worth the $12/bottle regular price, but worth the $6 discounted price :)

Weasel Shit. Mmmmmmm. Dark black color, thick light brown head that fades. Aroma is dark coffee, very nice. Taste is coffee, vanilla, sour fruit late, raspberry, plum, fig. 
Interesting beer.

Bottl 0.33 from BeerShop Koht (Tallinn Lai 8), drink at home. Incredible brown with red tones color of beer with brown head, which leave quickly. Aroma are coffee with lite wine tones - very good, taste is a little sweet with nitter end. Its a very viscid, maybe its the thickist beer Ive ever drunk. Taste are also have many coffee, chokolate, so complex.

It has a beautiful brown persistent foam and a fat and oily texture. The aroma is strong coffee. Mouth feeling is thick, creamy and rich forms a membrane in the mouth. The flavor is cold coffee of good quality, not with the same bitterness as ordinary stouts, for though Im not the great coffee know I can sense that bitterness is gentle. It is without doubt the coffee which is dominant flavor ingredient in this stout, but since it is also clear from the publicity and label it certainly can not be surprised. It is lovely, tasty, slightly vinous and warming.
Pours dark, little head. Aroma of coffee, malts, chocolate. Good carbonation. Taste of chocolate covered coffee beans, wonderful dark chocolate finish.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ & Friends, Copenhagen - black pour with tan head. Roasted malty aroma and taste with intense dark roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, great mouthfeel, good roasted finish. Wonderful.

Bottle from Palme, many thanks! One quarter of the bottle was filled with sediment but I am not sure whether that was w production fault or something that developed during those couple years of lagering. I guess the former which puts the brewery to shame, especially since this is an expensive beer. Anyway, the remaining 75% tasted lovely. Vanille- and coffee scented chocolate liqueur, basically. Thick, slick mouthfeel, soft carbo. Not really that in-your-face type of coffee flavour but it is there. No tartness, no palatable alcohol presence, very balanced. The coffee gets more intense as the beer warms up a bit, complemented by notes of soy sauce and leather. Excellent.
Goût de café intense limite expresso. Très longue amertume qui tend vers le cacao

First impression is that its different stout and not such coffee as u eexpect from label and description. But when you try this for second time you feel the big art of this beer. The first time is so much different than the second. FANTASTIC BEER, SMOOTH and so so delicate, tickle for every part of your drinking mechanism. Cant explain it. What more can I say. Words not enough just try it!

Bottle. Pitch black color with tall, lasting and light-brown head. Looks perfect. Leaves oily sediment on the sides of the glass when moved. Plenty of coffee in aroma, notes of chocolate, roasted malts, some sweet notes of dark fruits, hints of caramel and vanilla. Taste, again, is very roasty and coffee with a little bit of sweetness. High, roasty bitterness and alcoholic aftertaste but its quite noble and works well with other flavours. Oily, full body. Low carbonation. Had a Beer Weak version some time ago and it was better in terms of that coffee taste & aroma (felt like drinking good, cold brewed coffee with alcohol) but this one is way more complex. Great stuff.

Aroma: a lot of coffee, roastiness, then dark chocolate with dark dry fruits, touch of alcohol. Beautiful. Simply beautiful. Appearance: incredible oiliness, black, the head is perfect: stiff , dense (like nitric), great lacing. Taste: very roasty, great coffee (espresso style), dark chocolate, dry fruits, noble alcohol, sweetness, bitterness mostly from alcohol, low hoppiness. Palate: completely filling all taste buds, warming alcohol (I would give it half a year of maturing) but very swift.

An absolutely delicious stout. Nice wax sealed bottle. Deep brown/black pour with a small brown head. No lacing. Deep flavour profile of rich, earthy coffee, espresso, chocolates, roasted malts, and some burnt grains. Extremely well balanced with a rich and robust flavour. Absolutely delicious.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 20C, adapted). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown BF19.05.25. AROMA: strong aroma of coffee with slight sweet and complex dark fruits notes (prunes) with a faint vinous background. APPEARANCE: very darn Brown color and opaque. average brown head with moderate retention. "leg" formation and alcohol viscosity apparent. TASTE: strong black coffee flavour with slight sweet black dried fruits background (prunes). medium bitterness from hops and roasted grains with an almost dry, roasted (almost burnt) finish. PALATE: very full-body with a velvety texture. faint alcohol warmth. low carbonation. OVERALL: an outstanding imperial otameal stout that gives more central stage to coffee than other elements like esters and hops (wich would give it more complexity). Highly recommended though.

Pour from bottle to snifter. Jet black with a towering tan head. Nose of chocolate, earth/bark, coffee, vanilla hints, nuances of caramel/maple. Flavor is dark chocolate, some hop charactaristics, really bright yet earthy coffee, astringency and creaminess from the oats. Powerful yet balanced. Coffee is showcased in the linger, and is, quite understandably, remarkably tasty.

Black body, medium brown head with nice lacing. Aroma of coffee, porto, black chocolate. Taste is intense; its medium bitter, burnt, roasted; has a very spicy and slightly chocolate-y aftertaste. Alcohol is very well hidden, despite the 10,9%... Full, creamy body, slightly above average carbonation. A stout probably cant get much better than this.

Bottle picked up on my way through cincy, aroma chocolate, malts, and aroma. Taste is similar, nice, but not great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle, served in tulip. Black colour with a beautiful tan creamy head, looks very good. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Taste is so delicious, the coffee is amazing, very well blended with the roasted malts and the oats. The chocolate touch is also there but not as much as the smell. Dry aftertaste with some balanced sweetness, very pleasant. Full body, oily texture, perfect carbonation. In short: this is TOP.

Pours balck with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, burnt sugar, brandy, roasted malts. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, caramel, burnt sugar, brandy, roasted malts. Mouthfeel is very smooth with low carbonation.
Aromat: czekolada, kawa, wanilia. Smak: kakao, kawa, wanilia i jeszcze raz kawa. Super-jedwabiste odczucie w ustach, wspaniały posmak. Bardzo bogata.

Smooth aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Taste is chocolate, coffee without being too sweet. Tasty, but nothing really special, especially in the way of coffee - had regular imp stouts with a more pronounced coffee character.

Bottle. Pours black-dark brown color. Wonderfull big brown had which lasts and lasts. Aroma: brett, rum, vanilla, dates, wine. Wow. Flavor: brett is dominating, with again some dates. Coffe and chocolate. Really complex. Actually, slightly high level of bitterness. Mix of biterness, coffe and sourness lasts soo long in mouth. Creamy. Overall: this is great beer. Very complex and for its 11% alcohol very drinkable. Beautiful beast.
Black with thin tan creamy head. Coffee and bitter cocoa. Sweet with a bitter black cocoa finish. Soft carbonation and smooth. Oily to creamy. Good but not overly complex.

Bottle from Ebenezers
Thick black liquid with a rich creamy mocha head that lasts forever. Huge chocolate and coffee aroma with plenty of brown sugary sweetness to pull this desert beer together. Very rich, nice brew!

WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, wysoka, krótka.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Dżem porzeczkowy, karmel, kawa, żywica, delikatna wanilia, owsianka, nuty beczkowe oraz likierowe.
SMAK: W pierwszej chwili słodki i zalepiający niczym konfitura porzeczkowa. Jednak po chwili do głosu dochodzi kawa, a ta towarzyszy nam już do samego końca. 
OGÓLNIE: Gęste, oleiste. Alkohol jak najbardziej obecny, ale stanowi on niezbędne uzupełnienie, gdyż potęguje on wszelkie doznania zarówno w smaku, jak i aromacie. Rasowy-RIS! Aromat jest niesłychanie bogaty, choć nie tak intensywny.

Purchased 4/3/2015 enjoyed 8/3/2015 in a Mad Elf tulip/snifter. 

Look - Dark black body with only the outer edges letting light through. A little less than a finger tan head that developed slowly after pour and dissipated quickly. Little to no lacing. Very fine bubbles. 

Smell - Chocolate. Alcohol. Coffee. Char. Vanilla. Soy.

Taste - Dark and milk chocolates. Alcohol is there and not "light" but a different flavor. Oats. Coffee. I am just assuming the different flavor is a type of coffee I have not tasted. Sweet before the finish, almost citrusy. 

Feel - Creamy. Little tongue tingle with hops and alcohol. Not overly carbonated. 

Overall - I found myself taking many small sips of this to find out what is going on. I dont think it is overly complex, just flavors I have not tasted.

Fles gekocht bij EtreGourmet, uitgeschonken in glas van De Molen. Schenkt zwart uit, schuimkraag is minimaal en verdwijnt bijna meteen. De meeste beoordelingen hier spreken van de bekende bruine schuimkraag, bij mijn fles helaas toch wat verlies van carbonatie. De aroma's zijn complex en speciaal met tonen van espresso koffie, ik ruik ook een speciale aromatische houtgeur die lijkt op cederhout. Verder ook tonen van pure chocolade, mokka. Het smaakpallet is heel speciaal en verwant aan de aroma's. Zelden zoveel koffie tonen in een bier geproefd, ik heb de ca phe chon koffie nog niet geproefd, alleen nu dus voor de eerste keer in een Imperial Stout. En de smaken zijn heerlijk bitter en naarmate het bier opwarmt steeds zoeter. Het mondgevoel is heel olieachtig, er drijft zelfs een olieachtig laagje op het bier. Smaaktonen van: espresso koffie, pure chocolade, mokka, cederhout en vanille. De carbonatie is heel licht bijna vlak. De afdronk is zeer lang, droog koffie bitter. Het is jammer dat er geen schuimkraag op deze fles Brunch Weasel meer zat, het voorkomt een rating rond de 4,8. Voorlopig vind ik de Cocoa Shake uit de Beer Geek series van Mikkeller nog de beste. De wat zwakkere carbonatie is wel een reden om de Brunch Weasel nogmaals te proberen!

Tap at Øl, Copenhagen. Pitch black with multifaceted brown head and a beautiful lacing. The nose is rather soft, some cocoa and toffee, clearly roasty. Beautiful taste, very sweet but in balance with the power of this beer. Outstandingly delicious!

Pitch black color with medium brown foam. The smell has a lot of roasted coffee. The taste is ultra smooth, sweet, coffeeish with a high viscosity and a lot of bitter dark chocolate. The aftertaste is smooth as gargling silk that has been soaked in chocolate cream. This beer is just awesome, and I dont like coffee.

APPEARANCE ? perfectly black with dark caramel colored head.
NOSE ? absolutely the most coffee smelling beer I?ve ever had.
FLAVOR ? for all the great nose, it comes up weak in the flavor arena.
NOTES ? Shigadeyo rates this in 2009, and had a much better review. I?m surprised that the beer has changed so significantly over the years.

Bottle 0,33.
Dark brown. Full body. Light carbonation. Creamy. Strong coffee aroma. Well balanced taste, complex, warming, toffee. Good!

Thanks vjohans!
Bottle.
Dark brown, brown head.
Aroma of caramel, coffee, candy. Vanilla. 
Taste sweet and some bitterness. Taste coffe and vanilla, lovely!
12 oz bottle into pint glass. Jet black with dark brown head. Malty, with strong chocolate and oatmeal notes. Outstanding beer.
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a small, brown head; aroma of coffee, then coffee liqueur; thick palate; well hidden alcohol; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 Doskonałe piwo do analizy jak temperatura wpływa nie postrzeganie genialności piwa. Można rozpocząć zbyt nisko i nie zorientować się że te sztuczne smaki w nim kiedyś się rozwiną i powalą. 

Update. GENIALNE
