Aroma: picking up a lot of coffee, some licorice, vanilla and smoke (like in smoked meat). Smooth mouth feel! Taste: coffee, burned meat, vanilla and coffee. Quite bitter, seems to sweeten when temperature rise. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small bottle, deep black beer, almost purple deep brown head faded to nothing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted barley, dark fruits.
Taste is sweet coffee, vanillas, dried plum, molasses and burnt sugar. Palate is thick and rich, carbonation subdued. This is good, rich and roasty, but too sweet overall.
50 cl bottle from mikkeller shop. Batch 588 tapped 2011. Pours black with big brown head. Roasted coffee aroma with sweet coffee, cocoa and vanilla taste. Great balanced beer! Very rich and smooth.

I remember that last day of the 2014. We went to buy some nice beers. It was my first Mikkeller experience. WHAT A TRIP! I hade to share this with a friend and his father. We ended up stealing each other the last drop. A beer anthem! Later I noticed the most peculiar characteristic of this beer. Its made of weasel shit! The funny thing is that an exotic weasel is Vietnamese, and it eats the coffee beans to shit a variety called cà phê Chồn. One of the best coffees of the world.

Mikeller Brunch weasel its PURE CHOCOLATED ROASTED COFFEE. A superior taste and palate. Perfect, dense and permanent body. 

Try it bro!

Eleven dollar 11.2 oz bottle to snifter. Black, oily pour, thin tan head. Aroma of booze and coffee. Taste dominated by mostly coffee with medium carbonation. Bittersweet with some vanilla, roasted coffee and a good amount of booze coming through as it sits. Smooth, tasty and very satisfying.
Bottle - Pours dark brown with tan head. Nose is lots of coffee, roasty, chocolate. Taste is more coffee, creamy, roasty, dark chocolate. Its very rich.
Birra molto alcolica, con un aroma deciso, di sapore deciso e corposa sul palato, ottima da bere a cena, o in serata come ultima birra.

On tap at Ol & Brod, Copenhagen. Black with thick tanned head. Smell is heavy coffee and roasted malt. Taste is roasted malt and coffee and chocoalte. Semi dry with medium bitterness and low carbonation. Big body.

Bottle to snifter. Brown, black, oily pour, thin tan head. Super smooth, thick feel. Aroma and taste dominated by coffee and chocolate. Sweetness, some vanilla, little booze coming through as it sits.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft @ Beer Bar PCB. Crazy smooth decadent coffee, fudge, hint of vanilla, smooth roast, thick, thick palate. Awesomeness.
Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. pours dark brown with lasting creamy brownish head. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, some fruit. Sweet and bitter. Full bodied.

500 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a deep brown, almost black, with a one-finger brown head. Looks rich and viscous. Aroma of roasted malts and rich chocolate. Not so much coffee, really, which surprised me. 

The taste is very chocolatey as well, but with a prevalent coffee taste. The coffee isnt overwhelming at all. It allows the stout flavors to come through. There is a lingering bitterness that prevents the sweetness from becoming cloying. Great consistency. Medium carbonation. Par for the style. The mouthfeel is thick enough to feel like an imperial stout, but not so much that I couldnt put it away like nothing. High quality beer.

Very solid beer but to be honest, Im mystified at the very high rating. Dont get me wrong, its a very good beer and while solid all-around, is not particularly special. Slight coffee aroma, with dark our. Medium head, died down pretty quick. Good coffee stout taste but Ive had several better. Nice consistency, not thin.

Saw this on the menu at Brasserie V and had to get one. Slightly expensive at $13 a glass, but civet coffee is expensive. Black body. Huge chocolate coffee aroma. Big roasted coffee taste. Lots of chocolate flavor. The coffee taste is really good but different. Its a very earthy coffee.

Motor oil with thin tan head. Sipping on this for brunch between CFA studying and Tony Bs wedding. Life is good. Smells of cocal nibs. Strong coffee flavor that melts slowly on palate and rounds out to chocolate. Really good coffee flavor, not just coffee for sakes of coffee. Hides alcohol well. A trace of vanilla would have had me kick this up to 4.5 or 4.6, which is rare territory for me......(after reading the descripton, I cant believe I just drank poop)

Bottle from SlackerMads during European Swap 2/15, many thanks. Black color, minimal brown head. Aroma is dense and intensive, rich fruity with notes oft dark fruits, dried fruits, berries. Dark raspberry chocolate, cacao powder, light coffee notes. Flavor is also dense and velvety, vanilla, lots of fruity dark chocolate, cacao beans, espresso, some alcohol. Roasty bitter finish. Rich and very tasty.

Draft 6 oz pour at Special Brews. Pours black with a lasting tan foam head. Big chocolate vanilla aroma. Coffee bean flavor up front with a sweet creamy vanilla transition. Super smooth and easy drinking. Lingering mocha chocolate flavor. Incredible stout. Doesnt really taste heavy to me. Loved it.

This was poured into a snifter.
The appearance had a dark brown close to black color with no head nor lacing.
The smell was fabulous with an almost perfect combination of roasted coffee bean to a light milk chocolate and also a decent dark chocolate.
The taste was sweet and roasty pulling together rich roasty coffee notes into milk and dark chocolates finely. A light dry chocolate aftertaste leads to a slightly dry finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a good sipping quality about it. Alcohol really isnt felt, and the carbonation is fairly smooth.
Overall, imperialized oatmeal stout, if anything, well, the aroma and the taste are absolutely enthralling. Pretty sure I just love it for what it is and not necessarily for the style since honestly theres no such thing as an imperialized oatmeal stout.

Paid nearly $10.00 for this 11.2 oz bottle at 7/11 Kittery ME. Well, it does live up to the hype and price, cant believe it took me this long to try this! Aroma is real nice; deep roast, burnt espresso bean, earthy soil like note and unsweetened chocolate. 
The flavor has a nice amount of depth. It changes after some slow sips. Earthy coffee throughout, thick chewy oats that gives a hearty full body. The texture is dry roast with the alcohol letting you know it is here with a warming after the sip. Mild dark fruit hints. The roast, coffee, dark fruit and chocolate lingering for a good amount after the sip. Very savory and great, maybe just a tad overpriced because of the coffee beans.

Bottle. So good Ive got a cupboard full of them. Pours a perfect engine oil black with a bronze head. Aroma hums of coffee and roasted malt. So much flavour. Its a big stout. Coffee, chocolate, charcoal and vanilla. Its thick, boozy and incredibly complex. You couldnt tire of it.

Feline shit beer... interesting... pours almost pitch black, very thick and oily, barely any bubbles, just a thin ring of beige around the glass. Aromas of espresso, dark chocolate, nuts, cocoa, fudge, oats, perhaps a touch of cognac. The complexity and richness of this one is exceptional. Its like a chocolate brownie soaked in cognac-spiked coffee, but also with a lot of depth and other smaller aromas lurking behind it. Its medium sweet and bitter, well balanced without overwhelming any of the full flavour. Booze is barely noticeable. Full body; rounded, smooth, slick feel; long tasty finish. This is one of the very best.

On tap at Stoutfest during Seattle Beer Week. Everything about it was very impressive. Deep, rich and complex. Hint of tart but no fruit to speak of. Usually the coffee flavor in stouts is pretty basic but it was clear this coffee is different.
Draft pour at Brouwer?s Seattle beer week stout fest, this beer is awesome so smooth so much flavor, loved this beer, one of the best stouts. Try it if you can. A++
bottle pour. a good oatmeal stout with rich flavors, but i dont find it that different some other oatmeal stouts (Founders comes to mind).

Bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into a Duvel tulip. Pours a deep black with slight ruby highlights. Big coffee aroma with a huge chocolate fudge brownie aroma as well with a touch of dark fruit. Medium to full body with a mouthfeel somewhere between creamy and sticky. Sweet on the palate then ends a little boozy. Great big imperial stout with lots of flavor that picks up as it warms up to room temperature. Nice rich and smooth finish. A killer!

Bottle to tulip. Pours pitch black with a brownish-red head. Great laces. This beer smells like a chocolate factory. Lots of coffee and little bit of a leather smell. Plenty of wonderful booze notes as well. Definitely a bit of sweetness here. A bit bitter. Lots of wonderful chocolate and coffee notes. The beer tastes just like a chocolate malt with bourbon in it. Damn this is good. A sticky, deliciously bitter finish. Ill be heading back to the bottle shop to pick up lots more of this. Cheers.

Awesome beer for folks who like boozy beers. Chocolate, roast, sweetness, and coffee shine big in this beer. Lots of alcohol notes, but in a good way. Reminds me of a whiskey barrel aged imperial stout due to its roundness and sweetness, despite the high level of alcohol. Id love to try the barrel aged versions.

Bottle. Dark, almost pitch black pour with a mocha head that bubbled away relatively quickly. Slow cold drip coffee concentrate, syrup, caramel, oat. Smooth yet full and thick body that may require a spoon to drink. Perfect level of carbonation...not too much but enough to make it refreshing. Bitter, sweet and creamy. Like a perfect cup of coffee

Bottle; pours black with a thin mocha colored head; aroma coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt with a hint of dark fruit; taste is very smooth with coffee, roasted malt, and chocolate with hints of dark fruits and oats; finish is bitter coffee and dry; very nicely balanced and hides the alcohol; excellent beer

Undated bottle.
Glass: Duvel tulip.
Appearance: Black body with a dark tan head. The head is short and short lived though.
Aroma: A prominent aroma of wet dog, faint coffee and chocolate, both a bit stale with a bit of cracker and lactose. Possibly old.
Taste: Dark chocolate is mild but provides a dry bitter base with faint coffee and roasted malts, a hint of chocolate sweetness, but overall a bit stale and mild.
Palate: Full-bodied to thick, mild carbonation.
Overall: Possibly an old bottle, or this is much different than I remember. Either way I wont buy this again unless Im sure that its fresh.

Syrup liquid with tiny brown head. Non transparent at all, very dark. Noble chocolate is dominant plus civecats luxurious coffee, which I never tried, but I think I can say now what is the taste of it. Bitter sweet and strong in alcohol. Just a hint of liquorice and sultanas raisin - or not, I can not decide because od divine complexity born from unique simplicity. Very expensive, but I doubt this type if beer can be cheaper. Simply glorious.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2015 Bottle at Mikkeller Bar San Francisco. Black color with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Taste is cocoa, coffee, vanilla, warming finish. The booze only comes through there from time to time really. Super-silky mouthfeel, great aftertaste. Very rich. Amazingly balanced, albeit more edgy than other Beer Geeks, great brew! Again: Mikkel can brew things this balanced, it blows me away every time.

Bottle. Pitch black pour with tiny dark brown head that diminish fast. Aroma is intense with loads of liquorice, coffee and caramel. Still with a freshness to it. Taste is very balanced with no hints about the high ABV. Starts with some coffee and ends with a very long lasting liquorice note. Not sweet, not overly bitter, just very plesent and complex. Oily texture. Medium carbonation.

Wspaniały Imperial Stout. Idealnie zbalansowany, dominują nuty kawowe, czekoladowe, karmelowe, przez które przebija się lekka goryczka. Ciemne jak smoła i z takowym, smolistym ciałem. Gęsty killer, choć prawie 11% alku wyczuwalne nieznacznie tylko w aromacie. Jedno z droższych piw, jakie zakupiłem, ale warte swojej ceny.

Bottle from Koht. My first and last Kopi Luwak beer... Pours a reddish black colour with a brief tan head. Some tiny bits floating on the surface. Smells like raw coffee beans and chocolate - its really uplifting... sweet with some raw bitterness. Tastes... so full... chocolaty sweet, a lot of coffee bitterness, even a bit salty. Tingling alcoholic warmth in the throat. Sticky, but short of syrupy. Makes my lips stick on the glass. Vinous. Damn good.
Pretty smooth and delicious stout. Deep black pour - thick. Espresso and chocolate. Taste is decadent blend. Slightly sour finish. Balanced well, full bodied. Great!

Bottle, Malting Pot. Black, tiny brown head. Aroma coffee, wild cherries in alcohol. Very little carbonation, strong lacing. Taste follows the aroma - bitter, sweet&sour, finish distinctly bitter, mainly coffee. Very nice, but I preferred the Beer Geek Breakfast that I sampled recently.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, ladna drobnopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie kawa, czekolada, praliny belgijskie. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie plus wyrazny kwasny posmak kojarzacy sie z espresso

On tap @ Kufle i Kapsle. Pours pitch-black, small beige head. Aroma of coffee, marzipan, vanilla, chocolate candy bar. Feels almost as if it was barrel aged. In taste its sweet and chocolate-y. Velvety texture, full-bodied. Very drinkable. Great.

Have had twice on tap, twice in the bottle, all four times varied in milkiness, abundances of coffee, super milky, really tasty...if fresh one of the best if not the best..have to be careful as Ive purchased bad bottles.

Tap pour - nearly black, almost zero head. Aroma is toasted/roasted malt, sweet chocolate, mild coffee. Flavor is very smooth - coffee a bit more muted than I anticipated...malts bordering on burnt...very roasty. Very easy drinking brew with a moderately oily palate. Very nice beer overall.

330 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours an inky, nearly black dark brown with small brown head. Aroma is roasty with lots of treacle, anise, coffee and some dark fruit. Flavour is very rich and moderately roasty with treacle, anise and coffee very prominent and a subtler dark tree fruit note. Alcohol is quite well hidden for ABV. Impressive.

Probada en grifo en Barcelona Beer Festival. Una de las mejores Imperial Stouts que he probado, a pesar de estar muy mal tirada en BBF. amplio aroma y sabor a torrefacto, quizá en este caso el exceso de alcohol sea un defecto

26.2.2015. Black beer, no head. In aroma, first comes coffee beans, also roasted burnt malts. Taste has dark malts, coffee, roast, also sth spice almost like chili a bit, especially in the beginning. Milk chocolate, oats. Perfect balance.
Damp concrete nose. No head. Deep rich coffee earth on the balance supported by a blanket of richness to balance a slightly less than full body. Good

Bottle into a snifter. Pours a beautiful deep brown with a lasting caramel head. Love the coffee flavor, not too strong and not bitter. Almost a sweetness to the nose with a very pleasant finish, looking forward to enjoying this beer again next year. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Zupełnie czarne, obfita, ciemno brązowa piana, duże pęcherzyki i syczy. Szybo znika całkowicie.
Aromat: Espresso, gorzka czekolada, stęchlizna i lekki alkohol.
Odczucie: Pełne-, wysycenie niskie+, lekko gryzące
Smak: Czekolada, wiśnie, kawa i likier kawowy
Całość: Dobre ale liczyłem na coś zdecydowanie lepszego
Mam wrażenie, że coś lekko nie tak z tym piwem, co sugeruje sycząca piana, gorszy aromat. W porównaniu z pozostałymi beer geekami z serii wypada bardzo blado.

Strong bitter coffee aroma with slight chocolate mixed in too. Very dark brown color with not much head or lacing. Taste is of oatmeal, some vanilla, and coffee. Pretty thick mouthfeel with nice earthy bitter finish. Very well done stout!
Chocolate, coffee, a bit smokey flavor. Really thick oily character. Fresh a bit raw - but after a few months in bottle its velvety smooth. Hands down one of the best beers i have ever tried.

Tasted from draft at Hunahpu Day. Pours black with a dark brown head. Coffee and dark chocolate aroma is huge. Taste is incredible. Great coffee flavor throughout with dark chocolate and a little vanilla. Very smooth hiding the alcohol extremely well. Nice thick and oily mouthfeel. I've head several of the famous imperial stouts but I think this may be my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is just an amazing full of flavour imperial stout. Full body, black, brown head and a lot of coffee flavour. A must to try.

Jet black pour, very small khaki head. Aroma of roasted malts, strong coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and oats. Taste is bitter strong coffee, dark chocolate, oats, vanilla and milk. Mouthfel is thick, velvety and oily. Great feel and body. High abv well hidden. Very well done oatmeal stout. Very tasty.

drunk in beergeek with cam before going to see crowbar. this is what started our night. pours darkest brown, hardly any head. its slick and oily, no fizz. aroma of deep roasty coffee. taste is coffee, chocolate malt, slightly hoppy, moving to more bitter choco. traces of vanilla in there. like the other beergeek range it doesnt feel too heavy duty so i could pound it pretty quick. shit was deliciousssss

Inky black pour with a wee khaki head. Lovely nose with oats and chocolate and earthy roasty coffee and a soft yet strong mellowness. Lovely flavor with a black sweetness, some dark chocolate, a smooth finish, with some nice subtle yet balanced coffee notes throughout. Really somethin. A bit pricey, but with a well hidden booze behind some semisweet dark chocolate and a kiss of coffee, its somethin.

Bottle at the Syb Pig in Boca Raton. Pours a very deep black with a frothy mocha head. Powerful breakfast aromas of coffee, burnt malts, dark breads, graham cracker, vanilla. The taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla cream, slightly sweet milk, and dark fruits. Delicious finish of bitter coffee and roasted malts with some sweetness. The full body and thick mouth are on par for the style. Very very good.

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours pitch black with a creamy dark brown head. Aroma is espresso, chocolate, roasted malt, some vanilla. Flavour is medium sweet and rich coffee bitterness. Full bodied, smooth texture, soft carbonation. Finish is long a smooth with a pleasant bitterness.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours a very dark brown with little to no head. Carbonation is low with a full body. Aroma is vegemite and coffee mixed with dark chocolate. There's a hint of vanilla and some fruity hops. Taste begins fairly sweet and turns into chocolate. Coffee becomes evident at the end of the palate with a delicate and not over powering bitterness. There's some burnt notes, perhaps a slight hint of bourbon and some pine resin. Beautiful!

bottle at home, bought end of december in Prague. black color, very dark coffee colored head. very oily look, very strong coffee smell, milky creaminess. full body, strong coffee taste, some dried fruits, oily feel on the tongue, roasty bitter finish. quite good, but was expecting more.

Bottle 0.33l at Soljica coffee place Belgrade Serbia.Thank you Ljubo for sharing this bottle.Pour it thick dark color with no head.On the nose sweet dark fruits.Taste and aroma wau, kick of flavour, roasted coffee, roasted malt, plum, sweet cranberries, blueberry, dark chocolate.Perfect balanced.Perfection.

Dark and opaque in color. From bottle. No head. Strong coffee aroma and taste. Smells and finishes with the slight rum flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ basement beer bar.
Aroma of coffee, roasted burnt malt, booze. Black colour with small tan head, none lasting. Moderate sweetness, alcohol sweetness, malt bitterness. Full body, smooth texture, soft carbonation, sweet finish.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2015 Quite black appearance with barely any head. Has a complex taste of coffee, cocoa, caramel and dark rum. Heavy body, with great palate, and a great finish. The alcohol is definitely present, but doesnt obscure the other tastes

Opaque. Roast aroma, coffee. Roast malt. Heavy body, but not quite as viscous as Mikkeller George. Silky smooth flavors of dark sweet malt, coffee, vanilla meld nicely. Not overly bitter -- bitterness, roast and sweetness in good harmony. Clean finish. Super delicious!

Appearance is jet black, pours like thick syrup into the glass. No head at all. Aroma- rich chocolate cake, vanilla, dark coffee/espresso, fudge, booze, port, dark rum, dark fruit undertones, caramel. Taste- loads of chocolate, bitter coffee, caramel, burnt sugar, treacle, vanilla, hint of almond, tiramisu. Oily, syrupy mouthfeel, thick and dense, sweet booziness coats the tongue, almost chewy. A lasting, sweet finish. Just the right amount of sweetness. This is a sipper, and is exceptional.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Bottle at home alooone. Beautiful pitch black colour with a tan head. Rich, dark and smoky. Smooth coffee flavour balanced with dark chocolate and vanilla sweetness. Incredibly well balanced. Highly enjoyable :P

Bottle from Cornelius. Black body with a medium tan head that slowly fades. No lacing. Aroma of vanilla ice-cream, advent calendar chocolate, prunes and coffee. Flavour of nuts, milk chocolate, raisins, vanilla and Ferrero Roche. Full body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. Wonderful.

330ml bottle. Pours jet black with dark brown head. Aroma is coffee molasses licorice and soy sauce. Really full mouth feel. Velvety smooth texture. Does taste alcoholic. Plenty of burnt toast, coffee and a tangy, smooth, slightly sweet lovely finish.

Fantastic. Strong roasted and coffee aroma. Beautiful full and dark with a small ring that sustains, probably due to the oatmeal. Full-bodied but not syrupy. Sharp and dry finish. Bold flavors that blended nicely. Alcohol is well-hidden. Great sipping beer.

Black, oily. Small tan head. Strong aroma, coffee, roasted malt, brown sugar and licorice. Flavour has strong, bitter coffee with licorice notes. Mouthfeel is big, oily and sticky. Well balanced, strong and lasting bitterness combined with sweetness and relatively well masked alcohol. Very good.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Very sweet, luscious aroma of chocolate, molasses, warming alcohol and a touch of proper coffee.No berries or ripe fruit. If you really try, you can get some of that dry manure scent (that was so strong in De Molens Kopi Loewak). At this intensity it does feel somewhat pleasant. The taste is very sweet, sweet chocolate, roasted malts, a solid hop bitterness, warming alcohol. The body is smooth and creamy. Everything looks right, but it is mostly a well made impy, nothing earth shattering. The biggest disappointment, is the too faint coffee aroma. Still, a very good stout.

Rich lack pour with sixteenth inch of brown red head. Aroma of dark chocolate, rich bourbon, rich bourbon, oats, very rich bold coffee, dark fruits, carmel. Softer carbonation, creamy light mouthfeel, very clean finish. Strong rich bold flavor with boozy rich bourbon, bitter espresso, smokey dark chocolate, vanilla. Yowzers this is good.

Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, soft dark malts, roastyness, sweet wort, dark rye bread. Mouthfeel is full with flavors of chocolate ice cream, coffee, oatmeal, sweet wort and a nice balanced bitterness. This beer is simply put; Amazing!

Beer Geek Brunch Weasel
Bottle 0.33 bought in Mikkeller bottle shop in Copenhagen
appearance: very dark brown, solid, pours with no head at all which was quite disappointing, thick, oily texture
nose: intense amazing coffee aroma, dark chocolate, cocoa, decent good quality alcohol
mouthfeel: oily, full bodied, nearly no carbonation, extremely long and delightful bittersweet finish with espresso-like acidicy
taste: reminds me kahlua, espresso, extra-dark chocolate, rum, sweetness perfectly balanced with pleasant bitterness and acidic coffee taste
overall: exquisite beer one can linger over for a long time deriving enjoyment with every little sip, minus for disappointing looks with literally no head

Oily deep black coloured, small brown head that went away fast, pure coffee nose. Roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate with notes of alcohol and cocoa powder. Coffee finish of course. Smooth and easy-drinkable
Medium sweet, lots of roasted malts, lots of coffee, chocolate, liqourice, molasses/soy, bit of dark dried fruit and a long dry bitter finish. Amazing!

Bottle at The Beer Kitchen in Kansas City. Pours a dark black to brown with a thin mocha head. I had high expectations and for the most part this did not disappoint. Aroma is coffee dark chocolate and some roast. Flavor is lots of dark chocolate with slight roast. Excellent but not quite up to the hype or price. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma excelente y penetrante. Notas intensas a café y grano tostado abundan en nariz. Ligeramente también se perciben aromas ahumados y a roble.

Su apariencia es completamente la de una stout. Un color Negro que bien podría compararse al petróleo. Cuerpo robusto, carbonatacion prácticamente nula. Corona de espuma ligera, color café muy obscuro, de nula retención.

En boca es suave, intensa, deliciosa.

Al paladar es una cerveza compleja, pero excelente. Al primer trago es suave y aterciopelada. Equilibrada entre un ligero dulzor y un sofisticado amargor. En garganta se percibe la intensidad del café, que finaliza con un agradable y ligero amargor proveniente del café utilizado. Al final se perciben las notas ahumadas, casi tostadas.

En resumen es una joya de cerveza. Equilibrada, agradable, sabores excelentes, deliciosa, aroma completo, sabor balanceado. Simplemente genial.

12 oz bottle, brewed at Lervig. Pours deep brown with s medium brown head. Aroma is caramel, coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, molasses, coffee. Unsweet chocolate bitter in the finish.
Poured from bottle with a dark chocolate color and a thin brown head. Aroma is slightly smoky with hints of coffee and chocolate. Mouth feel is smooth and coats the palate with a nice coffee finish.

Love it. Lots of coffee aroma against the standard smokey chocolate and berry maltiness of a stout. Strong but not boozy. Could only have one at a time but this is just how a coffee stout should be done.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Black opaque colour with thiny light brown creamy head with moderate lasting. Carbonation is slow. Aroma is very distinctive and specific: alcohol is present, but over it prevails divine aroma of coffee, and other fruity esters. Taste is sweet, with notes of chocolate, coffee and other malts. Hop Bitterness is restrained, because of high malt sweetness.
full, mout-coating body, low carbontion, long lasting sweet finish.
 Very dense beer. One of my favourites.
FIRST RATE: 9-5-10-5-18=4.7

MY SECOND RATE: 3 bottles without head! on 4.3.2015: 8-3-10-5-18=4.4

MY THIRD RATE: pours oily black color with absolutely no head. Big surprise. Carbonation is visualy low with slow rising small bubbles.
Aroma is marvellus: without note of an alcohol, namely presence of coffee and vanilla is too strong, but somewhere in the background are hints of cognac, rhum, brandy...
Flavor: sweet, smooth, with notes of coffe, vanilla, hints of dark chocolate, brandy, whiskey, oat, molasses, dried dark fruits. Bitterness come from dark chocolate and especially from american hops (fruity notes).
Texture is silky smooth, body is sticky, malt sweetness is medium to high, hop bitterness is medium. Finish is dry sweet and long lasting, carbonation is low.
3rd RATE after several bottles: 8-5-10-5-18=4.6

Aroma is coffee, mocha, chocolate, espresso, vanilla and light hop clove and earthiness. Taste is a bitter/rich roasted maltiness. Chocolate and mocha definitely present here but the earthy bitterness and alcohol burn dominates and streals slightly from the deep malt profile. Appearance is a clear black body with a medium creamy head that retains fairly well.

Split a 11.2oz bottle? in half. Poured a ver pitch black color, like smooth oil. Small tan head. Aroma is lots of coffee, toffee, oats, licorice. Flavor is pretty tasty, lots of smooth coffee notes, vanilla finished by plenty of booze at the end. Im not sure poop coffee is really what I want to be drinking though. At least from what Ive read theyre getting it humanely, though thats the extent of what Ive read about the matter. I think Im going to steer far away from this trendy hipster gimmick in the future unless someone else is paying.

damn expensive bottle of dark liquid that has a unique aroma and flavor that stays in the memory. Definitely superior Imperial Stout, brewed in Norway by Nogne. Superior thing comparable to the best American examples of IS.
Prunes, coffee, oatmeal. Pleasant aroma, the taste is not too interesting for me. Good, but not incredible

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 330 ml bottle at CK. Pours black with a brownish head. Aroma is hazelnut, coffee, cocoa, and a bit smoke. Flavor is dark chocolate, loads of coffee,, smokey and hazelnut. 

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of soy, licorice, heavy roast, coffee, cocoa, linger in heavy toffee. Taste is heavy sweet with loads coffee, licorice. Heavy and savory. Very heavy

33cl flesje bij Zeezicht, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 10,9%
Uitgeschonken in blanco bokaal

Uiterlijk: zwart met luchtige crèmelaag die daarna snel wegtrekt

Aroma en smaak: koffie, chocolade, warm van de alcohol, bitter, gebrande mouten

Conclusie: blij dat ik dit speciale bier ben tegengekomen. Normaal dus in Scandinavië te krijgen. Weet nu waarom deze zo'n hoge rating heeft, geweldige stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black with a brown sparkling head that dissipates into the dark void in a matter of seconds. Intense aroma of dark roasted coffee, sweet licorice and some alcohol. Full body, creamy feel, soft carbonation. Rich and smoky flavour of the darkest chocolate imaginable, coffee that would wake you right up in the morning and a hint of cough drop for good measure. Long finish with a deliciously subdued bitterness. Love it!

Noire comme de lencre et surmontée dune infime couche de mousse brune qui ne tient aucunement en place, la bière dégage des arômes de café assez décadents, incluant son aspect végétal. La faible carbonatation est jumelée à lajout davoie forment une texture onctueuse et liquoreuse en bouche. Au départ, le goût de café et son amertume dominent outrageusement, mais au fur et à mesure que la bière tempère, des notes chocolatées et sucrées atténuent cette astringence. Lalcool apporte une chaleur réconfortante qui soutient très bien toutes ces saveurs puissantes.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This inky black beer has dark brown highlights and pours with absolutely no head. It has very rich chocolate praline flavours, vanilla and coffee notes with liquorice and more super rich Belgian chocolate on the spicy red fruity finish. Excellent!

Smells of bitter chocolate & has a huge chocolate taste, surprisingly more than coffee. It is like drinking smooth, 85% cocoa chocolate with some coffee in the complex, caramel finish. A lot less dry than some of the other Beer Geeks I've had but all the better for it. No wonder this has become a modern classic!

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a deep viscous black burgundy with no head and low carb. Arina is strong fine espresso with sone cocoa treacle a d salty notes. Flavor is rich bitter coffee with vanilla and torrified coffee very intense but balnced. Medium to heavy palate. Super complex but still quite drinkable.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours a level of black that should probably emit Hawking radiation, while forming a very thin, very dark brown head that dissipates quickly and leaves no trace at all - no cap, no ring, maybe a couple stray bubbles temporarily along the sides of the glass. In other words, nothing escapes it. Im guessing its somewhat high gravity. (These jokes should all go under one of Mikkellers other beers, but they fit better with the appearance of this one.)

S: The aroma, which somehow manages to escape the event horizon of the beer surface, strikes up front as sweet with dark fruitiness throughout. Both roasted chocolate malt and sweeter notes are present, as one would expect from an oatmeal stout. Fruity notes include plums, figs, and currants. Despite one of the main ingredients, I detect no litterbox odors - perhaps those simply arent shunted away from the singularity during dilation. Oddly enough, I get little to no coffee odor as well.

T: Unexpectedly, this beer did not tear my tongue apart and then crush it into an infinitesimally tiny ball of matter, so thats a plus. Toffee and chocolate malts strike up front, joined shortly by a quick rush of more fruity notes ranging from plum to currant. As the beer moves along the palate, an earthy, burnt bitter flavor swirls in to conceal the rest, which in turn yields to an almost pure coffee taste at the finish. A pleasant roasted coffee aftertaste lingers well after the swallow, markedly less bitter than any other coffee I have tasted aside from pure Kona coffee in Kailua-Kona itself.

M: Smooth and silken, with scarcely any carbonation to be found nor tasted - literally just enough to leave the beer not feeling dead and lifeless in the mouth. Its not the heaviest oatmeal stout Ive ever tasted, which is surprising given the amount of mass it should have, but it compares decently to others in the style.

O: Eminently drinkable, this hides its ABV well behind a wall of shifting flavor complexity. I would consider buying again. One could say it has a powerful attractive force. All right, Ill knock off the lame black hole jokes. Suffice it to say, despite being made with crap, this is far from a crappy beer.

Draft at BD Shoreditch 22/11/13, bottle at home 5/7/14. Pours daaark brown, small head dies off. Amazing intense sweet coffee roast chocolate aroma, so good. Intense rich sweet molasses vanilla chocolate, then bitter coffee, some hop bitterness too, great depth, a touch of acidity too. Big body, silky smooth. This is one of my very favourite beers, I love it.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with a brownish head. Aroma is hazelnut, coffee, cocoa, tobacco and smoke. Flavor is dark chocolate, loads of coffee, tobacco, smokey and hazelnut. Finish is bitter, roast, some fruits, tart. Full body, velvety, oily mouthfeel, weak carbonation. Wow, just wow!

Aroma: coffee, spice, cocoa, milk, red berries; Appearance: dense dark brown, vanishing minimal frothy brown head; Taste: intense bitterness, medium sweetness, slight sourness; Palate: long finish, thick texture, soft carbonation, medium body

A complex, multifaceted beer. Could be just a bit thicker and the bitterness from alcohol is a slightly discouraging at start.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 Bottle from De Hopduvel, Gent, Belgium. I loved this one better than the breakfast version. Less coffee aroma/flavour. However that strong coffee aroma is still there. Smell of coffe is cool but not for a beer. Imperial Russian Stout from Emelisse is still better than this one. 




This imperial Oatmeal stout is brewed with one of the worlds most expensive coffees, made from droppings of weasel-like civet cats. The fussy Southeast Asian animal are picky and will eat nothing but the best and ripest coffee berries. Enzymes in their digestive system aid the process of breaking down the beans which brews a strong, fist-in-the-air flavored coffee.
Who wouldve thought drinking beer that started its journey travelling through the insides of a weasel, would taste this good?

Color negro intenso. Espuma compacta, oscura y cremosa. Aroma a café. El sabor es intenso, con matices de chocolate y café. Buen cuerpo y un final amargo y seco. Excepcional. Ideal para después de la cena.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2016 0.3 flaske fra polet. Svart med mørkt skum. Aroma av kaffe brent malt. Smak av kaffe. Kraftig ettersmak. Litt bitter. Lite co2

Pour from a bottle is dark chocolate with a dark tan head. Aroma is a sweet aroma with hints of chocolate and a little coffee. Taste is a little sweet that gives way to a little bitterness from the coffee. Leaves a dry after taste.
Bottle, 33cl. Nice coffee aroma. Black! Thick, creamy. Strong taste of coffee, medium bitterness. Fresh.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

(On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Nov 16 2014) Pours inky black with a small dark tan head that faded to a ring with a bit of lace. Aroma is powerfully strong, pungent coffee, rich dark bittersweet chocolate, sweetish dark malts with hints of dark fruit, a bit spicy. Flavour is as youd expect after the nose, excellent. Rich, driven by big fairly roasty coffee, dark chocolate core, a little sweet, rather earthy, hints of dark, getting slightly bitter towards the finish with loads of coffee, vanilla, bit of that creamy oat character, moderately roasty. Lingering coffee that seems to last on and on, with persistent chocolate as well. Rich, full creamy mouthfeel, thick from the oats, light carb, no alcohol. Superb coffee imperial stout, the ca phe chon really adds something with its pungency and slightly unusual flavour profile. So drinkable, with layers that I know would reward a sampling on its own rather than in a night of beers. Must drink.
En flott stout! Snublet over denne på polet, og det var den siste flasken de hadde. Et særdeles heldig funn. Anbefales på det sterkeste!

This is another incredible beer from mikeller nice chocolate and sweet flavor. Had a draft pour at three floyds brewery. Pours black with a reddish tan head. Super easy to drink for the alcohol content 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong fresh coffee beans aroma. Jet black in colour with a rapidly disappearing head. Very strong black coffee flavour with malty notes. A touch of bitterness in the finish.

Nice stout with a strange story, look up civecat. Bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours deep black with a tan head. Aromas of fresh roasted coffee with flavors of black coffee, toasted oats, and dark fruits. Semi oily body, low carbonation and bitter finish. Paired with a bourbon ball.
Ottima imperial stout con note principalmente di caffè che emergono. Unottima alternativa al caffè dopo cena !!! Non proprio lideale per un brunch però !!!
Attraverso la notte impenetrabile di questa imperial stout, una cascata di note di caffé sfumate di cacao invade il palato, esaltata da un corpo pieno e denso e note calde. Ottimerrima!

Bottle form Beergium.com. Smell of vanilla and coffee. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste has massive vanilla together with coffee and chocolate. Palates is nice and thick, very pleasant. Overall a solid stout. Worth a try.
Magisk ikke noe annet å sei . Helt fantastisk . Lang varierer smak og en behagelig smak som vare I et minutt
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Black with slightly brown edges. Nose has bread, chocolate and coffee notes. Full bodied, flavors like aromas and lenghty tasty finish. Really good in all aspects.

Dark brown color with reddish hue, thin brown head that quickly disappeared. Full body, soft carbonation. Huge chocolate aroma, coffee, roasted malt. Creamy and smooth texture. Complex as hell. Awesome.
Fantastic complexity. Dark coffee, cacao, sultanas raisin, cinnamon. Well balanced, round very full body. Spetacular!
Bottle 0,33l. Thick dark liquid with dark unsteady foam. Full body, light carbonation. Rich chocolate taste without sourness, taste like spoon of Kras Express. Really great one.

Bottle. Pours a near black color with a moderate brown head on there. Nose has some licorice to it like a RIS, and has a lot of bitter dark roasty coffee to it. Taste is very chocolatey and quite roasty, with just a hint of bitter. Such a great beer...

Absolutely impenetrably black with a thick oil slick of coffee coloured head and a tapestry of lace down the side of the glass, clinging rigidly. The aroma is of intense freshly ground coffee, cola nut, lemon zest, grated dark chocolate, elderberries, carob (I hate carob), iron filings and redwood shavings. The smell is rich, complex, edifying. The immediate impression when drinking is how viscous and oily this beer is before the flood of classic dark beer flavours, all listed in the aroma. It is somewhat sweet and definitely warming. Those complex flavours coming together in a symphony... a symphony of... you know the bit where in the Witches of Eastwick where the school orchestra finally gets its act together and performs in perfect unison? The finish just has to be tasted to be described - the gentle pinch of astringent coffee along with some dusty cocoa and cocoa butter and an overwhelming urge to lean back in my chair, cast my eyes skyward and thank the Almighty. 
This is testament to everything going right in a brewery.
coffee, coffee, vanilla, smoke, black, hazy, minimal head, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, flat, long finish, bitter,

Bottle shared at home. Color: dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: high malty nose with high sugar concentration. Very expressive. Notes of vanilla and coffee. Taste: high malty taste with high sugar concentration on mouth. Notes of brown sugar and caramel. Aftertaste: dry sensation and notes of calvados and coffee taste finish.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a medium mocha head. Aromas of toffee, coffee beans, dark chocolate, slight sweet dark fruits, some malt. Taste is strong roasted coffee up front, some malty sweetness, dark fruits, dates, some woody notes, bitter dark chocolate.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Very dark brown opaque color with thin beige head. Aroma is extremely intense, with lots of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, wood and slightly hops. Taste is sweet, liquorice and smoky, with tones of coffee, chocolate, malts, slightly vanilla, toffee and caramel. Long aftertaste, sweet, dry and bitter. Gigantic!
Draft. Pours nearly completely black. Has fantastic aromas of coffee flavors, creamy sweetness, deep roasted malts and bitter chocolate. Very complex and pleasant. Its almost perfect balanced.

Pours nearly completely black, with a small, fizzy head, disappearing soon, while leaving no lacing.

Has fantastic, multi-layered aromas of coffee flavors, creamy sweetness, deep roasted malts and bitter chocolate, accompanied by a burning alcohol layer. Very complex and pleasant, with coffee being the most dominant ingredient.

Toffeeish, earthy malts go along with distinct coffee flavors, which hit the palate in an incredible smooth, creamy fashion. Coffee then turns bitter, overcoming the milk chocolate note more and more. While the brew actually begins sweeter than expected, the sweetness doesnt take over the whole palate, due to the rich coffee infusion. Also the coffee bitterness is very balanced, as a strong earth maltiness holds it at bay. The most surprising aspect is the incredible smoothness in this brew, making this the perfect pairing for e.g. a fruity chocolate cake, providing the creaminess for both, cake and brew. Alcohol is very well integrated in this complex tasting beer, adding to the bitter coffee sting, without being detectable on its own.
Draft->snifter at Churchkey (then at The Partisan). Black with small lite brown head. Loads of coffee and cocoa. Rich, creamy, complex. Outstanding.
Bottle. Im not usually an imperial drinker. This big beer with 10.9%ABV is a great coffee beer. The alcohol is not overpowering but a warming end.

This is simply one of the best stouts that I had. Great mouth feel, rich taste and strong coffee flavor without being bitter or dry. Alkohol is strong but well contained and it fits well. What a beer.

Deep,very intense coffee taste, nice aroma, dark brown head...the special ingrediant really ads a different dimension. Special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

To piwo przypomina że nie tylko chmiel ale i kawa jest gorzka - połączenie obydwu w stoucie dało wspaniały rezultat. Nie ma co się rozpływać nad aromatami - są to kawa, zboże i paloność. W smaku obfita kawa, chlebowość, ciemne pieczywo jakby chleb litewski bo słodowość kontruje. I to jest ten smak - chleba litewskiego właśnie. Cholernie przyjemne. Oleista konsystencja wyborna do tego stylu i do tego alkohol odczuwalny - ale jak na 11% to dobrze przykryty smakiem dominującym. Jedno z najlepszych i najstaranniej uwarzonych piw. Polecam.

Bottle. Black as night and with little carbonation. Aromas of instant coffee, tar, rubber, alcohol. The taste is almost overpowering; strong coffee dominates an intensely rich blend - or should I say roast? A treat!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Bottle shared with Vestergaard. Pours pitch thick black with tiny brown head. Aroma is fruity coffee berries. Citric espresso, dark chocolate and burnt figs. Taste is really balanced. Dark chocolate, vanilla. awesome mouthfeel and the smooth carbonation spreads all the flavor. Really creamy body, bit sugary. So much rich chocolate. Roasty coffee finish. Well composed.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2016 500ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a deep black oily color forming a medium and solid dark beige to brown head. Medium retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass. 
S: Throws off a bouquet of coffee and dark chocolate. Hints of licorice, oak, vanilla and earth. Roasted malts and herby hops. Hints of alcohol. 
T: Follows the nose. Strong notes of roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate. Sweet upfront followed by an intense bitterness. A mix of roasted malts and grassy hops. Notes of licorice and vanilla. 
M: Absolutely creamy, heavy and molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Bitter dark chocolate in the aftertaste. 
O: Very drinkable. Masterpiece Imperial Stout. 
[ BA Review @ 4/9/2012 ]

Bottle. Jet black pour with a dark tan head. Aromas of coffee, roasted malts, molasses, and cocoa. Flavor is big coffee and roasted malts with chocolate undertones. Very robust. One of the best impy stouts Ive had to date. This was just fantastic.
This is THE BEST Imperial Stout Ive drunk so far. Extremely aromatic, marvelously tasting. Coffee, black malts, hops. Everything on right place. Perfection!
Very dark, smells slightly roasted with a hint of alcohol. Taste is mildly burned with nice coffee and chocolate notes. Surprisingly unbitter. Very nice.

Theres something about beers with ca phe chon coffee that I dont find that pleasant (in addition to the fact that the poor civets that digested the coffee beans probably were force-fed and not treated very nicely). They all seem to have a raw, green and vegetal feel that I dont find in beers based on other types of coffee. The Beer Geek Brunch Weasel has the same thing, both in the very strong aroma and the equally strong flavour. It is also a bit one dimensional, its very coffee dominated hardly without any other elements, except some dark roasted malt and dark caramel. It looks black in the glass, and the tiny, fizzy, brown head disappears completely in no time. The mouthfeel is pleasant, its a full-bodied brew with an oily to creamy texture and soft carbonation. Despite all my complaints: its of course a very good beer, just not at the very top, and I prefer regular coffee beans in my imperial stouts. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 5 months after brewing, courtesy of my little brother]

A black imperial oatmeal stout with brown low head and weasel coffee.
Powerfyl aroma of coffe, malt, liqourice. Taste is bitter. Exciting beer.

Pours an opaque, very dark brown color with a dark taupe head with a reddish hue. Not a huge nose on this one. Pretty unassuming. A rich smoky character and some fig. Thick and coating mouthfeel. Moderately smoky, some coffee, figgy fruitiness, some chocolate ice cream.
Really nice coffee stout. Nice maltiness, some liquorice and the usual roasted tastes. Growed at higher temp.

YES! Now this how its done. Flavour all the way from the tip of the tongue to the back of throat. Balanced bitterness. Just the right amount of sweetness. Full bodies. Weasel droppings aside. Nearly perfect.

Great googlie mooglile! My my my... a wondrous beer to paint with. Well, im not painting with the beer... but with paint. Yeah. Thars it. One of the few beers that i have enjoyed that has coffee in it. Somelevel headed brewer must have some sense. Groove to the beernutfor the bottle!

Pours a solid inky black (without even a hint of colour round the margins) with two fingers of dense chocolate brown head diminishing gradually to a half finger cap, moderate lacing. Nose is dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate, with a hint of café latte milkiness and maybe some dark fruit. Taste is dark roasted malt, rich coffee, perhaps a hint of liquorice and only a very mild, very late bitterness. Full bodied and viscous, with mild sustained carbonation and a smooth finish.

Wow. I didnt realize before tasting this, that the titular weasel was the civet cat, and that this is basically made with kopi leuwak. And it shows - theres no bitterness or astringency from the coffee at all. In fact, theres very little bitterness at all, despite the rich coffee flavour. I keep waiting for the bitterness to hit, and it just doesnt. The bitterness is not the only thing thats conspicuously absent here, either: the ABV is utterly and completely missing. This thing is nearly 11%, and it drinks like a cup of coffee. One could get in a great deal of trouble with this exceedingly dangerous beer... were it not roughly as expensive as unicorn blood - or, given the colour, printer cartridge ink...

Has a little age on it, still doing great. Poured black with a light brown head. Has a really nice, solid hoppiness, great balance to the coffee and chocolate. Super smooth bigger medium body. Fantastic coffee and chocolate aroma. Delicious.

Rich and delicious, creamy, roasty, slightly dry and bitter finish.
Grass, bittersweet coffee, complex, interesting.
Oily dark brown body with small tan head. Strong coffee aroma, cocoa beans, dark fruits, a bit smoked, roasty, peppery, you can sense some alcohol. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Pretty good.

Bottled 330ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Oily deep black coloured, small brown head that went away fast, pure coffee nose. Roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate with notes of alcohol and cocoa powder. Coffee finish of course. Smooth and easy-drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Color is completely dark. Huge brown head. Looks delicious. Strong coffee, cocoa and roasted malts aroma. Coffee notes seemed a little bit unordinary, now i see its a coffee from Vietnam. Some sugar. Alcohol is noticeable only in aroma, but not in taste. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy and oily texture. Almost spectacular. (Svijet Piva 0,33l bottle)
Bottle, 330 ml, brewed at Lervig Aktiebryggeri. Pitch black with creamy brown head. Very rich and pleasant taste, mainly of coffee. One of my new favourite beers.

Deep, thick body with an amazing dark, creamy head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate; alcohol maybe too present, imho. Strong palate, definitely worfh of its style; low carbonation but impressive, complex and long lasting finish. Taste is coffee, chocolate; outmeal also present, as dark fruits and smoke.

Megjelenés tekintetében a szokásos imperial stout tulajdonságokat eleveníti meg, motorolajszerű sűrűség, éjfekete szín és kakaó barna hab tökéletes egyvelege alkotja kinézetét. Illata száraz faháncs és falevelek, különleges fűszerezésű, édesített kávé aromája, az utóbbi összetevő jelenléte tehát különösebb szakértelem nélkül is könnyűszerrel megállapítható - ízének selymes, olvadékony és szikrázóan intenzív, pikáns bevezetője, majd szénné égetett cukorkás, keserédes, fás, és kávészemekkel körbeszőtt jegyei azonban önmagukban nem igazolják kellőképpen a felhasznált alapanyag exkluzív jellegét. Szakavatott kávéfogyasztók valószínűleg elismerően csettintenének a cibetmacska névjegyének felbukkanása láttán, a sör-ínyencek azonban minden bizonnyal egy fajsúlyos, különleges és semmihez nem fogható sör körvonalait vélik felfedezni fogyasztása során, aminek minden egyes fázisa egy gasztronómiai élmény, legyen szó a karcosan megkapó illatokról, vagy éppen a megnyerően induló, szigorúvá fejlődő és mégis tökéletesen kerek, masszív ízélményről.
This is one tasty beer! It has a strong chocolate oatmeal flavor to it and a coffee after taste.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 Bottle, 330 ml. Pours jet black with no head whatsoever. Aroma absolutely dominated by strong, black coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts, with perhaps a little hint of caramel underneath all of this. Taste is notably more complex, with all flavours mentioned above finding themselves joined by a good deal more caramel, some significant dark fruity notes as well as others such as strawberry, cereal, honey and vanilla. No alcohol detectable until the warmth kicks in Sweetness of the chocolate, fruity notes are balanced out brilliantly by the bitterness of the coffee and the roasted malts, and the whole thing just tastes incredibly rich and complex, to the point where I could probably pick out yet more flavours on future tastings. An absolute joy on the palate too, being as thick and oily as the pitch black colour would suggest, and yet somehow with just the tiniest bit of carbonation (unless Im imagining things). Just superb stuff all-round, and pretty much the perfect dessert beer.

Pours pitch black, with a dark brown head. Aroma is rich coffee. Taste is roasted malts, lots of coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla. Full body. Creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Very complex beer. Long bittersweet coffee finish. Excellent beer.

Poured from a 341cc bottle. Shared with ML & JB. Pours opaque black/brown with a generous tan head. Aroma is expresso, dark chocolate, chile pepper, and burnt malts. Flavour is dark dried fruit, fig, molasses, dark malts, chocolate, and coffee.

Bottled. Pours absolutely pitch black. Tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate, rich maltiness. Flavor is chocolate and big coffee. It is perhaps the most coffee flavor Ive ever tasted in a beer. Very bitter coffee. Very good, but very intense.

500ml bottle. Black in colour, long lasting tan head, excellent lacing. Aroma is sweet, roasty, light alcohol, chocolate, espresso. Flavour starts of incredibly sweet, lots of Creme Brulee to start but that changes to a roasty - chocolate espresso bitterness. Sweet/bitter mouthfeel, medium body, high carbonation.
Finishes long sweet then bitter. This starts of really sweet, Creme Brulee sweet. That changes to an espresso bitterness for the rest of the time. As this warms it nears unbearable in terms of sweetness.

Bottle. Flown all the way from Copenhagen. Thanks muzz. Jet black, mocha coloured head that dissipates quickly. Medium lacing. Aromas of espresso, vanilla, dark chocolate, ever so slight whiff of smoke and some citrus. Rich espresso flavours up front, followed by citrus hop bitterness, coffee acidity, vanilla and big roasty finish with significant bitterness. The heavy alcohol is barely detectable. Perhaps a little hop forward through the middle for me, but a delicious, complex beer.

33 cl bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits for $9.99. Thick black appearance with a lingering brown head and light lacing. Aroma and flavor of coffee, molasses, dark chocolate, roasted malts and earthy bitterness. Mild to medium sweetness. Full bodied with a nice thick mouth feel. The coffee aspect is mild. Pretty good stuff overall.

Bottle. Dark black bodie with nice brown not very long lasting head. Aroma is coffee roasted malts, vanilla and some cocoa. Taste is roasted malts with some bitter Espresso some caramell some vanilla and some dried fruits. Very rich and complex taste. Aftertaste is bitter with bitter coffee and hints of sweetness. I think the bottle was a little bit to fresh, it would be more balanced in a year or so.

12oz bottle. Pours black with a very thin, tan head. Aroma has huge notes of dark chocolate, roasted malts, and coffee. Almost like cookie dough. Taste is a big espresso bitter. Big dark chocolate and milk chocolate, coffee, and espresso aftertaste. Slight alcohol warmth. Full body with a medium carbonation. Big full mouth feel. Almost syrupy but not sweet. Overall very nice. Huge chocolate and coffee flavours with a massive, full mouth feel. Awesome!

Pours a black brew with a small brown head with no retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with dark chocolate, coffe, coffe grains, caramel, dark fruits and oak , full bodied, very smooth,flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a bitter finish and a long aftertaste. Good balance, Excellent beer.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 Black colour and a massive, coffee-coloured head. Full aroma of roasted malts and coffee. The taste is a striking mixture of a full, bitter hop flavours, sweet oatmeal, and dark chocolate, dried fruit and coffee. Very full, extremely complex and smooth, with excellent balance. The finish is the longest I have experienced. The taste lingers in the mouth for an age. The beer continues to improve in the glass as it warms.
This example was brewed at the Lervig brewery and from a 33cl bottle. A wonderful, characterful beer.

Bottle. Black with a creamy light-brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, burnt breadish, rich and inviting in the way that a dark alleyway in a good dream is inviting. The flavour has notes of vanilla, sweet chocolate, flipping over to a massive dark roast coffee side with dark roast to burnt malts and bitter cocoa. Creamy and full texture, this beer also has a drinkability that is at odds with its complex palate. Rich, refined, and smooth, magnificent stuff.

Nose is coffee roast and brownie. Flavor is mild sharp bitterness, soft cherry acidity, silky chocolate, warming alcohol presence, char, mild ashy quality. Finishes prettty dry, smooth oaty mouthfeel.

Brewed at Lervig. Black. Quickly diminishing brown head. Aroma of roasted barley, dark chocolate and strong coffee. Also a hint of dark caramel and dates. Full, and similar taste and aftertaste, superbly balanced with bitterness. An enourmously enjoyable beer, still having a good drinakbility despite its strong taste and high ABV

Mine says brewed at Lervig, not Nogne. Maybe it has changed recently. Better than the Austmann stout I just had. The head looks a bit cheap, its not thick and it disappears quickly. Very much coffee and bitter.

poured black like motor oil with no head. Smells of coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, tobacco and soy sauce. Tasted bitter with lots of bold roast coffee and tobacco, and a little alcohol burn. Bottle was a year old. I would expect this to be creamier with the Oatmeal, but still very good.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. Pitch black, thick brown head disappearing fast. Nose is sweet dark caramel, coffee and burnt wood. Taste is very complex, bitter burnt notes yet sweet and very drinkable. Fullbodied, but finishes quite dry.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2015 Apparently this is the one with the famed loewak coffee beans, making it an exclusive luxury stout... Danish oatmeal / coffee stout brewed in Norway. Thin, tanned head, colour straightforwardly black. Complex aroma of indeed coffee beans, although I am not capable of determining whether it be loewak coffee or regular coffee; also vanilla, dates, bayleaf, leather, bitter chocolate, caramel and toasted bread; taste a profound maltiness, bit caramelly, chocolatey, coffee, middle a bit sweeter and fruitier, in the finish the roasted bitterness takes over with loads of coffee, long and dry; mouthfeel grainy yet silky thanks to the oatmeal. Very interesting to finally get the change to taste this exclusivity, but I fail to see a good reason to add such expensive coffee instead of any other one - I guess this would be more of interest to coffee connoisseurs.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 A lot of coffee and chocolate. Quite low roast, and not very full, quite dry. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and licorice. A bit earthy. A bit too easy and not enough roast, could maybe be a bit sweeter aswell.

330 ml bottle at home, brewed at Lervig. Black color with nice beige-brown head. Aroma is mostly coffee and hops. Roasted malty, some dark chocolate and a little bit alcoholic. Taste is sweet at the beginning but it becomes bitter quite fast. Lots of of coffee and chocolate. Full body with very nice silky mouth-feel, soft carbonation, long bitter coffee and light alcoholic finish.

I wasnt sure what to expect here. Such a hyped beer, extreme ravings, yet also a brewer that is being criticized more and more and indeed I am not always a big fan. This, though, seems to be one of the brews by which Mikkel can still be counted among the best craft brewers in Europe. It is not only the rich aromas which combine powerful malts and chocolate with earthy coffee and a surprisingly balanced appeal. It is not even the strong, mouth filling yet deeply satisfying taste of chocolate malts, well hidden alcohol warmth and long, long finish of bitters. The real standout for the is the way this beer looks and feels. One of the most luscious beers I have even seen and a velvety smooth palate, softly carbonated, never too sticky though and with a drinkability of something much less complex. Amazing recipe, very well executed too. Yes, sometimes this brewer still hits a home run, I think. (33cl bottle from Saveur Biere)

From a 33cl bottle, pours a very black color, with a dark brown head that only stay for a minute before only leaving a ring around. Aroma of strong coffee, malts and liquor. Flavors are rich and complex, first rich coffee and hints of chocolate hits you, spicy notes, orange zests, toasty breads notes. This cat is very rich and tasty. Nice long flavors in mouth with a medium carbonation, and creamy full body. Better as it gets warmer, and with a liquor finish. This is a big stout, wonderful, very tasty and full enjoyment. Although the Weasel is not really a good thing, but it makes a great brew. 
The rich coffee taste is very present all along.  Thank you Weasel poop. ;)
On tap at Chmielarnia. Coffee, chocolate, oat in aroma. Delicate and smooth. Espresso, chocolate, roasty grains, creamy with some sour hints. Oily body, low carbonation not too sweet.

bottled. rich jet black with a sliver of a brown head; potent aroma of coffee, vanilla cream, licorice, melted chocolate; choc-coated coffee bean, vanilla ice cream flavours, finishes with some burnt toast bitterness and some lingering citric tang; thick and luscious texture. extremely drinkable

Poured from bottle into snifter. Dark brown with tan head that actually sticks around for while. Heavy coffee/ chocolate aroma. Taste is sweet, malty, chocolate, coffee, with a little bit of a boozy/ bitter finsh. Mouth feel is smooth, with just enough carbonation. I served it kind of cold, it gets even more smooth and sweet as it warms. Really good beer.

Barwa: ciemna, nieprzejrzysta. Pian brązowa, obfita, ale ultra szybko zanikająca. Całość gęsta i oleista. [4/5]

Aromat: przede wszystkim kawowy, ale dość delikatny. Następnie czekolada, słodycz, melanoidyny. Alkohol całkiem dobrze ukryty. 

Smak: pełny, słodki z praktycznie zerowym wysyceniem. Czekolada mleczna i kawa, ale nie za gorzka, przyjemna. Do tego lekka lukrecja, nieco wytrawnej paloności i rozgrzewający alkoholowy finisz. 

Kolejne z serii Beer Geek Mikkellera. Tym razem RIS warzony z ziarnami kawy przetworzonej wstępnie przez łaskuny. Piwo mimo dużej mocy jest nadzwyczaj delikatne. Połączenie kawy i czekolady jest doskonale wyważone. Smak jest nie za słodki, nie za gorzki, z lekką nutą kwaskową. Niesamowicie pijalne, ale starałem się brać, jak najmniejsze łyki żeby ten smak zatrzymać na dłużej. Z reszta co tu się dłużej rozwodzić, spróbujcie sami, bo warto. Tylko cena może trochę zaskoczyć.

Black pour with small foamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, slight chocolate and faint hops. Taste of espresso, unsweetened chocolate, slight vanilla and faint hops. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, strong bitter coffee finish that lasts forever.

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is lots of coffee up front with cocoa, molasses, caramel and light ash in the background. Taste is medium sweet with a light roasted bitterness, lingering coffee. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Was hoping for a bit more complexity.
Mørk rødbrun∕svart farve med mørk beige skum som raskt forsvinner. Lukt av kaffe, sjokolade, vanilje og bek. Smak av røstet malt, sjokolade, kaffe, vanilje og bek. Vinmonopolet.

11.2 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours an inky black, with a small brown head which quickly fades, leaving fair lacing. Nose is strong black coffee. taste is deep, rich coffee and dark malt, with a very long finish that has a hint of hop bitterness. Mouth feel is creamy and thick. One of the best coffee stouts Ive ever had.

11.2 oz bottle purchased from State Line. Ive had this several times over the years, but am finally sitting down to rate this beer that has become harder to find recently.

Pours a dark black that does not allow light to pass at all. A one inch dark khaki head settles down to barely a hint of bubbles floating on the meniscus, leaving no lacing. Aroma is an intense yet balanced fresh black coffee with a slight sweet complexity from roasted malts. Notes of bakers chocolate as well - a deliciously bitter aroma. Flavor is full and overpowering. Coffee is dominant, with notes of sweet chocolate, caramel, malt, oats. Mouthfeel is full, rich and viscous, like a simple syrup. The finish is outstanding - no change from the bold flavor. If anything is different, there is a slight hint of mild peppermint that Im tasting - a pleasant roasty bitter chocolaty finish overall that is just superb. This is better than I remember, since Im drinking it at room temperature. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy tan head that lasts. The aroma is cocoa, roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee. Thick mouthfeel with nice coffee roast, dark chocolate, nice bitterness and dry finish. Really enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 Bottle 50cl. Pours black with a very dark head. Extreme rich aroma of roasted malt, coffee, tar and just very intense. If the nose was intense, then the taste basically blow up your taste buds. Amazing how much taste you can put into a beer. Coffee and tar is dominant and a perfect bitter finish to complete this beer. Simply fantastic if you are into extreme beers.

Pours a dark brown with a very thin head that diminishes. Aroma is fantastic! Coffee, slight booze aroma, chocolate and more coffee! That taste is out of this world. Perfectly balanced coffee flavor with yeast, vanilla, chocolate and more coffee at the finish. One of the best Ive had!

Kolsvart tjock öl med litet ljusbrunt skum som snabbt försvinner. Doftar sjukt mycket kaffe och lite choklad! ! Massor med kaffe, choklad, vanilj i smaken och lite söt sliskig och lite chocklad och beska. Fyllig och ingen alkoholsmak trots 10.9%. Ganska lite kolsyra! Riktigt bra öl!!

Mikkeller Beer Geek - Brunch Weasel
 -- 
Appearance: 5/5. Pours a gorgeous thick chocolate brown-black with a very dark brown foamy head that lingers. I salivated watching it pour. 
 -- 
Aroma: 7/10. Intensely yeasty and with a strong hoppy-pine aroma. Subtler notes of cocoa. Definite notes of alcohol. A little sour in the smell.
 -- 
Taste: 9/10. A nice, surprisingly restrained coffee-cocoa-ness to it with piney but not particularly bitter hoppiness. Chocolate to start, coffee along the way, and then a strong coffee-hops bitterness at the back.
 -- 
Palate: 4/5. *Incredibly* smooth across the lips and tongue, theres no mistaking this at all for an imperial oatmeal stout right from the mouthfeel alone. Smooth and creamy across the tongue and all the way back. Only very light carbonation, with one of the gentlest astringencies Ive come across in any oatmeal stout. The bitterness is a little too much in the finish though, and thats the only fault in the beer, really.
 -- 
Overall: 17/20. Outstanding, but the bitterness in the finish is a critical flaw. While not as sweet as I like my stouts, the mouthfeel is surely the best Ive ever had on any beer. Everything in this beer (except that finish bitterness) is in perfect balance. Restrained, pleasant, and delivering on its promises.

Pours dark with a thick foamy tan head. Immediate strong dark roasted coffee aroma with sweetness of dark bakers chocolate. Tastes creamy but mainly like a smooth full bodied dark coffee with dark chocolate. This is a smooth but dry beer with long roasted finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I though,,,, and thats where the trouble started with me thinking. I got an immediate burst of coffee and dark cocoa chocolate in a beer with a load of carbonation in the mouthfeel. Then I got sourness and I got tongue buckling dryness. I guess all of which means that this might not be my kind of beer. Loadsa alcohol in this as you drink this and you can see it on the sides of the glass. Nice beer, just not the beer for me.
Bottle 33cl. Pours black and leaves a quite foamy very dark head. Opaque color. Aroma is berries, chocolate, cookies, roasted malt, sugar, coffee. Sweet taste, heavy body. Liquor in the after.
Rating # 800. Bottle at home, 15th June 14. Bitter coffee, smooth and thick palate. Sweet and bitter balanced well and a great mouth feel, enjoyable

I have been wanting to taste this along with the rest of the beer geek beers from Mikkeller. This one did not let me down! 10.9% ABV is not evident at all due to the smoothness and delicious taste of the oatmeal and coffee!
dense with light carbonation, well balanced bitterness with a chocolate aroma. Flavour is heavy toffee caramel. Yum.

11.2 oz bottle pours black in sifter with foamy brown head slow to dissipate. Smells of coffee, semi sweet chocolate cherries and raisins; strong aroma. Very oily mouth-feel and little carbonation, heavy bodied for sure. More bitter than the original beer geek, heavier (10.5% v. 7.5) and more complex flavors. Mostly the bitter coffee is dominant ,but there is certainly dark fruit flavors. Too heavy, oily and alcoholy for me which is disappointing because Vanilla Shake was 13% and that was awesome. Still makes me feel awesome like the other Beer Geeks so not a total loss.
330ml bottle. Very dark, very little head. Aroma and taste is all tropical espresso. Oily texture. Overall, extremely flavourful.

Pours a thick black, used motor oil appearance with light head. Thich scents of mushroom soy sauce, coffee, dark chocolate and heavily roasted malts. Palate is full and round with roasted hints, strong black coffee and chocolate. Finishes long. Outstanding.
Bottle from who knows... Poured black with disappearing tan head. Aroma of much better coffee then reg Breakfast. Light carb med bod. Light char roast oat biter taste.
This is the third Mikkeller Ive had that doesnt agree with me. Had it at a tasting and all I could taste was pennies. Nobody else noticed it. This will be my last Mikkeller.
i like a lot of mikkellers stuff, and this is no exception. pretty darn good, even if it did come out of a weasels butt.
Complex taste. Its a big civet coffee beer. It would be really good with bacon and eggs.

33cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 04-06-2014.
In short: a nice Imp. Stout.
Pours black with nice tan head. Short head retention, some lacing. Coffee, creamy, liquor, roasty aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is coffee, roasty, some liquor and spicy flavours. Dry notes, some viscous mouthfeel. Smooth and enjoyable.Bitter finish.

Bottle @home. Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma has chocolate bitterness, caramel. Taste is coffee, chocolate. Intense chocolate bitterness (bit too intense to my taste). Softer chocolate finish. Full body, oily mouthfeel.

Bottle to a snifter. Viscous black with thin brown head. Aroma of dark bold coffee, dark chocolate, burnt toffee, plum and fig. Flavor is complex, rich, all the aromas come through on the palate in waves and layers. Well balanced, smooth, a bit of a warm boozy finish. Clearly one of the best stouts on the planet. Is there a BA version?

0,33L bottle. Pours black with brown head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is very intense coffee, roast, and malt. Taste intense coffee, intense dark chocolate, sweetness, roast, coffee, vanilla, and smoke. Finish is slightly sweet with increasing dark chocolate bitter. Overall: great brew.

I love the aroma of this beer. You can smell it as soon as it pours out of the bottle. Strong, yet pleasant. I detected roasted malts, light cappuccino, some booze, raisin, fig and licorice. Complex but just subdued enough. It also looks great. Black with a small bubbly dark tan head. Leaves sticky lacing on the glass. Tastes of gourmet coffee, some dark chocolate and just enough booze. The hop bitterness comes through in the aftertaste and effectively balances the sweetness. The palate is full and slick with a great finish that hangs on until the next sip. This is a great beer. I was ready to be disappointed due to the cost and hype that surrounds it but I really cant find a flaw. My advice is to skip the Beer Geek Breakfast and go straight for this one. It is much better.

Pour from 2013 bottle is pitch black with dark brown creamy head. Aroma is deep roasted malt, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, and resin hops. The taste is pleasantly sweet vanilla, chocolate with a powerful, bitter, acidic coffee taste. Palate is full bodies, flat carbonation with a smooth velvety mouthfeel. Finish is long and astringent but pleasant. I like this beer a lot more than the beer geek breakfast. It has a sweeter taste to balance out the powerful bitterness. A fantastic stout. I wish I had more.
Bottle - Oatmeal, big roast and dark roast coffee. Jet black with a rich brown head. Big rich roast coffee, huge roast and a bitter finish. Really rich in every way.

Deep caramel flavors, elegant coffe notes, pleasant hop bitterness. Well balanced beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark opaque brown with dark tan colored spongy head, caramel aroma, bitter coffee beans taste mixed with hard alcohol, low carbonation, long bitter finish. Very nicely camouflaged alcohol taste but a bit too bitter.

Pours thick black with a dark brown head. Heavy coffee on the nose, laced with dark chocolate. Thick creamy mouthfeel, aroma of coffee and chocolate. The coffee aroma is unique, sort of sweet. Not to cite Borat, but VERY NICE, HOW MUCH.

12oz bottle into Le Snifter - sludgy pour towards the end. Nose is dark chocolate. Sip adds roast and lactose qualities. Very rich in coffee. Smooth and get has a big body. ABV is well hidden. Very bitter in the dark cocoa department. Dry. Coffee to the max; I get it, but not top 50 get it.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 Pours a luscious black with a thick, creamy brown head. The nose is divine! Dark chocolate, heady coffee, dark roasted grains, notes of anise (or was it anus?). :) Taste bears espresso-like bitterness on a huge malty foundation. Full body, soft carbonation. Long, mocha finish. This brew is the shit!

At B&F in Rome. Many thanks luttonm for the suggestion. Deep oily black, with a consistent brown foam. Nose: licorice, coffee, berries! Mouth is very complex: coffee dominates! Dates, smoked feel, dry fruit! Cool stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Spending bottle that I picked up at Casanova. I had had the Cognac variant before and this is a stellar brew. We need Mikkeller back in MN!

bottle shared by VT, thanks bro! pours oily black with a small dark beige head, some retention and lacing. black pepper, booze, rich strong coffee, demerara and molasses, slightly perfumey, some red berries seep through, licorice, smoke, almost tannic woodsiness, dust and metal. moderate carbonation, medium to full body - oily and sticky, bold if not harsh boozy-bitter coffee-resinous finish. perfumey alcohol. aromatic coffee and resins.

I sandhed en Stout i en klasse for sig selv. Kaffen fylder både i aromaen og i smagen og gør denne øl til et mindre mesterværk. Hvordan Mikkeller kan blive med med at nytænke øl på det niveau har gør, er mig en gåde.. Og nu har hans sprit også vundet guld.. Hov vi snakker øl.. Køb den.. Smag den.. Køb én mere - det gjorde jeg :-)
On tap at Maxs in Baltimore. Like eating a delicious pile of ashes, that finishes with lovely chocolatey coffee.
Vanilla and choclate taste. Massive beer obviously. Dulled down by many IPA before it. Creamy. Full thick body. Just like your mom. I like it.

Black with medium brown head. Sweet coffee, berries, roasted malts, marzipan, chocolate pudding. Medium seet, syrupy going into a tart middle with a big roasted or raw cocoa bitterness. Full bodied with slight sticky feel. Nice stuff.

A solid blend of rich bitter chocolate, great tasting coffee, sweet malt, oats, and overall goodness. It pours black and thick and its intense. Has a hint of fruit at the end. One of the best Coffee/Beer combos around.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Pitch black color, good brownish foam. High intensity aromas of coffee, licorice, malt, leather and more subtle aromas of roast & vanilla. Full body & high complexity . Some sweetness, but solid bitterness balances well. Very enjoyable
-backlog- very nice imperial stout with huge fruity coffee notes. Would definitely recommend this one.

700th beer review. Bottle at home. Poured pitch Black with a mocha coloured head. Big long lacing. Big aroma of bakers chocolate, milk chocolate, bitter coffee, Cream, oats, vanilla, roasted malts. Dark fruits, raisins. With a big long lasting smooth finish. Incredible!

Notes 4/14/2014

Appearance - 4/5 - dark brown black beer with an initial mocha head that immediately fades to nothing.
Aroma - 8/10 - coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, oatmeal, nothing too crazy or special
Taste - 8/10 - again, coffee, oatmeal, roasted malts, chocolate, plus maybe a tiny bit of burnt flavors, even burnt rubber
Palate - 4/5 - its pretty creamy and chocolate milkshake like, but Im finding with coffee stouts that the coffee decreases the complexity a lot of the time because its overpowering. Thick mouthfeel tho, alc covered, aftertaste = coffee.
Overall - 15/20 - Id love to try this with the other coffee stouts (Founders Breakfast Stout, Santa Fe Imperial Java Stout) and see whose shines above the rest.

Bottle for game of thrones. Nose is deep dark brownish black with nose of coffeeband licorice. Tastes of rich espresso grind, licorice, some molasses, hint of melted butter, and soy sauce. Creamy gesture and not too sweet.

Bottle from Beer and Cheese Taipei. Big roasted coffee aroma. Smooth rich palate (but not too thick/oily) with lots of roasted flavors followed by coffee then hoppy bitterness with lasting boozy finish. Bit of nuttiness. Very big in every way - creamy and rich and boozy and coffee and delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Tons of coffee, roasted malt, hazelnut, hop, alcohol, bit of lemon on the nose. Taste is nicely big and bitter with coffee and some spice. Some raisin as it warms up.
