Body is incredibly creamy and smooth. Like the Beer Hop Breakfast but slightly more acidic with more coffee and creamier in the body.
Deep dark bottle pour, seriously complex stuff-- waves of flavor and a long finish-- seriously rich coffee, cocoa... rich, smooth, and delicious, Worth the price.

Had it on tap at Mikkeller Vesterbro. Probably the best coffee stout I have had, though pretty close with the Stone espresso one which I have only had i a bottle. Great flavors that evolve, a lot of alcohol and with a delicious coffee taste. Just gets better and better.

Pours out with the tenaciousness of motor oil. Has a aroma of coffee chocolate and alcohol. A creamy palate that is followed by a beautifully complex flavor profile. Rich coffee and malt toasted to perfection. A hint of carbon and a texture of melted marshmallow with the tiniest of bubbles. It coats the mouth and glass with it sweet and bitter lace. If there was such thing as a perfect beer this would be the closest I have tasted

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 Bottle. Tints the glass copper head. Aroma of raisins, dried apricot, coffee, light citrus hop. Bitter sweet chocolate taste with a dry bitter dark chocolate long lingering finish. Almost no booze at all. The toasted malts and the coffee are balanced very well in this beer where they really compliment each other more than dominant one way or another. This is a highly complex beer that is exceptionally well balanced. Mmmmmmm.

Bottle 33 cl.
Pours pitch black, with a brown, lacing head. Malty aroma, of dark bread, caramel, chocolate and coffee. Some citrus hops. Flavour is sweet, and long bitter.

Coffee, chocolate, some roasted malts and licorice in the aroma. Black body with a beige head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with soft carbonation. Overall a complex and interesting stout.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Pitch black color, dark brown head. Coffee nose, milk chocolate, roasted malt, hints of rubber and liquorice. Bitter coffee and dark chocolate taste, vanilla and roasted malt. Full body, pleasant carbonation, warming alcohol, creamy texture. Truly great.

Botella de 33 cl del rincón de la cerveza 05_04-2014. Color negro intenso con espuma oscura, no muy persistente. Gas no muy abundante, lo justo. Aromas intensos a café y maltas tostadas con algo de especias y chocolate. Cuerpo medio alto con 10.9 vol que se notan en todo momento y potencian los sabores de café y tostados. Aumento de la sensación alcohólica a medida que va calentando, subiendo también la densidad. Sabores a cafés torrefactos, que dominan claramente, maltas tostadas, montón de cereales, ligeras especias, vainillas y toques ligeros de lactosa, acabando con pequeño amargo ligeramente persistente en boca ....... Muy muy buena, todo perfectamente conjuntado, y con intensos sabores potenciados por el volumen alcohólico. Imprescindible repetir, gran gran imperial stout.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 On tap poured into a snifter..jet black with tan head..big coffee aroma..taste matches smell but incredibly smooth for almost 11%abv..great imperial stout.

Aroma is acidic coffee which is really nice. Body is medium to full. Acidity f coffee makes it good, but takes away from the body a bit. Good beer, not thick enough for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 Jet black, large off white brownish head(still small as the beer has been warming) , moderate lacing. Aroma is dark roasted coffee, definite oatmeal. It smells amazing. Taste. I have been waiting for this one. Cheers. OMG. Taste is great. Strong, rich, dark roast coffee, dark malts, dark chocolate, and the alcohol compliments the beer so dam well it is unbelievable. I am attempting to get a hold of some KBS and would love to compare the two. Very well done Mikkeller. Side note, may have been aged a considerable time. Hard to know with no bottling date that is discernible!

Distinct coffee aroma. Taste is somewhat bitter with hints of chocolate and a medium body. Slight alcohol burn but not surprising for 10%. Overall pretty good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Superbe produit ! Tout est au top dans cette bière : couleur, arômes, saveurs. On est sur le café pour faire large mais cest plein de complexité au palais. Excellent !

Pours dark brown/opaque black, with a thin milk chocolate head that stays as a thin cap. Beautiful pour. Aromas of bitter coffee, bitter chocolate, some anise and a very subtle hint of alcohol. Taste is extremely rich. The coffee is robust, the grain bill is huge, lending to a thick mouth feel. The carbonation is on the medium to heavy side, which really provides a nice counterbalance to the thick mouthfeel. Almost a cereal flavor from the oats. Bitter chocolates across the finish give the coffee a rounded edge. Moderate alcohol warming as it works down my throat. Extremely drinkable and delicious!

Pours pitch black with a tiny dark brown head, intense roasted coffee smell and hints of dark chocolate. Very balanced taste of chocolate versus coffee, an overall magnificent brew. An alltime favourite of mine.
Pretty consistently one of Mikkels best beers. A really good coffee stout, though not quite amongst the absolute greats.
Thanks cards04 for this behemoth. Powerful coffee and roasted aroma. Full body is smooth. Espresso flavor dominates cocoa and black licorice. Finish is slightly bitter. Very nice.

33cl bottle from BarleyWine Copenhagen. Pours a deep black with a small beige head and lots of lacings. Aroma is coffee and some pipe tobacco. Taste starts of sweet and full of dark chocolate, bourbon, orange mayhaps and brown sugar. Then the bitterness sets in and the delicate notes of extremely well-brewed coffee sets in...and lasts! Taste just improves with every zip. Delicious stout that makes you wanna keep on drinking. - with thirst, Niklas

Black colour with a minimal brown head. Aroma: Roastiness, coffee, sweetness, dark fruit, charred wood, citrusy hops and peppery alcohol. Taste: Roastiness, coffee, sweet licorice, dark chocolate, light dark fruitiness, coal, citrusy hops, peppery alcohol, dark sugar. Roasted coffee finish. Full bodied and smooth

Opaque dark brown with half a finger of tan head that settles to a wispy film with little lacing. Aroma is more subdued than expected with sharp brewed coffee, chocolate and faint cherry pipe tobacco. Taste is strong brewed coffee at first followed by a quick hit of sharp roasty bitter and some alcohol. That fades to a sweet chocolate syrup, then a grassy bitter. Finishes with more coffee and dark chocolate that lingers as well as some roasty bitterness. Medium/full bodied with medium/high carbonation. Big and complex flavors that develop as you drink. Makes you want to keep drinking to explore it. Maybe a bit too carbonated but lives up to the hype.

2014 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours black with a hint of brown at the edges. Very little brown head. Aroma is surprisingly subdued. Some chocolate with a little earthy hops. Taste starts as chocolate and some bitterness. Alcohol and roast start to build on the tongue and then explodes into a dark chocolate with an acrid, roasted coffee. Taste hangs around on the tongue and continues to develop. Mouthfeel is medium-full with a slight alcohol burn. The taste is the big attraction.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice. Solid. Theres nothing missing here. Might be the epitome of the style. At the same time, Id like some distinguishing characteristic that makes the beer interesting. Here, I get nil.
Rich coffee aroma. Flavor is huge chocolate with coffee backbone that lingers nicely. Fine carbonation and smooth mouthfeel
Botella 33 cl. en Cerveceria Arte&Sana. Predomina el café, pero la cantidad de matices es increible. Chocolate, vainilla, licor... Magistral.
Dark black in color with a bubbly half finger tan head. Big coffee nose, oatmeal. Big coffee taste, oatmeal, toasted malts, licorice sweetness. Bitter chocolate finish. Amazing big beer.

Probably the best thing Ive tasted that came from a weasels ass. Truly superb. The coffee, dark chocolate and oatmeal come together with superb precision here. Caramel and cream, coffee and toasty, crisp malt. Finishes bitter with notes of sweetness. Pours black with great head and lacing. Some residual sweetness as well. Tap at Churchkey.
My god... mikkeller just doesnt know how to make a bad beer... black pour..brown head.. chocolate..coffe.. thick creamy happiness!!

Draft at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours black with just a sliver of tan head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee. Tasting notes of caramel, dark chocolate, roast, bitter and roasted coffee, vanilla. Full body with a dry and bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Very smooth for the ABV. This and the Vanilla Shake are probably my top two favorites of the Beer Geek brews.

3/13/14. Draft at Church Key. Pours dark on black with nice mocha head. Light roasty nose. Highlight is the wonderfully complex coffee notes in the mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with a foamy brown head that last some time. Lots of lacing. The aroma is of coffee, chocolate and dark fruits. It tastes exactly as it smells: coffee, chocolate, plum and raisins. Its really boozy and nicely bitter. Oily mouth. This is both complex and straightforward, and a great coffee stout.

330ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Pours black with a foamy brown head leaving alittle lacing, and aroma of roast malt, oats, fruity hop, coffee. Taste is sweetish roasted malt, toffee, dark fruits, hoppy, chocolate & dark coffee, with some lingering earthy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, full bodied, soft carbonation, warming bitter finish. Very drinkable indeed!
Pours black with a dark brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is strong coffee, chocolate, roasty and smokey

Bottle @ home. Aroma: Roasty, hints of undifined sour flowery notes, hookah, liquorishy, some spices. Apperance: Pours crued oil black, small short brown head. Taste: Rich roasted notes, liquorish, smoke, hookah, bitter like chocolate, bitter like coffee. Palate: thick oily feel. Overall: I might be colored by the former ratings - but its one of the most interesting stout-tastings I had, a lot of new tastes - not a every day beer (maybe not even monthy) But if you like to try new - this is!
Bottle pour. Smooth silky black. Coffee and malt, very strong. Smooth finish. Really good.
An offering from krompt and we were both very impressed. Intense coffee, roast and poop taste and aroma minus the poop. Who thought fecal matter could taste so good?

Herbal, almost minty flavor fades into coffee, chocolate, and alcohol. For beer flavored with cat shit, this is incredibly good. Though had I known it was flavored with cat shit coffee, I probably wouldnt have bought it. They probably ought not to advertise it that way.
Heavy booziness with coffee backbone. A very good beer. Straightforward yet doesnt disappoint.
Bottle. Aroma of burbon and chocolate and coffee. Taste of strong coffee and booze. Booze and chocolate aftertaste. Amazing beer.

Opened with a key in a hotel room. Pours dark black, with thin head. Sensational beer, so smooth, but so full of flavour.. Easiest drinking 10.9 abv beer Ive ever had. Does mikkeller do anything but stunning beer?
Poured dark black with aromas of roast, light coffee, and some chocolate. Flavors are the same, light coffee, and chocolate, some bitterness and light earth. a very nice coffee Imperial Stout.

Kraftig men rund aroma. Svært mørk fremtoning. Smak av mørk kaffe og sjokolade. Smak er svært mektig og ølet er ledig mettende. Velegnet for en liten smak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark with an espresso head. Aroma is cold pressed coffee, chocolate, and hops. The flavor is really unique and delicious with the weasel coffee elements. Really good
Schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr intensiv röstmalzig, Kaffee. Geschmack sehr intensiv röstmalzig, Kaffee, bittere Schokolade. Weltklasse!

Aroma; strong malts, berries, wood, smoke, caramel, fruity coffee.
Coffee brown bubbly body, brownish head, not much lacings.
Taste; malty spirity coffee, black chocolate, herbal notes in the background.
Coffee-ish to palate. Finishes with dark chocolate malts, dark syrup, warming alco.
A nice slow sipper at the end of the evening for those who like strong stuff.




:: 33cl brown bottle BBF160718 abv10.9% [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tromsø.
Thanks Pacha! Black pour with a creamy tan head. Toms of coffee and chocolate in the nose with touches. Rich creamy chocolate and coffee flavor wit. Smooth body and carbonation. Super tasty.

Aroma is expected, but does not jump out at you as unique. Pour strong. Taste left a bit to be desired. Off-putting flavors street short cellering in some bottles. Overall, inconsistency. Grainy palate. Otherwise, an exceptionally well done beer by an incredible brewer.
Huge, a excellent beer by Mikkel. Nice balanced stout with really refined coffee-aromas to soothe it all down. This is up there with the best.

Bottle, courtesy of Cards04. Very dark pour, gorgeous pillowy head. Big coffee aroma, chocolate, malts, a touch of vanilla and cinnamon. Creamy, boozy coffee flavour, some chocolate, and a bit of hops. The taste sticks in your mouth in an amazing, lingering way. Beautiful.

Overall this was a nice brew. Heaps of rich coffee and some chocolate in the nose, alongside tons of malt. Flavor is dense coffee and roast with dry, dark chocolate notes. Very enticing. Well balanced with some earthy hops. Great stuff.

Shared by OmegaX - thanks man! This was an excellent brew for sure. It smelled like cold-pressed coffee and dark chocolate mainly. There was more hop flavor than aroma, but still TONS of fresh coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate and a mellow caramel bite. I loved every sip, and the oily texture only made each sip more savory.
Not sure how a beer gets better than this. Perfect balance, not overly boozy but with just enough bourbon to lift the bitter cocoa nibs and coffee to another level. My new stout standard.
Pours jet black with tan head from 12oz bottle. Nose us of coffee and Mocha. Strong roasted coffee taste. Thinner body but easy drinking. Good stuff.

On tap at Sixgill in Fremont. Thick black and dark khaki head. Aroma is heavy roasted malts, coffee, and soy. Flavor is mostly coffee and chocolate. Tastes like a turbo version of founders breakfast stout.
Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors, Chicago. Pours black with dissipating dark brown head. Coffee and grains aroma. Taste is phenomenal. Coffee, chocolate, oats... Lovely. Thick and smooth body.

Pitch black pour, very tiny khaki head. Aroma of coffee grains, char, roasted malt, dark bakers chocolate. Bittersweet chocolate up front, roasted malt, oat, black coffee. Full body. nice winter drink!

Bottle. Black pour with a bit of big bubble brown foam on top. Very full body. Creamy finish completely hides the high ABV. Lots of wonderful dark flavors going on here! Espresso. Charcoal grill. Leather. Truffles. Cinnamon. Liquorice root. Burnt toast. Shoe polish. Black pepper. Roasted nut butter. Certainly multiple complex chocolate flavors happening here from dark to light. Despite what the main ingredient might suggest, I can honestly find no off-putting notes at all (and I suspect that anyone saying otherwise is simply falling into a trap of their own expectations. ) This beer is FANTASTIC and outstandingly well balanced. Simply tastes like the richest, creamiest, most deliciously complex mocha coffee one could hope for. Easily among my Top 10 of dark beers. Increasingly hard to find. Grab it if you find one!

Bottle from Bieresgourmet.be. Pitch black body, with small brown head, that dissipates quickly. Delicious, rich, complex aroma like melting dark chocolate, cocoa and coffe beans, dried dark fruits, roast, some alcohol burn. Taste is also very complex, with generally the same aromas and a perfect balance between sweet and bitter. The mouthfeel is full, creamy, with a lively carbonation and it finishes very complex again, with a medium bitterness, a pleasant, long-lasting alcohol warmth and all aromas mentioned before, of which the chocolate aromas even stay after minutes. Amazing! Perfectly balanced, heavy stuff, bursting with complexity, yet dangerously smooth to drink, because of the pretty well hidden alcohol and the sparkling carbonation. This is an Imperial Stout how I love it!

33cl bottle from 2d2dspuma. Color is very dark and head is brown and beautiful. Body is hiper smooth. Taste is medium bitter and light sour, beautifully balanced. Aroma is high on chocolate, coffee, some roasted and light hop. Very good!

Bottle. Black with a thick dark brown creamy head. Fresh coffee grounds, light chalky, sweet roasted malt, toasted, dark chocolate, syrup, vanilla, very light alcoholic. Taste is near heavy sweet with lots of roasted and coffee like bitterness in the finish. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, full body. The finish gets a bit too bitter for my taste, but still this is a fine brew that deserves its high rating. I just prefer a little less coffee and bitterness, thats all.

From bottle. Thick black pour with slight head that is brown with orange highlights. Roasted chocolatey aroma. Rich roasted malt flavor with chocolate and coffee - a little sweet and a little bitter. This is a lovely huge beer with a lot of complexity.

0.33l bottle. 10.9%. Very distinct coffee and chocolate smell. Big FAT body. Dark and smelly. First taste impression is like a cup of coffee. Well balanced coffee, chocolate and caramel taste. Maybe a bit to much coffee "feel". Very original beer. Must taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Absolutely dark. Forcefull.. Dark chocolate foam. Smell of chocolate, coffe. Espresso.clear tadte of chocolate. Though not that powerfull as expected. In a good way. Grest coffeflavour. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness. Maybe a to abrupt finish. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bought at Vinmonopolet Steinkjer. chocolate, coffee, roasty, resin, herbs, barnyard, basement aromas, licorice, soy sauce,
Reddish brown frothy head and sweet caramel aroma. Dark brown in cold with a bitter long finish and coffee flavor.

Appearance: Poured into a snifter, almost no head which giving the ABV comes as no surprise. Pitch black almost a 60 weight motor oil appearance. Seems to coat the glass very well.

Aroma: very complex. Dark fruits, roasted malt, Carmel, hints of coffee and chocolate. A lot going on.

Taste: very nice, up front getting the roasted malts, coffee, caramel malt, dark fruits. The dark fruits aren't as forward as I would have expected given how noticeable they were on the nose, they are more in the background on the palate. The alcohol is nearly undetectable, which is very impressive, though I do get the warmth of it after the swallow.

Overall: awesome brew, this is my first Mikkeller beer and I'm very impressed. Extremely well balanced and enjoyable. Be careful with this the alcohol is so unnoticeable it could get you into trouble real quick.

Essentially, a perfect beer (giving myself some wiggle room). The integration of the coffee into the perfectly rich, smooth roasty stout is incredible. Off the top of my head, cant think of a better imperial stout out there.

Jet black pour with half a finger of khaki head that stick around. Smells of earthy chocolate, coffee, vanilla, faint hint of cinnamon, earthy hops. An initial bitter roastedness that gives way to a slightly sweet chocolate coffee then finishes dry with malty roasted bitter with some caramel and chocolate. A little alcohol bite towards the end but not overly apparent. Fairly thick mouthfeel. An overall good roasty malty coffee chocolate flavor, very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is the best beer i have tasted.
To bad that the weasel that "make" the coffeebeans in this beer is living under unhuman circumstances.
De Molen made one imp.stout with same beans and stopped making it when this was revalded. I expect that mikkeller does it too.

Bottle poured into snifter. Oily black body with a khaki head. Smells of chocolate, caramel, toffee and coffee. Tastes of caramel strongly upfront, accompanied by toffee, almonds and chocolate. This is followed by a nice strong coffee taste in the finish. A sweet cream coffee taste is left on the palate. Overall a very great beer that is easily drinkable.

Black pour with a 2 finger, creamy, slightly chunky caramel brown head that has great retention and leaves nice, oily lacing. Aroma is full of delicious earthy, floral coffee, roast, dark caramel, a little vanilla, toasty, sweet woody notes, light nutty notes and a decent helping of chocolate. Flavor is loaded with coffee up front, lots of coffee, strong and earthy, but not bitter, burnt sugar, roasted nuts, cocoa, roast, a little dried dark fruit and light, but sharp floral notes to the finish. Heavy body creamy, chewy feel and light to medium carbonation. It fits the beer well, but it could be a little less syrupy for my taste. Really great overall, at $10/330ml I am not likely to buy more, however.

Bottle gifted to a friend and shared with a friend. Aroma: Coffee dominant, but also chocolate fudge, almonds/vanilla, and a bit of rum. Appearance: Pitch black body with a mocha head that dissipates into a patchy skin. Flavor: Coffee and vanilla up front; some alcohol burn with a bit of bitter chocolate; astringent coffee toward the finish. Palate: Medium body, tacky texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: Quite good, but not tops for me.

Pours an opaque black from the bottle with nice ring of lacy tan brown head that sticks nicely. Aroma is boozy chocolate up front, nice mild coffee in the middle, comes out more as it warms. Taste follows, faint chocolate but lots of the coffee, great mild roast, hint of earthy smoke. Thick and viscous, bitter coffee finish. Great stuff.

Great beer. Poured into a snifter and is pitch black with a great tan head. It looks delicious and it is. Smells of a lot of coffee and I get some more of the oatmeal. The taste is more oatmeal than I expected. There was a lot of it. Get a lot of chocolate also with the coffee in the back end. Doesnt drink like an 11% beer. More like 8%. Overall this is a great beer. Wish I had more of it.

Huge coffee/espresso nose, dark black. Best beer of the style ever! So lucky!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, black-brown with a tan head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, espresso, chocolate fudge, black cherries and vanilla. 

Taste of espresso, roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, brown sugar, cocoa, espresso and dark fruit. 

Full body and medium/low carbonization with a rich, velvety mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz bottle. Pours inky black with a small tan head. Nose is a bit muted because of the coldness of the beer. Full flavors in the taste, with some coffee bitterness and a hint of sweetness. A bit of an odd tanginess on the end.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Thanks for UMNBeerhunter for this extra, cheers Joe!

A: Pours a dark, nearly black ale with little head formation. Medium sheet of light mocha, fine bubble sheet on surface. Spider web lacing. 

S: Plenty of coffee as anticipated. The beer offers up a high astringency in the coffee, but then subsequently opens up to reveal the malts and tones I typically die for. Amazingly subdued by the coffee. As it warms, the beer becomes more open and enjoyable.

T: The coffee again dominates the beer. If I were interested in the idea that coffee should be the highlight of a beer, I would likely enjoy this, here, no. Slight oaty, malty beer with hints of resiny hops.

M: Thick, and oatmeal engrained. Sticks to my teeth and relays a film on the tongue which does not disappear.

D: This beer is good for one taste.

Serving type: bottle

03-07-2011
Bottle at Khushis (BYOB). Huge aromas of coffee and chocolate. Sweet silky chocolate, liquorice, bitter coffee taste.
Awesome coffee aromas and toasty malts. Sweet coffee flavor that pairs perfectly with the stout. This is fantastic stuff!
Draught. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, coffee. Flavour is vanilla, chocolate roasted notes. Nice and complex beer.

A quality imperial breakfast stout. Strong coffee aroma persists all the way through this stout. Very smooth. Overall a top notch stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rated on 9-25-2009 at Fort Wayne, IN Gathering. This bottled beer pours a small light brown head with a long retention, opaque dark brown body and virtually no lacing. The Aroma consists of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and alcohol. The Taste is lightly bitter, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, alcohol, and has a dry finish. The Palate is very smooth and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, I am not a coffee drinker, but I very much enjoyed this beer from start to finish. It is a sipping beer, worth trying, and a beer I would drink again.
What a thick and special brew. Heavy in the taste with lits if dark chocolate and also some mild coffee. Perfect draft for a winter night due its warming, full body consisting earthy aromas.

Bottle from my Santa - thank you a lot Blafa! The beer pours out in a deep dark black colour with steady low head and medium body. Nice aroma of malt, chocolate and torf. Taste of rich and intense malt, bittersweet chocolate, nuts, woods, espresso and torf. Earthy but also sweetish hints. Enjoyed it a lot.

Pours a completely dark colour with a good brown head. Strong aroma of coffee which is really inviting for a good experience. Also some dry wood and some earthy notes to it. Taste is is just magical! The strong coffee taste really sticks out, and the rest of the flavour is so well balanced. Dough, nuts and some spruce in there, making in a very complex beer. Long and lovely finish, which really never lets go. Full bodied, with a oily texture and soft carbonation, which makes the flavours show themselves from their best side. This has to be the best beer in Scandinavia, at least top 3!
This is the best stout Ive ever tasted! Love it! Dark, roasty, alcoholic. Just perfect

Pitch - darth vader - black! No real head though. Noses of milk coffee, earthy, toffee, sweet malts and some faint wet forest notes. Tastes of milk chocolate and coffee, sweet, light fizzy with a slick texture and a full body. Faint bitterness and liquorice notes offering some traces of vanilla. Well balanced with a rather long lasting chewy finish.

My 100th review! Served with a breakfast of bacon, eggs, and cheese hash browns. Color is a beautiful dark espresso, with a small, dense creamy brownish head. Left massive amounts of silky lacing on the glass. Nose was surprisingly light, but became more apparent as it warmed. Oodles of coffee and the darkest dark chocolate.  By the end, the smell lingering in the goblet was a fine cup of espresso. Flavor is a good strong cup of coffee. Very nice dark roast character. Quite good!

The very last sip revealed a rich fruity flavor that I couldn't place. I kept revising this review as I drank - the beer was slowly revealing more and more depth to its character. Awesome.
jet black pour, small tan head that leaves spotty lacing. roasted coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate nose. them continues in mouth with black coffee dominating. slight astringency. medium body.

Aroma: Vanilla, coffee, malts, definite roast, liquorice Appearance: Dark brown, black, no see through, creamy beige foam, disappearing head, medium lace Taste: Coffee(bitterness), hint of chocolate, lightly sour, blight vanilla, creamy mouthfeel, very nice

Pours black with thick brown head. Aroma is rich roasted coffee and roast. No animal dung present. Taste is very big dry roasted coffee, very rich coffee almost 1 note. Further sips bring chocolate and a light sweet alcohol

Tap at mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Pours a dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma is rich, sweet coffee - tiramisu-like. Full body, mild carbonation. Yum. Sweet coffee cake, vanilla, chocolate then nice bitter boozy finish. It's really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours opaque black with tan head. Nose coffee roast, toast, hint of oatmeal, some booze. Taste strong dark roast coffee, bakers chocolate, big mid palate bitter. Smooth mouth. Roasted bitter finish.
C4 m4 n8 t8 o4.2

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Lervig edition. Pours pitch black, with a thick dark brown head that soon vanishes. Nice aroma of coffee of course, roasted malts, some dark fruits. Thick and oily on the palate, with a flavour thats both sweet and bitter, with roasted coffee, a hint of vanilla, and a superb bitter and dry finish of coffee. The alcohol is well hidden. A great beer.
Tap at Mikkeller SF, San Francisco. Colour is black with small brown head. Aromas and flavours: Massive coffee, hints of chocolate and roasted malts. Super soft and very easy to drink. Fabulous.

Deep dark brown coloured beer with big cinnamon coloured head on top. Lacing sticks to the glass as the head slowly goes away. Aroma has lots of sweet dark chocolate, milk coffee, roasted dark coffee, brown sugar and interestingly some citrus and herbs. After warming up a little, some salty licorice pops up. Taste has sweet dark chocolate, roasted malts and bitter roasted black coffee at the end. Salty licorice comes after warming up. Oily mouth feel and nice carbonation makes this beer the ultimate imperial stout. Mind blowing.

Bottle, been waiting for this one. Pours a darkish brown black pour with a mocha airy head. Nose is straight up roasted coffee. Taste is roasted malt with a strong bitter coffee taste. Warms the palate nicely and finishes on the strong bitter coffee notes. A must try. Quaff Score 8/ 10

Pours black with a brown head and strong pleasant coffee, java aroma. Taste is of bitter, strong coffee notes throughout with underlying creamy java, chocolate, burnt roast, and vanilla while full bodied and a smooth mouthful. Very flavorful bitter tasting coffee stout

So ready for this bad boy. Pours pitch black with a medium sized brown head. The head dissipates quickly but leaves a ton of bubbles of uneven size. The aroma has tons of coffee, chocolate, some vanilla notes, and some cocoa sweetness. The taste is bitter chocolate and has the most incredible coffee flavor. True coffee ground flavor and a big bitter bean finish. Incredible texture that just dominates the palate. I think this is the best stout Ive ever had.

Pours beautifully black as night. Very thin dark brown head just kisses the top of the pour. Fantastic coffee aroma on the nose as well as a deep roasted small, almost like an oak aged beer. Oatmeal give the beer an amazingly smooth mouthfeel. Deep roasted coffee flavor. Very bitter on the initial sip as fresh brewed coffee and coffee grounds grab the tounge. Slightly sweet caramel notes run down the center on the tounge leading to a wonderfully dry finnish.

2013 bottle from Mari's. Pours a inky black with a brown head that quickly fades. Aroma of chocolate and coffee and alcohol. The taste has some sweetness at the front then coffee bitterness then alcohol heat. Pretty good but not a top 50 as it currently stands.
0.33l bottle. Pitch black body, brown head. Aroma of cream, coffee, vanilla and orange zest. Tastes like coffee, caramel, cream, orange juice and grapefruit. Really creamy texture. Awesome beer.

Pours pitch black producing a large, somewhat fluffy looking, dark tanned head. Aroma is rich, roasted coffee beans with liquorice, tar, leather and roasted malts. Taste is heavy coffee and chocolate. Bitter at first, then subtly sweet into bitter again towards the aftertaste. Full bodied with a medium level of carbonation.

Awesome coffee and chocolate malt nose. Dark black pour with a very slight tan head. Strong coffee bitterness with some hits of chocolate bitterness as well. Flavorful and nice to drink, but more bitterness than I like in my big dark beers.

Inky black pour with dark mocha head. Roasty, bitter coffee aroma with a little punch of booze. A fascinating, bizarre sweetness on the tongue. Sweet coffee, smoky wood. A chocolate heaviness creeps in as she opens up. More and more enjoyable with each warming minute. Well hidden alcohol. Slick, dry bitter finish. Really nice beer.

Bottle:
Pours used-oil black with a dark brown head.
Strong, bitter, roast coffee aroma.
Taste is creamy, licorice/coffee...
Smoke and ash....wonderful bitter.
Melted maltchocolate as it warms.
Awesome.

Couleur très noire, très peu de mousse, superbe nez, très expressif, sur le chocolat noir surtout, un peu de café, de vanille, damandes et de cendre. La bouche est épaisse, grasse, très concentrée en chocolat noir, avec un peu de vanille, un côté crème bûlée légèrement sucrée et une bonne amertume qui lempêche de tomber dans la lourdeur. Finale très longue, avec un peu de réglisse.

From a bottle. Pours very dark brown with a very thin head. Smells like dark chocolate, ash, coffee, roasted, and alcohol. Tastes dry, like strong alcohol, ashy earth, bitter coffee, and light syrupy sweetness. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted and chocolate malts, earthy hops, oak, light bourbon, prunes, and faint spice. Flavor is dry, roast malt base, bittering chocolate, light ash, burnt wood, and faint alcohol; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
Rich taste. Pleasant aroma. Reminds me of midnight yard dart games in Canterbury. In the buff.
Bottle shared with sonnycheeba. Pours dark opaque brown with toffee colored head. Aroma of coffee and spice. Large coffee and dark chocolate taste.
Tremendous, the coffee flavors are so rich, Mouthfeel is nice and thick, Finish lingers just enough to leave you begging for more. Excellent!

Bottle: oily black pour, big mocha head that foams up and settles to a nice, thick, quarter inch layer on top. Aroma has notes of sweet chocolates, light roast, mild smoke, dense & oily coffee beans that carry that signature sweet/fruity Kopi characteristic. Light weedy & grassy notes, too. Taste is nice chocolate, mild smoke, lightly sweet coffee with a slight char. Nice creamy milkiness with slight caramel & mallow. Finish of roasted woodiness with more oily coffee beans, smoke, & charred malt. Very nice brew.

Pours black with beautiful chocolate milk head. Fantastic coffee aromas. Sweet cream and vanilla with dark chocolate liquor coming in after about 20 minutes in the glass. Tastes are strong and delicious coffee. Some boozy heat, creaminess and dark chocolate. What a great beer.

Dark black body with brown head some lacing. Aroma of coffee vanilla cherries some booze. Taste of dark chocolate covered cherries bitter coffee. Palate is a bit thin for my liking. Overall a great beer.  Thanks cards04 for this one!

Thick pour, with a light brown head, 1.5 fingers. Black, doesnt let light trough. Instant aroma of marshmellow, caramel, slight hint of coffee. Taste is bitter, but quality, severely roasted coffee beans. Some vanilla notes here. Semi full palate, but creamy. Pretty flat. Aftertaste is impressive, nice bitter coffe notes.

Instantly on my top five list. It is awesome. It is so smooth, that you want to chug it, but you have to keep reminding yourself that it is $8 per bottle, and to sip it slow. Great job Mikkeller, even if it was brewed from cat poo coffee.

Bière noire à la mousse moka. Nez à la fois puissant et raffiné de café et de chocolat. En bouche, le café domine, propulsé par lalcool qui trouve sa juste place. Je ne connaissait pas le café de civet (kopi luwak) avant de boire cette bière. Cest un procédé certainement peu appétissant, mais le résultat dans cette «beer geek» de Mikkeller est magique.

Mikkeller Beer geek Brunch Weasel. Imperial Oatmeal stout. 10,9% Duft: ristet malt. kaffe,en blanding af sødme og ristet malt, frisk kaffe duft, en smule duft af noget grønt. Smag: fin sødme, kaffe, ristet malt
Svart med brunt skum. Espresso sjokolade. Bitter pulverkaffesmak, handlinger. Lang fin bitter ettermak

Bottle from Brewdog shop. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, nuts, roasted malts, vanilla and a bit of toffee. Velvet smooth, oily body with lots of malts. Bitter finish with coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Exquisite imperial stout.
Poured deep black with a dense beige head. Aroma of bitter dark chocolate, coffee, roast malt. Full, oily body. Flavour as the aroma, very well balanced.

Pours a small frothy light brown head that fully diminishes. Body is black.
Aroma contains heavy malts ( dark bread, straw, roasted and burnt malts, nutty tones, molasses and mild, very subtle coffee), moderate hops (pine, citrus fruits), light yeasts (leather, broth) and dried fruits ( grape, raisin, plum), cherry, licorice, cola, spices and alcohol.
Flavor starts off light acidic, then goes to sqeet and finishes in dry bitter.
Body is full with syrupy texture and soft carbonation. 
Amazing amount of aromas, very subtle coffee, strong roasted notes and lots of fruits. Fantastic!

12 oz bottle from Cparles. Thanks man! Well finally... I love coffe I love beer and when the two collide it makes me very happy needless to say Ive been wanting to try this for a while. Black viscous pour, with just a smigen of medium tan head. Aroma is full of coffee, lots of roast, a touch of vanilla some booze. Taste is sligty sweet at first and then opens up with lots of roast, coffee and a little bit of heat that lingers on the tongue. Extremely well balanced. Great Stuff.

Bottle at Stones beer garden...a bit pricey at $14, jeez. Pours pitch black with an ever so small brown head. Chocolate, dark fruits, figs, raisins, earthy coffee, molasses. Flavor follows with big chocolate covered fruits and raisins, some thick espresso. Some latose sweetness. More dark fruits than I expected. Big thick viscous mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Good stuff.

DWG; Pours black with a large, medium lasting, lacing brown head. Aroma is roasted, malty, coffe with dark chocolate, smoke and dark fruity hops. Taste of heavy roasted malt, strong coffe and dark chocolate. Vanilla and berries. Boozy, warming with a smooth, creamy mouth. Sweet with balancing hops. Sweet bitter finish. Thank You Weasel.

Pour is as dark as the night and topped by a "milk chocolate" head. Retention is somewhat good, lacing is excellent. Aroma is really roasty and you can feel a lot of alcohol too. Taste is sweet but balanced by a lot of roasted malt that provide a medium level of bitterness. Some nice coffee impressions. Some nice green hops can be savored, too. Mouthfeel is silky, carbonation medium. Body is full. Great!
330ml bottle at VilleValla Pub. Black and almost no head. Very thick and creamy. Balanced and great taste. The alcohol gives warmth. Great beer.
Duft av lakris og vanilje. Dy mørk farge, nesten sort. Lite skum, litt langs kant. God fyldig smak av lakris, kaffe og mørk sjokolade. Nydelig.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Tiny medium brown head. Pitch black body. Aroma of coffee, toasted bread and burned wood. Hits the mouth with an explosive mixture of tastes which backs up the aroma nicely. Malt sweetness, bitter aftertaste, almost sour. The high ABV is pretty well hidden.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Bottle 330ml @ home. Pours pitch black. Small espresso coloured head. Aroma is stunningly coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is plenty of coffee, as well as chocolate. Perfectly blended with the high alc% makes this a treat. Thick body, oily.
Pours Almost Black. Aroma is heavy coffee, smooth, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, , almost bourbony. Full bodied and soft carbonation.

Opaque black,with low carb and very thin head from co2 bubbles. Leaves light swirly cloud on top of a sea of blackness.Slight lace
 Aroma is strongly minerally berries dark roast,dark chocolate. Taste is smooth slick rich roast chocolate dark berry,minerally roast malt,more roast in finish with strong dark chocolate cocoa flavor. Cherry.Herbal earthy hops. The coffee is really melded into this strong imperial stout-its a great stout,its main thing seems that its really minerally to me and I think that is how the coffee is interpretated for me along with dark berry notes.Tobacco. Herbal eatthy bitter.

Très. Noir. Légère mousse moka. Nez: alcool. Café. Truffe au chocolat. Liqueur de café. Herbacé. Grain rôti. Bouche: très ronde/crémeuse. Forte amertume. Très torréfié. Chocolat noir. Café à fond. Liqueur de café. Truffe au chocolat. Poudre de cacao. Caramel brûlé. Grain de café enrobé de chocolat. Liquoreuse. Fine chaleur d'alcool mais loin du 10%. Sucré quoique la finale reste très sèche. Aucun défaut. Un produit absolument exceptionnel.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 StÃ¦rk! Olielignende konsistens, kraftig lugt. God smag af kaffe. StÃ¦rk og varmende alkoholsmag...
Black as tar. Pours very thick, with a brown head. Has a strong aroma of coffee and cocoa. Has a rich taste of black coffee which converts to dark chocolate in the aftertaste.
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2014 Bottle @ unibaren Aarhus. Pitch black, small tan head, nice lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, coffee, hoppy notes. Taste, roasted malts, coffee, more coffee, hoppy notes, licorice,.

Black as coal, brown head and a godly body... The aroma is soft and rounded with loads of coffee, prunes, dates and some roasted notes. The flavour is full, dominated by the coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and some esters. The end is bittersweet. The aftertaste simply wont stop! A really stuning beer!

Smooth, and oily. Its quite high on the sweetness. Low carbonation. Im still confused by the bitters, its a mix between bad over watered coffees and normal beer bitters. I dont think Im happy with it.
 
I worked it out, its the aftertaste bitters that are throwing me off, the bitters through the tasting are great but the aftertaste bitters are the over shot coffee
 flavors 


****** let it warm, the bitters smooth right out!!
-- rated via Find A Beer for Blackberry 10
Bottle at Torst. Pours black with little else. Aroma is rich earthy umami a bit of off funk licorice. Flavor is similar. Feel is thick, silty. Really really good. Deep.

Bottle. Black colour with a tan head, with very nice lacework and medium lasting. Aroma has notes of coffee, burnt wood and ashes all of them under the notes of roasted malts. Flavor has notes of roasted and toasted malts, black chocolate, coffee beans and ripe fruit with licorice notes. The final is mild bittery with notes of vanilla and black coffee. Dense, creamy and smooth on palate; very good equilibrated the alcohol that is hidden by coffee beans notes.

From 10/10 notes. Pours an oily dark black/brown into tulip with very tiny head. Nose is dark coffee, roasty, some vanilla, hint of booze. Mouthfeel is thick, rich, super creamy. Taste is cream, milk, coffee, delicious. So well balanced. Finish is coffee, pleasant bitterness, cream, a little boozy warmth. Just awesome.

Draft 0,25l at Oslo Beer Festival. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma has quite some coffee coming out of a weasels ass, roast and vanilla. Taste of coffee, roast and a little bit of chocolate and vanilla. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Hoppy coffee, burnt sugar, chocolate turkish delight. Edge of alcohol.
Appearance: Black, opaque, with no head.
Taste: Sweet and slightly hoppy taste leading to a deep hot bitter coffee.
Palate: Full and creamy with medium carbonation and a long hot bitter finish, almost painful!
Overall: Sophisticated and abound with flavour. Manages to include a distinct hoppy element whilst retaining a definite stout character. Excellent.

Chocolate, nut and coffee aroma. Dark brown in color with a creamy and frothy off tan head. Damn. Incredibly balanced. smooth vanilla start with a malty light coffee finish. Bits of black licorice and carazmel in there too. Amazing beer!

Bouteille 330mL. Noire, légère mousse brune. Forte dominance de café au nez. Bouche dominée par le café, un peu de boisé et de vanille. A l'aveugle, j'aurais pensé à un vieillissement en fût de chêne. La finale est amère et asséchante, peu intéressante. Pas mauvaise, mais décevante à mon sens...
Wonderful coffee aroma and flavor. Great deep brown color and dark tan head. Im glad I have three more of these for the upcoming Winter.

Draft at Borefts 2013. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma has quite some coffee, some roast and vanilla. Taste has lots of coffee, roast and a little bit of chocolate and vanilla. Full body with a creamy texture. Nice stuff!

Borefts 2013 - Nice roasted bitter malt and coffee. Very creamy and rich. Theres a background sweetness to this with perhaps some vanilla. Lots of roasted malts and coffee. Very well balanced and easy to drink.
Keg at Borefts Bier Festival 2013. Pours a black colour. Taste is bitter, smokey, liqourice and coffee
Prachtige zwartbruine kleur met een mooie donkere schuimkraag. Duidelijke koffie, roasted, vanille geur. Smaakt vol koffie, roasted, drop en vanille. Lekkere brandende nasmaak.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 @borefts 2013
this is liquid moccapie... so much chocolat and sweet vanilla coffee, its almost edible... awesome round mouthfeel soft carbs great great great beer

Pours a black beer with a nice brown head.
Smells coffee choco. very rich aroma.
tastes coffee, choco with a nice ver long bitter finish.
Thick body, low carbo and a dry texture.

@Borefts 2013
zwart met kaki kraag
aroma: koffie, vanille, zoethout, chocolade
smaken: koffie, chocolade, matig bitter, espresso/kopi luwak ?, laurierdrop, zoethout, romig, volle body, goed bier !
Was really looking forward to this one on borefts festival, and it did not disappoint. Amazing beer.

This is an amazing beer. Black, full, creamy, complex, superbly balanced : just about perfect. Roasted malts, coffee, vanille, chocolate with the right level of (light) sweetness. For me,this was the best at Borefts 2013.
Borefts 2013. Poured deep black with a dense beige head. Aroma of bitter dark chocolate, coffee, roast malt. Full, oily body. Flavour as the aroma, very well balanced.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2015 @Borefts. I didn?t know this beer, but from now on I?ll never forget it. Amazingly rich beer with an ever evolving taste of roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. And all of this in a balanced and smooth way. True greatness.
Love love love this beer. This is a little different then ur usual stout this is one of my favorites
On tap @ Borefts. Ive had this many times, but finally Im rating this. Pours thick, black with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, molasses. Taste is deep, rich, creamy dark chocolate

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 Had it at the festival yesterday. Although it looked really nice, the taste was not as complex as advertised. Coffee is very dominant. That was a bit of a disappointment.

Rated much higher after drinking it again, 14-1, at home, with Marijn and Kaspar. Very good stout. Nice coffee touches in the end, they really add something. Very comprehensive and rich taste.

Rated slightly lower (think its definitive now, haha) after drinking with Lennart @ the Beertemple 24-10-15.

Draft @ Borefts 2013. First off I need to say that Ive had some beers with Kopi Luwak in it, but none of them tastes like this beer. It pours a pitch black beer without any light shining trough. Big, vast brown head that is lasting a long time and leaves decent lacing. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts and big molasses presence. The coffee aroma is not your oridinary, regular cup o coffee, it really is something special. Flavour returns loads of that coffee flavors, with a big roasted character in the body and finish. Awefully well balanced, big sticky mouthfeel. Epic brew!

Deep dark brown body with a small tan head. Smells like coffee and luxury. Very smooth and oily mouthfeel. Rich and decadent taste of coffee and deep roast. The alcohol is lost in this rich mixture of tastes, only its warmth remains. Great
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2013 Draft @ BBF 2013. Pours Almost Black. Aroma is heavy coffee, smooth, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, , almost bourbony. Full bodied and soft carbonation.

Appearance: Chocolate motor oil with ruby tint as it pours. Two-finger khaki head. Aroma: mocha latte, caramelized sugars, broken coffee bean. Taste: charred coffee, slightly bitter; deep and decadent dark chocolate sweetness. Palate: creamy mouthfeel that really demonstrates its status as an oatmeal stout. Ends on a dry note of bakers chocolate.

Excellent beer. Now if only I could get my hands on some of these barrel aged variants...

Pours pitch black with a small chocolate ring. Smells strongly of coffee, chocolate, and hints of licorice. Taste is coffee with hints of chocolate. Full-bodied with a silky texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Mikkeller Beer Geek Brunch Weasel finishes with a subtle lingering coffee bitterness.

Le Ca Phe Chon apporte une excellente note de café à cette bière. Son petit soucis est plus sur lapparence de la bière qui est beaucoup trop épaisse, à la limite de lonctueux, cest beau à loeuil mais ce nest pas ce que je cherche dans la bouche.
Arome : café et vanille
Onctueux en bouche et très noire, très peu de mousse
Aroma is coffee, dark malts, dark fruit, slight earthiness and a big hint of oatmeal/chocolate. The flavor is coffee, dark fruit, malts, chocolate and a very acidic/mildly sour finish.

330ml bottle shared at home. Pours jet black with decent tan head. Aromas are, not surprisingly, coffee. Really good, expensive, fresh coffee though! Hint of booziness and chocolate. Very smooth though, once past the coffee assault. Lovely.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with full tan head. Aromas of creamy coffee, rich roasted malts, and a bit of milk chocolate. Flavours of coffee, brownies, dark chocolate powder, and a touch of liquorice. Smooth though a little hot. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours black; viscous motor oil with practically no head. Dense, thick, oily, chewy. Coffee really nice in the aftertaste. Side by size with beer geek breakfast, this is less bitter (still smoky), thicker, richer. Alcohol in the aroma but not strong in the taste. Coffee big in finish, but less so in the initial taste or the aroma. Stale chocolate. Sweet up front, lasting light bitter finish. Overall: Decadent, smooth, rich, thick, expensive.

31/VIII/13 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: 5/IV/18 (2013-819) 
Pitch black beer, high viscosity, thick while pouring, big irregular brown head, very stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of caramel, mocha, dark chocolate, alcohol, bit sugary, earthy, more burnt caramel. MF: soft to no carbon, full body, thick creamy texture. Taste: dark chocolate, burnt caramel, mocha, coffee, pretty sweet, hint of vanilla, slightly smoked, charcoal. Aftertaste: bit sour, caramel, mocha, hoppy bitter touch, chocolate, sugary, hint of vanilla.

Had this a couple months ago, just now catching up on my ratings... BIG BOY stout. Crazy coffee flavor with super dark chocolate. Smells of COFFEE. Full mouth feel, small tan head that disapears quickly.

From 11.2oz bottle. Pours thick jet black and lightly carbonated with a thin medium brown head. It is this and viscous on the Palate but not overly heavy. Smells of coffee, booze, chocolate and dark bread. The taste is incredible. Tastes of dark and bitter coffee with bittersweet chocolate overtones, and a molasses / malty sweetness. Finish has a nice residual hop bitterness and the slight taste black coffee. Overall, well balanced. Not too sweet but enough to balance the coffee and hop bitterness. The oatmeal smooths out the overall flavor nicely. Very drinkable and surprisingly not overly boozy given the almost 11% ABV. Not too cloyingly sweet like some of the other Mikkeller offerings that I have had. Awesome beer. I've got to try this one again!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

New Beer Distributors, NY 11.2oz ($7): I have waited and waited, and unlike for any other beer, the price of this actually went down. I dont know how long it is going to be at this price, so I couldnt pass it up. In any case, it pours black with a teensy brown head. Aroma is acidic coffee, roasted malts, some booziness, and a bit of chocolate. Bitter chocolate, ridiculous amounts of coffee. Lingering hop bite. Lingering aftertaste. Somewhat smooth still regardless of how fierce it is.

Color negro opaco con espuma beige oscuro. Aromas de café, frutos rojos y bizcocho. En boca es densa con um inicio dulce afrutado que pasa a un amargor acafetado muy muy equilibrado y bien integrado. Espectacular.

50 DKK(880 yen)  from Mikkeller & Friends, 10.9% brewed at Lervig Aktiebryggeri, Norway. A thick viscous brown almost black motor oil of a pour with a dark brown head. A really unique potent coffee aroma with an earthy/woodsy quality to it. Incredibly silky & smooth mouthfeel with a really thick luscious body. Roast coffee flavor, with a burst of sweetness mid-mouth & then a mellow bitter coffee finish. I am not a big coffee guy but this beer is really incredible stuff. A big beer that is easy to drink, well-balanced between sweet & bitter plus it has some uniqueness to it. Excellent stuff, my favorite of the beer geek series by far.

Poured from the bottle. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts. Color is black with a nice tan head. Flavor is strong roasted malts, dark chocolate, and coffee. Mouthfeel is a bit viscous and astringent. This one is pretty good, even with poop coffee.
Slightly dark chocolate scent. Taste of coffee and licorice. Weak taste. Not overly impressive beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

11.2oz bottle, from Party Source. New label. Been looking for this one for a long time, very excited to try it. Pitch black color. Beautiful thin very dark brown head. Leaves nice swaths of dotty lace behind. Awesome big, potent, complex coffee aroma. Roasty, earthy, decadent assertive coffee. Some good dark chocolate. Earthy hop. Very big bitter taste. Little sweetness. Just a light bit of alcohol warmth. Bigger body. Very nice chewy texture. Light carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Awesome imperial stout. Had to force myself to savor it. Every sip was a delicious treat. Makes me want to immediately try the Beer Geek Vanilla Shake sitting in my fridge...

11.2oz bottle. Pours a thick rich black color with a tiny creamy tan head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt and coffee, chocolate, and oats. Taste of dark fruits, toffee, rich espresso, oatmeal, and dark chocolate.
Jag väntade mig lite hype, men här var ingen hype, den här ölen var galet bra. Smaken bar toner av rostade toner, choklad och jord. Balansen är galet finstämd och kroppen är precis som man önskar.

Black pour, thick brown head, nice lacing. Nose is fine coffee, sweet malts, hops, fresh water, chocolate. Taste is gourmet coffee, assertive but not overpowering, sweet chocolate, roasted grains, bitter finish. Mouthfeel is full and smooth, would like a touch less carbonation and a slightly more viscous body. Otherwise pretty phenomenal.

Bottle from Brusin Ales, I think - I had this one yesterday and its gorgeous and smells a nice balanced coffee and oatmeal. That said it tastes balanced, but nothing spectacular. Its very good, dont get me wrong, but Im not getting the hype.

11.2oz bottle. 

A: Thick black body with a slowly disappearing dark mocha head. Has some nice legs.

N: Lots of coffee, char, dark chocolate, and leather. Some licorice and plenty of malt/malted milk balls. Very thick smelling, as though you can grasp the density somehow. 

T: Quite sweet at first - the malted milk comes through against an appropriate coffee bitterness. Then it becomes bitter and smoky. Perhaps a bit too much of the latter, but its still pleasant. 

M: Thick and oily. Oatmeal rounds out the mouthfeel well. Very alcoholic and can be quite sharp. 

O: A coffee jolt thats quite enjoyable. Maybe a touch more malt and lessened alcohol would really let the beauty shine through more clearly.

Dark dark brown/black with small tan head. Smells..rich coffee and dark chocolate scents, roasted oats and sugars. Tastes..big strong quality coffee flavours with a dark choc influence. Roasty on all things. Pretty nice one to finish at mikkeller vesterbro.
Holy cow this beer is insane, the coffee beans have been completely digested by a weasel, and then they make this into a coffee stout, crazy!

Bottle. Black with a 1 finger tan head. Aroma is strong coffee, chocolate and a touch of hops. Taste really showcases the coffee. Chocolate and hops come through on the finish along with some solid booze punch. Great velvety mouthfeel. This one lives up to the hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really excellent, smooth beer. Good from start to finish. On par with the Alesmith Kopi Luwak Speedway Stout. Thanks to CraftShack for stocking this. Have had the Calvados edition before but definitely prefer this one.

Shiny dark black colour, almost radiant beige head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, coffee, mocha, liquorice, roast, figs and dates. Sweet flavour, malts, salty salmiak, roasted malts and light bitter coffee. Quite full body, bordering on gelatinous. Finish coffee, caramel, light alcohol and lingering sweet and bitter tones.
(From 33cL bottle @ home. Keith Shore label, brewed by Lervig. BB 05/04/18. Thanks for bringing the bottle, Benzai!)
Pitch black, small head. Taste and aroma of coffee, chocolate, burnt malts, sweet roasted finish.
12oz bottle pours a thick black color without much head. Coffee aroma and flavor though very balanced mild bitterness.

Pours from a bottle a very dark brown almost black with a slight tan head. The aroma is of bourbon and coffee. The taste is of bitter chocolAte with a strong coffee flavor that resonates on the palate.
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home. Pours pitch black with a tan head. Roasted malt nose. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, dark cherries and licorice. Intense boozy finish.

Drag av askfat i doften och de sedvanliga stout-tonerna. Choklad är ganska tydlig. Kopi luwaken kan jag inte känna. Lite värmande känsla, skulle nästan kunna vara en knivudd chili. Härligt krämig och växer helt klart sedan första klunken. På tåget hem från Köpenhamn.

330 ml bottle with a new label, brewed at Lervig. Deep dark brown body with a small tan head. Smells like coffee and luxury. Very smooth and oily mouthfeel. Rich and decadent taste of coffee and deep roast. The alcohol is lost in this rich mixture of tastes, only its warmth remains. Great, splendid!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fantastic beer. Pours jet black. Sweet coffee aroma. Velvety, luxurious mouthfeel. Taste is strong with chocolate, coffee, and a hint of smoke (or extremely roasted coffee). The alcohol is present, but it blends into the the intense flavors and you forget about it. A complex, stimulating beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Very dark brown color, almost black. Thick, dark brown top, holds nicely. Thick coffee, dark chocolate, mild roast, cocoa powder and some milkyness in aroma. Alcohol is well hidden, but I get usual tickle in my nostrils, so I know its there. Medium roast, coffee, cocoa, grainy flavor. Full bodied. Fantastic beer.

Flaske i gave fra esp0r. Har drukket denne ved mange anledninger tidligere, men det var før jeg begynte å rate. Svart farge, løgnaktig viskositet, brunt skum.lavt karbonert.
Kaffe , mørkbrent malt,nøtter, eik. En veldig god øl med intens kaffesmak. Definitivt en av mine favoritter

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a small creamy dark brown head that leaves great lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark roasty malts, espresso, molasses, cocoa. Flavor is the same, incredibly rich roasty coffee, light sweet, medium bitter. Full body, rich creamy mouthfeel. This is truly one of the best. A beer to be savored and enjoyed. Hard to find a better non-BA impy out there, IMO.

Bottle. Dark as night, pitch black. Aroma is an extremely nice combination of tons of coffee, dark chocolate and actually aome sweetness, probably from the oats. And it lingers for a long, long, long time. Awesome.
The taste is fantastic! The first thing you notice is the crazy long-living coffee bitter aftertaste. I really like this. But yeah, as in the aroma, its mainly dark bitter ecspresso coffee notes and dark dark chocolate. A nice creamy, full mouhfeel by the oats which also bring some sweetness in the beginning - nice! Just like the aroma, the tastes lingers forever! In general, this is a fantastic beer that definitely should be drunk by any coffee/imperial stout lover. Worth the hype! One of my favorites from Mikkeller
Pours dark brown with beige head. Smelle of coffee, licorice, malt and hops. Taste is strong and intense coffee with licorice, aromatic hops and some burned malt. A bit cloying.

Pitch black 
Nose is as expected. Earthy with some acidity 
Very good. Could do wonders in a barrel

11.2 oz bottle..Pour is black with a tan head that fades to splotches. .Nose is chocolate milk, sweetness, caramel, sweet coffee, amazing flow and balance of aromas......Taste is fudge, nice sweet coffee,vanilla,roast, chocolate powder, very smooth..Alcohol is very well hidden..

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Pours pitch black with a short, creamy khaki head. Big coffee, vanilla, chocolate and cereal aroma, smells incredibly rich. Taste is so smooth yet chewy, loads of chocolate, coffee, oatmeal sweetness and a resins hop aftertaste. Nice lingering bitterness, great stout.

Black color, mocca head. Aroma of nuts, whiskey, really good quality coffee, dark chocolate. Taste is coffee bitter with light sweetness. Amazing balance. Medium body, creamy texture, soft to flat carbonation. Really amazing brew

Bottle into a goblet. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Taste is big and chocolatey. Very dark but smooth espresso, vanilla, toffee. Smooth, lightly bitter. I prefer regular Beer Geek i think. But this is a nice variation.

beige coffee head disappears with some slight lacing. coffee colour. viscous pour. aroma is boozy, coffee and hop. taste is boozy, sweet with a bitter coffee aftertaste. quite round dense mouthfeel, dense body and soft carbonation.  bottle 33 cl
Overall: Chocalate, coffee, dark powers, dark tastes.Note: Bottle at Villevalla pub. Reviewed 2013-07-06.

A very dark, black coloured beer with a light brown head that lacing for a long time. The aroma is very complex, of course. Notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, smoke, wood, dried dark fruits, nuts and even alcohol. The taste is absolutely bitter, Its like a dark bitter chocolate in a cup of coffee. Texture is oily, and the beer has a very soft, smooth carbonation. The aftertaste is bitter and very long. Good beer, (no) shit!
Aroma of bitter coffee, roast chocolate cake. Pours black with brown film everywhere. Taste is bitter and roasty with chocolate cake, coffee and roast wood. This suffered from not being fresh.

In the smell there are raisons, caramel, alcohol and coffee. The foam is dark brown, but not thick and does'nt stay long. The beer is low carbonated, and is drinks like oil. The taste is straight forward roasted malts and roasted coffee. Which continous in the aftertaste. A very good imperial stout, but with suprices in the flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

csakajosor.hu, Budapest.
 Igazán fekete színe van, habja tisztességes méretű, világosbarna és közepesen kitartó. Illata kávélikőrös, csokis, szilvalekváros, fás és gyógyfüves. Íze rendkívül selymes, kávés, fekete csokis, likőrös, zabkekszes, fás és kissé gyógyfüves, vaníliás, keserédes. Sűrű, olajos teste van és közepesen van tele apró buborékokkal. Utóíze keserédes, sima és száraz. Ritka kiegyensúlyozott imperial stout, ami hiába erős, akkor is nagyon itatja magát. Ja, hogy cibetmacska kakából szedték a hozzávaló kávét? Le van szarva, akkor is nagyszerű!

Bottle - 330ml. Perfectly opaque black body with a decent brown foamy head. Rich, complex malty/hoppy aroma with roasted coffee, chocolate, and woody hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its perfectly balanced, robust taste carries roasted coffee, woody, vanilla, and chocolate notes. Ends with a long, warming bittersweet finish. Extraordinary!

Bottle from drink shop, tallinn. Pitch black color, small brown head. Aroma is strong coffee, licorice, roasty, cream. Smooth creamy taste, coffee, hops and coffee at the end. Alcohol well hidden. Almost perfect coffee stout.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Best looking beer I have ever seen - like a choc milkshake with a massive thick foam. Aroma is mild - bit of yeast character and malt. Taste is big mouthfeel, medium carbonation;strong chocolate bitterness off coffee, rich malt brings a extra astringency. Palate is bitterness, which is great, but I would love a touch more sweetness. Overall though, a great imperial stout.

Black colour with a nice chocolate-milk-coloured head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roasted malt, orange citrus hops. Taste is sweet at first with a long bitter finsih. Full bodied beer with a smooth texture. Very, very good beer.

had this bottle, sitting in my kitchen for some time now. purchased this winter @ chez moeder lambiek ( brussels ). they had 3 bottles left in total ( both bars) . i believe its the first batch, but the date wasnt stamped on right . so, 50 cl bottle at home, on ym own 

pours black, nice brown foam ! smell is very bitter

OMG

nice, thick, buttery, bitter, kopi luwak ( realy, i dont drink coffee but i NEED to drink that one day ! ) , chocolate in the aftertaste, perfect carbo, whats to say ? 
the smell is pretty good
the taste is better

the late taste is damn , damn good ! 


edit ( at the end of the bottle ) it hasd the same shit the first batch of this beer , bourbon BA edition had. that is something like... clay ? rubber??? on the bottom of the bottle. yuck ! 

also the taste is a bit ( very little ) off. almost a sour hint ( if you seek for it) . might be cause of the light in my kitchen though. i WILL buy the new batch and rerate in time ;)

Clear black with medium to thin brown head.
Aroma.. Intense coffee, deep roasted malts, dark chocolate, cocoa, bit hops
Quite sweet with decent bitter finish. Smooth
Enjoyable nice quality brew. Very well balanced and complex

very dark, almost black colour, dark brown, medium dense foamy head, which lefts back a beautiful brown layer; aroma of chocolate, roasted coffee and malt and hints of alcohol; regarding the taste: great harmony of sweet maltyness, chocolate, roasted coffee, and a bit syrup like sweetness with fress hoppy notes and hints of alcoholic warmth; oily texture - this is definitely the best stout Ive ever tasted...it is even better than the Speedway from AleSmith. drinking this, Im extremely close to fall in love with stouts :-)

33cl bottle from Mikkeller & Friends (brewed at Lervig). Motor oil black pour with thick bubbly mocha head - loads of lacing. Looks decadent. Lots of coffee in the aroma - very green, pungent coffee though - ripe dark fruit, really dark chocolate, heavy roastedness, light vanilla. Taste explodes with dark chocolate, that same intense green coffee note (cant put my finger on it, obviously thats weasel shit coffee for you), deep roasted notes, some vanilla, spruce, some dark berry. Full mouthfeel - silky and viscous. Big, big flavours going on here - all so well balanced (except for that crazy green coffee note which sticks out). No hint of the booze at all. Lingering coffee, chocolate, and light licorice notes. A great brew, incredibly interesting with the coffee character - dont age it, drink it ASAP and check it out.

Color black, was unable to pour a top. Taste of roast, tar, rubber, chocolate, all the black bits and the sweet side of the coffee soon takes hold. The skunky coffee-feel overpoweres toward the very last mouthfuls and the idea of its origin becomes clear. Still a pleasant experience and worth another bottle.

330 ml bottle with a new label, brewed at Lervig. Deep dark brown body with a small tan head. Smells like coffee and luxury. Very smooth and oily mouthfeel. Rich and decadent taste of coffee and deep roast. The alcohol is lost in this rich mixture of tastes, only its warmth remains. Great, splendid!
330 ml bottle. Pours pitch black with lively head.  very thick and full bodied stout,  roasted coffee and chocolate. very balanced and not overly sweet.

Lervig version. Very oat-y aroma, some coffee and chocolate. Huge malt present. Maybe some tiny hints of maple? Black, brown head, looks beautiful as the style should. Full bodied, there is lots and lots of roast and bitterness in the finish. Extreme oats again. Very good imperial stout, maybe a tad young, could use a bit more sweetness to balance the bitter finish. Very good imperial stout by the coolest man alive.

Pours pitch black, very small tan head, looks like coffee. Huge coffee aroma, dark chocolate and cacao, some sweet malt notes, some cereal. Amazing flavour, again huge coffee notes, thick bodied and medium carbonated. Does not have a lot of malt presence, the coffee really covers everything else up, but its good.

A beautiful beer that lives up to the hype. Very dark with a tight tan head. Silky smooth with balanced dark malt, hop and coffee flavours. A truly stunning beer that shows what Mikkel is all about. Perfect!
Bottle from Mikkeller Shop; dark brown almost black pour with dark tan head, roast coffee and chocolate aroma, quality coffee taste with some chocolate and vanilla the mouthfeel is amazing.

Very dark brown, almost black, small dark brown head. Nose is dark chocolate, warm roasty-malty notes, vanilla. Taste has tons of  slightly sour coffee, vanilla, roasty malts, smooth bitter-roasty-hoppy dry finish. Full bodied, flat carbonation, smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle. Color black with big brown head. Aroma coffee, chocolate, roasted, hop, citrus. Taste sweet, bitter, bitter chocolate, hop, citrus, coffee.
Coffe, smoke, chocolate malts and cherry. Pitch black with tiny brown head. Sweet, some burnt sourness. Medium thick, little carbonation.

Bottle. Pours black with some tan head. Tons of chocolate on the nose with coffee and a little roasted malts punching through. Flavor matches the aroma but the best part is the mouthfeel. Super smooth, easy to drink and I would have never guessed it was almost 11% abv. Incredibly well done.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 May 2011, 0,5l bottle (batch #470) sampled @ first ever BBGTC tasting:
Fyldig sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, mørk frukt, mørk sjokolade, brent kaffi, mørkt sukker. Fyldig sødmerik smak med preg av mørkbrent malt, humle, kaffi, salt lakris og mørk sjokolade. Middels bitterhet som set godt. Veldig god.
Pure magic! A beautiful beer with wonderful coffee aroma and an imperial stout taste of dark bread loaf, chocolate and dark coffee. Full-bodied and creamy. The best beer in the world!

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen.  Poured a deep mahogany with a broken tan head. The aroma is big coffee and liqourice. The flavour is oily, medium bitter, with liqourice and dark chocolate. A super beer to drink in smaller quantities!

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 New small bottles (33cl), bought at Geers Oostakker. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: pitch black beer, nice stable mocha head.
Nose: very nice and complex nose, lots of coffee, but a very good coffee in this case! subtle presence of sugar, quite some alcohol, but for me this was like sniffing a very good coffee! Amazing.
Taste: lots of alcohol, very strong coffee taste, some sugar, somewhat mocha finish.
Never had the regular Civet Coffee, but after drinking this beer, Ill try to find me a cup!
On tap. Black with a dense tan head. Nose is powerful, coffee, wood, red fruit, alcohol and toasted notes. Taste is very sweet, smooth, roasted, fresh coffee with a long nice finish.
On tap at Mikkeller. Black colour with dense beige head. Coffee and roasted malts aroma. Coffee, roasted taste, with biterness and dark chocolate. Full body. excellent beer.

A worthy finish after returning home from CBC 2013. Pours black with two fingers of thick, creamy tan head. Looks gorgeous. Nose is tons of coffee with some chocolate malt, melasses and maybe hints of vanilla. Taste is initial cream and vanilla sweet before a huge coffee bitterness takes over. Finish is beyond lingering, it lasts forever and is rich with coffee and dark chocolate. Body is rich and creamy with low carbonation. Need to go back and buy more...

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar.  Lervig version.  Viscous black pour.  Smell - lots of coffee and something else a bit musty - perhaps originating from the rectum of a weasel.  The mouthfeel of the beer is really great - it doesnt foam up in the mouth like most stouts - just stays oily and rich.  The flavour is big coffee and big smoke.  The flavour doesnt set it apart from other stouts, but the mouthfeel and smell do.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2014 This beer is one of the best I tried. Black as motoroil, dark brown foam, low carbonation. Very complex beer. Notes of chocolate, coffee beans, dark fruit, vanille, ... Very balanced between sweet and bitter. This beer is just perfect.
bottle from mikkeller and friends. Dark stout with gentle malt and slight hop taste, followed by an intense taste of roasted Coffee-beans and oat. Really amazing stuff.

Lervig edition. Tasting at cardinal. Very black with small beige head. Rich aroma of coffee and licorice. Sweet and full bodied, honey rounds of a solid body, coffee is ever present. Sweetness reaches a level where it starts to clash with bitterness, but chocolate softens it.

(on tap @ Mikkeller Bar Victoriagade) Pours black with a medium, tan head. Good regeneration. Aroma is sublime, smooth coffee and a bit of roasted malt. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, full body and a roasted coffee finish. Flavour is really coffee dominated in a very well integrated and smooth way. Not as much sweetness as you sometimes get with coffee stouts like To Øl Goliath for example.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 [Tap @ Mikkeller] Kolsvart med brunt skum. Aroma av cappoccino, söt kaffe smak. En hint av alkoholen träder också fram.

Tasted 13/04/2013, from the bottle.
Pours oily black, totally opaque, with just a tiny head. Leaves sticky lacing on the glass.
Aroma is gorgeous, just amazingly intense and complex - coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, slight tartness, even ashy/woody tones present.
Taste is coherent with aroma, but just stretched in time - at first comes coffee, then its tart overtone, then dark&sweet chocolate, then ashy&woody, then roasty and finally bitterness of roasted barley, which last quite long.
Recommended+

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 vintage on draft at 4:20. Pours dark and black with a dense thin foamy head. The nose is intense coffee, wood, cherry, booze, marshmallows and some toasted nuts. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. The texture is smooth as silk, creamy, heavy body and a huge finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very european malty stout.  Touch of burnt coffee and sweetness.  A little flat.  Tasty but overrated.

Smells like break fast, coffee, roast malts, and wood. Appears dark brown with small tan head. Taste is complex and balanced. Roasted malts, warm wood and slight alcohol. Other taste makes this complex. Toasty after taste. great stuff, but $14 for a 8.5oz bottle is still expensive.

25/03/2013 on tap @Brasserie 4:20 (2009). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma pressoché assente. Al naso botta di alcol micidiale, gli 11 gradi si sentono tutti e anche di più, note ossidate, cioccolato e caffè, un po sgraziata. In bocca è potente, cioccolato allinizio, poi caffè, ossidata, quasi piatta. Corpo pieno, leggermente inferiore alle attese, carbonazione molto soft. Un po sgraziata, ma non male, sicuramente sopravvalutata.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle thanks to nightfall. Pours a viscous oily black with a light khaki colored head. Aroma is hefty roast and char over top of a mellowed out coffee and vanilla. Taste is more coffee and char. I dont know what charcoal tastes like, but I want to say its similar to this. The coffee is pretty strong in this. Thick mouthfeel and overall really good. Nice beer.

500 ml. bottle.  Pours black with just a bit of a tan head.  Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, and chocolate.  Taste is dark coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruits, licorice, and a bit of alcohol.  Very, very good!!
Always been a big fan of Mikkellers work, and this is for sure probably his best brew to date if you ask me...

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a really thick black with beigey head. Huge aroma of coffee! Along with some sweetness maybe vanilla or chocolate. Taste is oh so creamy with espresso and vanilla sweetness that hung around on your palate forever. Great beer.
Bottled. Aroma of burned rubber, dark chocolate, coffee. Unfortunately the alcohol is not hidden, way too aggressive for me.

Bottle (notes from tasting session. Aromas are so complex: chocolate, wood, mold-aged stuff, coffee, grass, and intense coffee. Initial is smooth sweet chocolate backed up with a hit of charcoal ash. Mid palate adds more chocolate and burnt to a crisp coffee grounds. Final is like a rich, thick Devils Food cake. Opulent, with a rich aftertaste,  So full bodied. One of the very best imperial stouts.

Rich in every aspect, this is close to perfection! [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this RIGHT after the beer geek breakfast. Of course it has the same great mouthfeel and slightly sweet maltiness, but the aroma is the most noticable improvement and Im very impressed with depth the civet poop adds ti the overall character. A VERY good beer. One of the best Ive had in a while.

Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; black with thin beige lacing. Smells solid; dark malt, chocolate, and roast with light hop notes. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Good, not great.

Bottle. Pours cloudy nearly black with airy tan head. Dark, complex aroma of malt, roasted coffee, caramel and liquorice. Bitter, profound taste of roasted coffee and liquorice. Heavy malty notes. Uhm....oh... feels like an A-bomb when Im ready to depart... Killing me softly with this stout... MORE!

Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Nice light coffee aroma with some nice milk chocolate and some light vanilla notes. A bit of an oak character as well. 
Pours a nice deep black with a thick dark mocha head with decent retention. Some moderate lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is milk chocolate and coffee. The finishing flavor is coffee and vanilla. A light oak character. Astringency is medium low. No hop flavor and low hop bitterness. A bit of a vegetative note and some oxidation present. 
Mouthfeel is full bodied and almost chunky with low carbonation. Low to medium low astringency and medium alcohol warmth.
